module_ra_rrtmg_sw.F
Go to the documentation of this file.
1!!MODULE module_ra_rrtmg_sw
2
3 module parrrsw
4
5 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
6
7! implicit none
8 save
9
10#ifdef SINGLE_PRECISION
11#define RWORDSIZE 4
12#define IWORDSIZE 4
13#else
14#define RWORDSIZE 8
15#define IWORDSIZE 4
16#endif
17
18!------------------------------------------------------------------
19! rrtmg_sw main parameters
20!
21! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, jul1998
22! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jun2006
23! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
24!------------------------------------------------------------------
25
26! name type purpose
27! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
28! mxlay : integer: maximum number of layers
29! mg : integer: number of original g-intervals per spectral band
30! nbndsw : integer: number of spectral bands
31! naerec : integer: number of aerosols (iaer=6, ecmwf aerosol option)
32! ngptsw : integer: total number of reduced g-intervals for rrtmg_lw
33! ngNN : integer: number of reduced g-intervals per spectral band
34! ngsNN : integer: cumulative number of g-intervals per band
35!------------------------------------------------------------------
36
37 integer(kind=im), parameter :: mxlay = 203 !jplay, klev
38 integer(kind=im), parameter :: mg = 16 !jpg
39 integer(kind=im), parameter :: nbndsw = 14 !jpsw, ksw
40 integer(kind=im), parameter :: naerec = 6 !jpaer
41 integer(kind=im), parameter :: mxmol = 38
42 integer(kind=im), parameter :: nstr = 2
43 integer(kind=im), parameter :: nmol = 7
44! Use for 112 g-point model
45 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngptsw = 112 !jpgpt
46! Use for 224 g-point model
47! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngptsw = 224 !jpgpt
48
49! may need to rename these - from v2.6
50 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jpband = 29
51 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jpb1 = 16 !istart
52 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jpb2 = 29 !iend
53
54 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jmcmu = 32
55 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jmumu = 32
56 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jmphi = 3
57 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jmxang = 4
58 integer(kind=im), parameter :: jmxstr = 16
59
60! Use for 112 g-point model
61 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng16 = 6
62 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng17 = 12
63 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng18 = 8
64 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng19 = 8
65 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng20 = 10
66 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng21 = 10
67 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng22 = 2
68 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng23 = 10
69 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng24 = 8
70 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng25 = 6
71 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng26 = 6
72 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng27 = 8
73 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng28 = 6
74 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng29 = 12
75
76 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs16 = 6
77 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs17 = 18
78 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs18 = 26
79 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs19 = 34
80 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs20 = 44
81 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs21 = 54
82 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs22 = 56
83 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs23 = 66
84 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs24 = 74
85 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs25 = 80
86 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs26 = 86
87 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs27 = 94
88 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs28 = 100
89 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs29 = 112
90
91! Use for 224 g-point model
92! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng16 = 16
93! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng17 = 16
94! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng18 = 16
95! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng19 = 16
96! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng20 = 16
97! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng21 = 16
98! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng22 = 16
99! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng23 = 16
100! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng24 = 16
101! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng25 = 16
102! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng26 = 16
103! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng27 = 16
104! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng28 = 16
105! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ng29 = 16
106
107! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs16 = 16
108! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs17 = 32
109! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs18 = 48
110! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs19 = 64
111! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs20 = 80
112! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs21 = 96
113! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs22 = 112
114! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs23 = 128
115! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs24 = 144
116! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs25 = 160
117! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs26 = 176
118! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs27 = 192
119! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs28 = 208
120! integer(kind=im), parameter :: ngs29 = 224
121
122! Source function solar constant
123 real(kind=rb), parameter :: rrsw_scon = 1.36822e+03 ! W/m2
124
125 end module parrrsw
126
127 module rrsw_aer
128
129 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
130 use parrrsw, only : nbndsw, naerec
131
132! implicit none
133 save
134
135!------------------------------------------------------------------
136! rrtmg_sw aerosol optical properties
137!
138! Data derived from six ECMWF aerosol types and defined for
139! the rrtmg_sw spectral intervals
140!
141! Initial: J.-J. Morcrette, ECMWF, mar2003
142! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
143! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
144!------------------------------------------------------------------
145!
146!-- The six ECMWF aerosol types are respectively:
147!
148! 1/ continental average 2/ maritime
149! 3/ desert 4/ urban
150! 5/ volcanic active 6/ stratospheric background
151!
152! computed from Hess and Koepke (con, mar, des, urb)
153! from Bonnel et al. (vol, str)
154!
155! rrtmg_sw 14 spectral intervals (microns):
156! 3.846 - 3.077
157! 3.077 - 2.500
158! 2.500 - 2.150
159! 2.150 - 1.942
160! 1.942 - 1.626
161! 1.626 - 1.299
162! 1.299 - 1.242
163! 1.242 - 0.7782
164! 0.7782- 0.6250
165! 0.6250- 0.4415
166! 0.4415- 0.3448
167! 0.3448- 0.2632
168! 0.2632- 0.2000
169! 12.195 - 3.846
170!
171!------------------------------------------------------------------
172!
173! name type purpose
174! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
175! rsrtaua : real : ratio of average optical thickness in
176! spectral band to that at 0.55 micron
177! rsrpiza : real : average single scattering albedo (unitless)
178! rsrasya : real : average asymmetry parameter (unitless)
179!------------------------------------------------------------------
180
181 real(kind=rb) :: rsrtaua(nbndsw,naerec)
182 real(kind=rb) :: rsrpiza(nbndsw,naerec)
183 real(kind=rb) :: rsrasya(nbndsw,naerec)
184
185 end module rrsw_aer
186
187 module rrsw_cld
188
189 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
190
191! implicit none
192 save
193
194!------------------------------------------------------------------
195! rrtmg_sw cloud property coefficients
196!
197! Initial: J.-J. Morcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
198! Revised: J. Delamere/MJIacono, AER, aug2005
199! Revised: MJIacono, AER, nov2005
200! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
201! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
202!------------------------------------------------------------------
203!
204! name type purpose
205! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
206! xxxliq1 : real : optical properties (extinction coefficient, single
207! scattering albedo, assymetry factor) from
208! Hu & Stamnes, j. clim., 6, 728-742, 1993.
209! xxxice2 : real : optical properties (extinction coefficient, single
210! scattering albedo, assymetry factor) from streamer v3.0,
211! Key, streamer user's guide, cooperative institude
212! for meteorological studies, 95 pp., 2001.
213! xxxice3 : real : optical properties (extinction coefficient, single
214! scattering albedo, assymetry factor) from
215! Fu, j. clim., 9, 1996.
216! xbari : real : optical property coefficients for five spectral
217! intervals (2857-4000, 4000-5263, 5263-7692, 7692-14285,
218! and 14285-40000 wavenumbers) following
219! Ebert and Curry, jgr, 97, 3831-3836, 1992.
220!------------------------------------------------------------------
221
222 real(kind=rb) :: extliq1(58,16:29), ssaliq1(58,16:29), asyliq1(58,16:29)
223 real(kind=rb) :: extice2(43,16:29), ssaice2(43,16:29), asyice2(43,16:29)
224 real(kind=rb) :: extice3(46,16:29), ssaice3(46,16:29), asyice3(46,16:29)
225 real(kind=rb) :: fdlice3(46,16:29)
226 real(kind=rb) :: abari(5),bbari(5),cbari(5),dbari(5),ebari(5),fbari(5)
227
228 end module rrsw_cld
229
230 module rrsw_con
231
232 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
233
234! implicit none
235 save
236
237!------------------------------------------------------------------
238! rrtmg_sw constants
239
240! Initial version: MJIacono, AER, jun2006
241! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
242!------------------------------------------------------------------
243
244! name type purpose
245! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
246! fluxfac: real : radiance to flux conversion factor
247! heatfac: real : flux to heating rate conversion factor
248!oneminus: real : 1.-1.e-6
249! pi : real : pi
250! grav : real : acceleration of gravity
251! planck : real : planck constant
252! boltz : real : boltzmann constant
253! clight : real : speed of light
254! avogad : real : avogadro constant
255! alosmt : real : loschmidt constant
256! gascon : real : molar gas constant
257! radcn1 : real : first radiation constant
258! radcn2 : real : second radiation constant
259! sbcnst : real : stefan-boltzmann constant
260! secdy : real : seconds per day
261!------------------------------------------------------------------
262
263 real(kind=rb) :: fluxfac, heatfac
264 real(kind=rb) :: oneminus, pi, grav
265 real(kind=rb) :: planck, boltz, clight
266 real(kind=rb) :: avogad, alosmt, gascon
267 real(kind=rb) :: radcn1, radcn2
268 real(kind=rb) :: sbcnst, secdy
269
270 end module rrsw_con
271
272 module rrsw_kg16
273
274 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
275 use parrrsw, only : ng16
276
277! implicit none
278 save
279
280!-----------------------------------------------------------------
281! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 16
282! band 16: 2600-3250 cm-1 (low - h2o,ch4; high - ch4)
283!
284! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
285! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
286! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
287!-----------------------------------------------------------------
288!
289! name type purpose
290! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
291! kao : real
292! kbo : real
293! selfrefo: real
294! forrefo : real
295!sfluxrefo: real
296!-----------------------------------------------------------------
297
298 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no16 = 16
299
300 real(kind=rb) :: kao(9,5,13,no16)
301 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,13:59,no16)
302 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no16), forrefo(3,no16)
303 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no16)
304
305 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
306 real(kind=rb) :: rayl, strrat1
307
308!-----------------------------------------------------------------
309! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 16
310! band 16: 2600-3250 cm-1 (low - h2o,ch4; high - ch4)
311!
312! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
313! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
314! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
315!-----------------------------------------------------------------
316!
317! name type purpose
318! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
319! ka : real
320! kb : real
321! absa : real
322! absb : real
323! selfref : real
324! forref : real
325! sfluxref: real
326!-----------------------------------------------------------------
327
328 real(kind=rb) :: ka(9,5,13,ng16) , absa(585,ng16)
329 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,13:59,ng16), absb(235,ng16)
330 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng16), forref(3,ng16)
331 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng16)
332
333 equivalence(ka(1,1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,13,1),absb(1,1))
334
335 end module rrsw_kg16
336
337 module rrsw_kg17
338
339 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
340 use parrrsw, only : ng17
341
342! implicit none
343 save
344
345!-----------------------------------------------------------------
346! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 17
347! band 17: 3250-4000 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - h2o,co2)
348!
349! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
350! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
351! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
352!-----------------------------------------------------------------
353!
354! name type purpose
355! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
356! kao : real
357! kbo : real
358! selfrefo: real
359! forrefo : real
360!sfluxrefo: real
361!-----------------------------------------------------------------
362
363 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no17 = 16
364
365 real(kind=rb) :: kao(9,5,13,no17)
366 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,5,13:59,no17)
367 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no17), forrefo(4,no17)
368 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no17,5)
369
370 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
371 real(kind=rb) :: rayl, strrat
372
373!-----------------------------------------------------------------
374! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 17
375! band 17: 3250-4000 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - h2o,co2)
376!
377! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
378! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
379! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
380!-----------------------------------------------------------------
381!
382! name type purpose
383! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
384! ka : real
385! kb : real
386! absa : real
387! absb : real
388! selfref : real
389! forref : real
390! sfluxref: real
391!-----------------------------------------------------------------
392
393 real(kind=rb) :: ka(9,5,13,ng17) , absa(585,ng17)
394 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,5,13:59,ng17), absb(1175,ng17)
395 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng17), forref(4,ng17)
396 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng17,5)
397
398 equivalence(ka(1,1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,1,13,1),absb(1,1))
399
400 end module rrsw_kg17
401
402 module rrsw_kg18
403
404 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
405 use parrrsw, only : ng18
406
407! implicit none
408 save
409
410!-----------------------------------------------------------------
411! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 18
412! band 18: 4000-4650 cm-1 (low - h2o,ch4; high - ch4)
413!
414! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
415! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
416! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
417!-----------------------------------------------------------------
418!
419! name type purpose
420! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
421! kao : real
422! kbo : real
423! selfrefo: real
424! forrefo : real
425!sfluxrefo: real
426!-----------------------------------------------------------------
427
428 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no18 = 16
429
430 real(kind=rb) :: kao(9,5,13,no18)
431 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,13:59,no18)
432 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no18), forrefo(3,no18)
433 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no18,9)
434
435 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
436 real(kind=rb) :: rayl, strrat
437
438!-----------------------------------------------------------------
439! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 18
440! band 18: 4000-4650 cm-1 (low - h2o,ch4; high - ch4)
441!
442! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
443! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
444! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
445!-----------------------------------------------------------------
446!
447! name type purpose
448! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
449! ka : real
450! kb : real
451! absa : real
452! absb : real
453! selfref : real
454! forref : real
455! sfluxref: real
456!-----------------------------------------------------------------
457
458 real(kind=rb) :: ka(9,5,13,ng18), absa(585,ng18)
459 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,13:59,ng18), absb(235,ng18)
460 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng18), forref(3,ng18)
461 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng18,9)
462
463 equivalence(ka(1,1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,13,1),absb(1,1))
464
465 end module rrsw_kg18

467 module rrsw_kg19
468
469 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
470 use parrrsw, only : ng19
471
472! implicit none
473 save
474
475!-----------------------------------------------------------------
476! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 19
477! band 19: 4650-5150 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - co2)
478!
479! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
480! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
481! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
482!-----------------------------------------------------------------
483!
484! name type purpose
485! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
486! kao : real
487! kbo : real
488! selfrefo: real
489! forrefo : real
490!sfluxrefo: real
491!-----------------------------------------------------------------
492
493 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no19 = 16
494
495 real(kind=rb) :: kao(9,5,13,no19)
496 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,13:59,no19)
497 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no19), forrefo(3,no19)
498 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no19,9)
499
500 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
501 real(kind=rb) :: rayl, strrat
502
503!-----------------------------------------------------------------
504! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 19
505! band 19: 4650-5150 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - co2)
506!
507! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
508! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
509! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
510!-----------------------------------------------------------------
511!
512! name type purpose
513! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
514! ka : real
515! kb : real
516! absa : real
517! absb : real
518! selfref : real
519! forref : real
520! sfluxref: real
521!-----------------------------------------------------------------
522
523 real(kind=rb) :: ka(9,5,13,ng19), absa(585,ng19)
524 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,13:59,ng19), absb(235,ng19)
525 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng19), forref(3,ng19)
526 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng19,9)
527
528 equivalence(ka(1,1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,13,1),absb(1,1))
529
530 end module rrsw_kg19

532 module rrsw_kg20
533
534 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
535 use parrrsw, only : ng20
536
537! implicit none
538 save
539
540!-----------------------------------------------------------------
541! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 20
542! band 20: 5150-6150 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - h2o)
543!
544! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
545! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
546! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
547!-----------------------------------------------------------------
548!
549! name type purpose
550! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
551! kao : real
552! kbo : real
553! selfrefo: real
554! forrefo : real
555!sfluxrefo: real
556! absch4o : real
557!-----------------------------------------------------------------
558
559 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no20 = 16
560
561 real(kind=rb) :: kao(5,13,no20)
562 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,13:59,no20)
563 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no20), forrefo(4,no20)
564 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no20)
565 real(kind=rb) :: absch4o(no20)
566
567 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
568 real(kind=rb) :: rayl
569
570!-----------------------------------------------------------------
571! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 20
572! band 20: 5150-6150 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - h2o)
573!
574! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
575! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
576! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
577!-----------------------------------------------------------------
578!
579! name type purpose
580! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
581! ka : real
582! kb : real
583! absa : real
584! absb : real
585! selfref : real
586! forref : real
587! sfluxref: real
588! absch4 : real
589!-----------------------------------------------------------------
590
591 real(kind=rb) :: ka(5,13,ng20), absa(65,ng20)
592 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,13:59,ng20), absb(235,ng20)
593 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng20), forref(4,ng20)
594 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng20)
595 real(kind=rb) :: absch4(ng20)
596
597 equivalence(ka(1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,13,1),absb(1,1))
598
599 end module rrsw_kg20
600
601 module rrsw_kg21
602
603 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
604 use parrrsw, only : ng21
605
606! implicit none
607 save
608
609!-----------------------------------------------------------------
610! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 21
611! band 21: 6150-7700 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - h2o,co2)
612!
613! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
614! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
615! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
616!-----------------------------------------------------------------
617!
618! name type purpose
619! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
620! kao : real
621! kbo : real
622! selfrefo: real
623! forrefo : real
624!sfluxrefo: real
625!-----------------------------------------------------------------
626
627 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no21 = 16
628
629 real(kind=rb) :: kao(9,5,13,no21)
630 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,5,13:59,no21)
631 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no21), forrefo(4,no21)
632 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no21,9)
633
634 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
635 real(kind=rb) :: rayl, strrat
636
637!-----------------------------------------------------------------
638! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 21
639! band 21: 6150-7700 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - h2o,co2)
640!
641! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
642! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
643! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
644!-----------------------------------------------------------------
645!
646! name type purpose
647! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
648! ka : real
649! kb : real
650! absa : real
651! absb : real
652! selfref : real
653! forref : real
654! sfluxref: real
655!-----------------------------------------------------------------
656
657 real(kind=rb) :: ka(9,5,13,ng21), absa(585,ng21)
658 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,5,13:59,ng21), absb(1175,ng21)
659 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng21), forref(4,ng21)
660 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng21,9)
661
662 equivalence(ka(1,1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,1,13,1),absb(1,1))
663
664 end module rrsw_kg21

666 module rrsw_kg22
667
668 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
669 use parrrsw, only : ng22
670
671! implicit none
672 save
673
674!-----------------------------------------------------------------
675! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 22
676! band 22: 7700-8050 cm-1 (low - h2o,o2; high - o2)
677!
678! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
679! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
680! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
681!-----------------------------------------------------------------
682!
683! name type purpose
684! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
685! kao : real
686! kbo : real
687! selfrefo: real
688! forrefo : real
689!sfluxrefo: real
690!-----------------------------------------------------------------
691
692 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no22 = 16
693
694 real(kind=rb) :: kao(9,5,13,no22)
695 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,13:59,no22)
696 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no22), forrefo(3,no22)
697 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no22,9)
698
699 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
700 real(kind=rb) :: rayl, strrat
701
702!-----------------------------------------------------------------
703! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 22
704! band 22: 7700-8050 cm-1 (low - h2o,o2; high - o2)
705!
706! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
707! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
708! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
709!-----------------------------------------------------------------
710!
711! name type purpose
712! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
713! ka : real
714! kb : real
715! absa : real
716! absb : real
717! selfref : real
718! forref : real
719! sfluxref: real
720!-----------------------------------------------------------------
721
722 real(kind=rb) :: ka(9,5,13,ng22), absa(585,ng22)
723 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,13:59,ng22), absb(235,ng22)
724 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng22), forref(3,ng22)
725 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng22,9)
726
727 equivalence(ka(1,1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,13,1),absb(1,1))
728
729 end module rrsw_kg22
730
731 module rrsw_kg23
732
733 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
734 use parrrsw, only : ng23
735
736! implicit none
737 save
738
739!-----------------------------------------------------------------
740! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 23
741! band 23: 8050-12850 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - nothing)
742!
743! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
744! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
745! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
746!-----------------------------------------------------------------
747!
748! name type purpose
749! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
750! kao : real
751! kbo : real
752! selfrefo: real
753! forrefo : real
754!sfluxrefo: real
755!-----------------------------------------------------------------
756
757 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no23 = 16
758
759 real(kind=rb) :: kao(5,13,no23)
760 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no23), forrefo(3,no23)
761 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no23)
762 real(kind=rb) :: raylo(no23)
763
764 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
765 real(kind=rb) :: givfac
766
767!-----------------------------------------------------------------
768! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 23
769! band 23: 8050-12850 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - nothing)
770!
771! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
772! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
773! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
774!-----------------------------------------------------------------
775!
776! name type purpose
777! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
778! ka : real
779! kb : real
780! absa : real
781! absb : real
782! selfref : real
783! forref : real
784! sfluxref: real
785!-----------------------------------------------------------------
786
787 real(kind=rb) :: ka(5,13,ng23), absa(65,ng23)
788 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng23), forref(3,ng23)

792
793 end module rrsw_kg23

795 module rrsw_kg24
796
797 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
798 use parrrsw, only : ng24
799
800! implicit none
801 save
802
803!-----------------------------------------------------------------
804! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 24
805! band 24: 12850-16000 cm-1 (low - h2o,o2; high - o2)
806!
807! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
808! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
809! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
810!-----------------------------------------------------------------
811!
812! name type purpose
813! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
814! kao : real
815! kbo : real
816! selfrefo: real
817! forrefo : real
818!sfluxrefo: real
819! abso3ao : real
820! abso3bo : real
821! raylao : real
822! raylbo : real
823!-----------------------------------------------------------------
824
825 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no24 = 16
826
827 real(kind=rb) :: kao(9,5,13,no24)
828 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,13:59,no24)
829 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no24), forrefo(3,no24)
830 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no24,9)
831 real(kind=rb) :: abso3ao(no24), abso3bo(no24)
832 real(kind=rb) :: raylao(no24,9), raylbo(no24)
833
834 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
835 real(kind=rb) :: strrat
836
837!-----------------------------------------------------------------
838! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 24
839! band 24: 12850-16000 cm-1 (low - h2o,o2; high - o2)
840!
841! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
842! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
843! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
844!-----------------------------------------------------------------
845!
846! name type purpose
847! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
848! ka : real
849! kb : real
850! absa : real
851! absb : real
852! selfref : real
853! forref : real
854! sfluxref: real
855! abso3a : real
856! abso3b : real
857! rayla : real
858! raylb : real
859!-----------------------------------------------------------------
860
861 real(kind=rb) :: ka(9,5,13,ng24), absa(585,ng24)
862 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,13:59,ng24), absb(235,ng24)
863 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng24), forref(3,ng24)
864 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxref(ng24,9)
865 real(kind=rb) :: abso3a(ng24), abso3b(ng24)
866 real(kind=rb) :: rayla(ng24,9), raylb(ng24)
867
868 equivalence(ka(1,1,1,1),absa(1,1)), (kb(1,13,1),absb(1,1))
869
870 end module rrsw_kg24

1103 module rrsw_kg29
1104
1105 use parkind ,only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
1106 use parrrsw, only : ng29
1107
1108! implicit none
1109 save
1110
1111!-----------------------------------------------------------------
1112! rrtmg_sw ORIGINAL abs. coefficients for interval 29
1113! band 29: 820-2600 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - co2)
1114!
1115! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
1116! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
1117! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
1118!-----------------------------------------------------------------
1119!
1120! name type purpose
1121! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
1122! kao : real
1123! kbo : real
1124! selfrefo: real
1125! forrefo : real
1126!sfluxrefo: real
1127! absh2oo : real
1128! absco2o : real
1129!-----------------------------------------------------------------
1130
1131 integer(kind=im), parameter :: no29 = 16
1132
1133 real(kind=rb) :: kao(5,13,no29)
1134 real(kind=rb) :: kbo(5,13:59,no29)
1135 real(kind=rb) :: selfrefo(10,no29), forrefo(4,no29)
1136 real(kind=rb) :: sfluxrefo(no29)
1137 real(kind=rb) :: absh2oo(no29), absco2o(no29)
1138
1139 integer(kind=im) :: layreffr
1140 real(kind=rb) :: rayl
1141
1142!-----------------------------------------------------------------
1143! rrtmg_sw COMBINED abs. coefficients for interval 29
1144! band 29: 820-2600 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - co2)
1145!
1146! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, oct1999
1147! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
1148! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
1149!-----------------------------------------------------------------
1150!
1151! name type purpose
1152! ---- : ---- : ---------------------------------------------
1153! ka : real
1154! kb : real
1155! selfref : real
1156! forref : real
1157! sfluxref: real
1158! absh2o : real
1159! absco2 : real
1160!-----------------------------------------------------------------
1161
1162 real(kind=rb) :: ka(5,13,ng29), absa(65,ng29)
1163 real(kind=rb) :: kb(5,13:59,ng29), absb(235,ng29)
1164 real(kind=rb) :: selfref(10,ng29), forref(4,ng29)

1166 real(kind=rb) :: absh2o(ng29), absco2(ng29)

1169
1170 end module rrsw_kg29
1171
1172 module rrsw_ref
1173
1174 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
1175
1176! implicit none
1177 save
1178
1179!------------------------------------------------------------------
1180! rrtmg_sw reference atmosphere
1181! Based on standard mid-latitude summer profile
1182!
1183! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, jul1998
1184! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jun2006
1185! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
1186!------------------------------------------------------------------
1187
1188! name type purpose
1189! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
1190! pref : real : Reference pressure levels
1191! preflog: real : Reference pressure levels, ln(pref)
1192! tref : real : Reference temperature levels for MLS profile
1193!------------------------------------------------------------------
1194
1195 real(kind=rb) , dimension(59) :: pref
1196 real(kind=rb) , dimension(59) :: preflog
1197 real(kind=rb) , dimension(59) :: tref
1198
1199 end module rrsw_ref
1200
1201 module rrsw_tbl
1202
1203 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
1204
1205! implicit none
1206 save
1207
1208!------------------------------------------------------------------
1209! rrtmg_sw lookup table arrays
1210
1211! Initial version: MJIacono, AER, may2007
1212! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2007
1213! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
1214!------------------------------------------------------------------
1215
1216! name type purpose
1217! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
1218! ntbl : integer: Lookup table dimension
1219! tblint : real : Lookup table conversion factor
1220! tau_tbl: real : Clear-sky optical depth
1221! exp_tbl: real : Exponential lookup table for transmittance
1222! od_lo : real : Value of tau below which expansion is used
1223! : in place of lookup table
1224! pade : real : Pade approximation constant
1225! bpade : real : Inverse of Pade constant
1226!------------------------------------------------------------------
1227
1228 integer(kind=im), parameter :: ntbl = 10000
1229
1230 real(kind=rb), parameter :: tblint = 10000.0_rb
1231
1232 real(kind=rb), parameter :: od_lo = 0.06_rb
1233
1234 real(kind=rb) :: tau_tbl
1235 real(kind=rb) , dimension(0:ntbl) :: exp_tbl
1236
1237 real(kind=rb), parameter :: pade = 0.278_rb
1238 real(kind=rb) :: bpade
1239
1240 end module rrsw_tbl
1241
1242 module rrsw_vsn
1243
1244! implicit none
1245 save
1246
1247!------------------------------------------------------------------
1248! rrtmg_sw version information
1249
1250! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, jul1998
1251! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
1252! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
1253!------------------------------------------------------------------
1254
1255! name type purpose
1256! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
1257!hnamrtm :character:
1258!hnamini :character:
1259!hnamcld :character:
1260!hnamclc :character:
1261!hnamrft :character:
1262!hnamspv :character:
1263!hnamspc :character:
1264!hnamset :character:
1265!hnamtau :character:
1266!hnamvqd :character:
1267!hnamatm :character:
1268!hnamutl :character:
1269!hnamext :character:
1270!hnamkg :character:
1271!
1272! hvrrtm :character:
1273! hvrini :character:
1274! hvrcld :character:
1275! hvrclc :character:
1276! hvrrft :character:
1277! hvrspv :character:
1278! hvrspc :character:
1279! hvrset :character:
1280! hvrtau :character:
1281! hvrvqd :character:
1282! hvratm :character:
1283! hvrutl :character:
1284! hvrext :character:
1285! hvrkg :character:
1286!------------------------------------------------------------------
1287
1288 character*18 hvrrtm,hvrini,hvrcld,hvrclc,hvrrft,hvrspv, &
1289 hvrspc,hvrset,hvrtau,hvrvqd,hvratm,hvrutl,hvrext
1290 character*20 hnamrtm,hnamini,hnamcld,hnamclc,hnamrft,hnamspv, &
1291 hnamspc,hnamset,hnamtau,hnamvqd,hnamatm,hnamutl,hnamext
1292
1293 character*18 hvrkg
1294 character*20 hnamkg
1295
1296 end module rrsw_vsn
1297
1298 module rrsw_wvn
1299
1300 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
1301 use parrrsw, only : nbndsw, mg, ngptsw, jpb1, jpb2
1302
1303! implicit none
1304 save
1305
1306!------------------------------------------------------------------
1307! rrtmg_sw spectral information
1308
1309! Initial version: JJMorcrette, ECMWF, jul1998
1310! Revised: MJIacono, AER, jul2006
1311! Revised: MJIacono, AER, aug2008
1312!------------------------------------------------------------------
1313
1314! name type purpose
1315! ----- : ---- : ----------------------------------------------
1316! ng : integer: Number of original g-intervals in each spectral band
1317! nspa : integer:
1318! nspb : integer:
1319!wavenum1: real : Spectral band lower boundary in wavenumbers
1320!wavenum2: real : Spectral band upper boundary in wavenumbers
1321! delwave: real : Spectral band width in wavenumbers
1322!
1323! ngc : integer: The number of new g-intervals in each band
1324! ngs : integer: The cumulative sum of new g-intervals for each band
1325! ngm : integer: The index of each new g-interval relative to the
1326! original 16 g-intervals in each band
1327! ngn : integer: The number of original g-intervals that are
1328! combined to make each new g-intervals in each band
1329! ngb : integer: The band index for each new g-interval
1330! wt : real : RRTM weights for the original 16 g-intervals
1331! rwgt : real : Weights for combining original 16 g-intervals
1332! (224 total) into reduced set of g-intervals
1333! (112 total)
1334!------------------------------------------------------------------
1335
1336 integer(kind=im) :: ng(jpb1:jpb2)
1337 integer(kind=im) :: nspa(jpb1:jpb2)
1338 integer(kind=im) :: nspb(jpb1:jpb2)
1339
1340 real(kind=rb) :: wavenum1(jpb1:jpb2)
1341 real(kind=rb) :: wavenum2(jpb1:jpb2)
1342 real(kind=rb) :: delwave(jpb1:jpb2)
1343
1344 integer(kind=im) :: ngc(nbndsw)
1345 integer(kind=im) :: ngs(nbndsw)
1346 integer(kind=im) :: ngn(ngptsw)
1347 integer(kind=im) :: ngb(ngptsw)
1348 integer(kind=im) :: ngm(nbndsw*mg)
1349
1350 real(kind=rb) :: wt(mg)
1351 real(kind=rb) :: rwgt(nbndsw*mg)
1352
1353 end module rrsw_wvn
1354
1355! path: $Source: /cvsroot/NWP/WRFV3/phys/module_ra_rrtmg_sw.F,v $
1356! author: $Author: trn $
1357! revision: $Revision: 1.3 $
1358! created: $Date: 2009/04/16 19:54:22 $
1359!
1360 module mcica_subcol_gen_sw
1361
1362! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1363! | |
1364! | Copyright 2006-2008, Atmospheric & Environmental Research, Inc. (AER). |
1365! | This software may be used, copied, or redistributed as long as it is |
1366! | not sold and this copyright notice is reproduced on each copy made. |
1367! | This model is provided as is without any express or implied warranties. |
1368! | (http://www.rtweb.aer.com/) |
1369! | |
1370! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1371
1372! Purpose: Create McICA stochastic arrays for cloud physical or optical properties.
1373! Two options are possible:
1374! 1) Input cloud physical properties: cloud fraction, ice and liquid water
1375! paths, ice fraction, and particle sizes. Output will be stochastic
1376! arrays of these variables. (inflag = 1)
1377! 2) Input cloud optical properties directly: cloud optical depth, single
1378! scattering albedo and asymmetry parameter. Output will be stochastic
1379! arrays of these variables. (inflag = 0)
1380
1381! --------- Modules ----------
1382
1383 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
1384 use parrrsw, only : nbndsw, ngptsw
1385 use rrsw_con, only: grav
1386 use rrsw_wvn, only: ngb
1387 use rrsw_vsn
1388
1389 implicit none
1390
1391! public interfaces/functions/subroutines
1392 public :: mcica_subcol_sw, generate_stochastic_clouds_sw
1393
1394 contains
1395
1396!------------------------------------------------------------------
1397! Public subroutines
1398!------------------------------------------------------------------
1399
1400 subroutine mcica_subcol_sw(iplon, ncol, nlay, icld, permuteseed, irng, play, &
1401 cldfrac, ciwp, clwp, cswp, rei, rel, res, tauc, ssac, asmc, fsfc, &
1402 cldfmcl, ciwpmcl, clwpmcl, cswpmcl, reicmcl, relqmcl, resnmcl, &
1403 taucmcl, ssacmcl, asmcmcl, fsfcmcl)
1404
1405! ----- Input -----
1406! Control
1407 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: iplon ! column/longitude dimension
1408 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: ncol ! number of columns
1409 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nlay ! number of model layers
1410 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: icld ! clear/cloud, cloud overlap flag
1411 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: permuteseed ! if the cloud generator is called multiple times,
1412 ! permute the seed between each call;
1413 ! between calls for LW and SW, recommended
1414 ! permuteseed differs by 'ngpt'
1415 integer(kind=im), intent(inout) :: irng ! flag for random number generator
1416 ! 0 = kissvec
1417 ! 1 = Mersenne Twister
1418
1419! Atmosphere
1420 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: play(:,:) ! layer pressures (mb)
1421 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1422
1423! Atmosphere/clouds - cldprop
1424 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cldfrac(:,:) ! layer cloud fraction
1425 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1426 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tauc(:,:,:) ! in-cloud optical depth
1427 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1428 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ssac(:,:,:) ! in-cloud single scattering albedo (non-delta scaled)
1429 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1430 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: asmc(:,:,:) ! in-cloud asymmetry parameter (non-delta scaled)
1431 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1432 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: fsfc(:,:,:) ! in-cloud forward scattering fraction (non-delta scaled)
1433 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1434 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ciwp(:,:) ! in-cloud ice water path
1435 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1436 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: clwp(:,:) ! in-cloud liquid water path
1437 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1438 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cswp(:,:) ! in-cloud snow water path
1439 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1440 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: rei(:,:) ! cloud ice particle size
1441 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1442 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: rel(:,:) ! cloud liquid particle size
1443 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1444 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: res(:,:) ! cloud snow particle size
1445 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1446
1447! ----- Output -----
1448! Atmosphere/clouds - cldprmc [mcica]
1449 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: cldfmcl(:,:,:) ! cloud fraction [mcica]
1450 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1451 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ciwpmcl(:,:,:) ! in-cloud ice water path [mcica]
1452 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1453 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: clwpmcl(:,:,:) ! in-cloud liquid water path [mcica]
1454 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1455 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: cswpmcl(:,:,:) ! in-cloud snow water path [mcica]
1456 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1457 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: relqmcl(:,:) ! liquid particle size (microns)
1458 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1459 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: reicmcl(:,:) ! ice partcle size (microns)
1460 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1461 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: resnmcl(:,:) ! snow partcle size (microns)
1462 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1463 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: taucmcl(:,:,:) ! in-cloud optical depth [mcica]
1464 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1465 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ssacmcl(:,:,:) ! in-cloud single scattering albedo [mcica]
1466 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1467 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: asmcmcl(:,:,:) ! in-cloud asymmetry parameter [mcica]
1468 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1469 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: fsfcmcl(:,:,:) ! in-cloud forward scattering fraction [mcica]
1470 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1471
1472! ----- Local -----
1473
1474! Stochastic cloud generator variables [mcica]
1475 integer(kind=im), parameter :: nsubcsw = ngptsw ! number of sub-columns (g-point intervals)
1476 integer(kind=im) :: ilev ! loop index
1477
1478 real(kind=rb) :: pmid(ncol,nlay) ! layer pressures (Pa)
1479! real(kind=rb) :: pdel(ncol,nlay) ! layer pressure thickness (Pa)
1480! real(kind=rb) :: qi(ncol,nlay) ! ice water (specific humidity)
1481! real(kind=rb) :: ql(ncol,nlay) ! liq water (specific humidity)
1482
1483
1484! Return if clear sky; or stop if icld out of range
1485 if (icld.eq.0) return
1486 if (icld.lt.0.or.icld.gt.3) then
1487 stop 'MCICA_SUBCOL: INVALID ICLD'
1488 endif
1489
1490! NOTE: For GCM mode, permuteseed must be offset between LW and SW by at least number of subcolumns
1491
1492
1493! Pass particle sizes to new arrays, no subcolumns for these properties yet
1494! Convert pressures from mb to Pa
1495
1496 reicmcl(:ncol,:nlay) = rei(:ncol,:nlay)
1497 relqmcl(:ncol,:nlay) = rel(:ncol,:nlay)
1498 resnmcl(:ncol,:nlay) = res(:ncol,:nlay)
1499 pmid(:ncol,:nlay) = play(:ncol,:nlay)*1.e2_rb
1500
1501! Convert input ice and liquid cloud water paths to specific humidity ice and liquid components
1502
1503! cwp = (q * pdel * 1000.) / gravit)
1504! = (kg/kg * kg m-1 s-2 *1000.) / m s-2
1505! = (g m-2)
1506!
1507! q = (cwp * gravit) / (pdel *1000.)
1508! = (g m-2 * m s-2) / (kg m-1 s-2 * 1000.)
1509! = kg/kg
1510
1511! do ilev = 1, nlay
1512! qi(ilev) = (ciwp(ilev) * grav) / (pdel(ilev) * 1000._rb)
1513! ql(ilev) = (clwp(ilev) * grav) / (pdel(ilev) * 1000._rb)
1514! enddo
1515
1516! Generate the stochastic subcolumns of cloud optical properties for the shortwave;
1517 call generate_stochastic_clouds_sw (ncol, nlay, nsubcsw, icld, irng, pmid, cldfrac, clwp, ciwp, cswp, &
1518 tauc, ssac, asmc, fsfc, cldfmcl, clwpmcl, ciwpmcl, cswpmcl, &
1519 taucmcl, ssacmcl, asmcmcl, fsfcmcl, permuteseed)
1520
1521 end subroutine mcica_subcol_sw
1522
1523
1524!-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1525 subroutine generate_stochastic_clouds_sw(ncol, nlay, nsubcol, icld, irng, pmid, cld, clwp, ciwp, cswp, &
1526 tauc, ssac, asmc, fsfc, cld_stoch, clwp_stoch, ciwp_stoch, cswp_stoch, &
1527 tauc_stoch, ssac_stoch, asmc_stoch, fsfc_stoch, changeSeed)
1528!-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1529
1530 !----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1531 ! ---------------------
1532 ! Contact: Cecile Hannay (hannay@ucar.edu)
1533 !
1534 ! Original code: Based on Raisanen et al., QJRMS, 2004.
1535 !
1536 ! Modifications: Generalized for use with RRTMG and added Mersenne Twister as the default
1537 ! random number generator, which can be changed to the optional kissvec random number generator
1538 ! with flag 'irng'. Some extra functionality has been commented or removed.
1539 ! Michael J. Iacono, AER, Inc., February 2007
1540 !
1541 ! Given a profile of cloud fraction, cloud water and cloud ice, we produce a set of subcolumns.
1542 ! Each layer within each subcolumn is homogeneous, with cloud fraction equal to zero or one
1543 ! and uniform cloud liquid and cloud ice concentration.
1544 ! The ensemble as a whole reproduces the probability function of cloud liquid and ice within each layer
1545 ! and obeys an overlap assumption in the vertical.
1546 !
1547 ! Overlap assumption:
1548 ! The cloud are consistent with 4 overlap assumptions: random, maximum, maximum-random and exponential.
1549 ! The default option is maximum-random (option 3)
1550 ! The options are: 1=random overlap, 2=max/random, 3=maximum overlap, 4=exponential overlap
1551 ! This is set with the variable "overlap"
1552 !mji - Exponential overlap option (overlap=4) has been deactivated in this version
1553 ! The exponential overlap uses also a length scale, Zo. (real, parameter :: Zo = 2500. )
1554 !
1555 ! Seed:
1556 ! If the stochastic cloud generator is called several times during the same timestep,
1557 ! one should change the seed between the call to insure that the subcolumns are different.
1558 ! This is done by changing the argument 'changeSeed'
1559 ! For example, if one wants to create a set of columns for the shortwave and another set for the longwave ,
1560 ! use 'changeSeed = 1' for the first call and'changeSeed = 2' for the second call
1561 !
1562 ! PDF assumption:
1563 ! We can use arbitrary complicated PDFS.
1564 ! In the present version, we produce homogeneuous clouds (the simplest case).
1565 ! Future developments include using the PDF scheme of Ben Johnson.
1566 !
1567 ! History file:
1568 ! Option to add diagnostics variables in the history file. (using FINCL in the namelist)
1569 ! nsubcol = number of subcolumns
1570 ! overlap = overlap type (1-3)
1571 ! Zo = length scale
1572 ! CLOUD_S = mean of the subcolumn cloud fraction ('_S" means Stochastic)
1573 ! CLDLIQ_S = mean of the subcolumn cloud water
1574 ! CLDICE_S = mean of the subcolumn cloud ice
1575 !
1576 ! Note:
1577 ! Here: we force that the cloud condensate to be consistent with the cloud fraction
1578 ! i.e we only have cloud condensate when the cell is cloudy.
1579 ! In CAM: The cloud condensate and the cloud fraction are obtained from 2 different equations
1580 ! and the 2 quantities can be inconsistent (i.e. CAM can produce cloud fraction
1581 ! without cloud condensate or the opposite).
1582 !---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1583
1584 use mcica_random_numbers
1585! The Mersenne Twister random number engine
1586 use mersennetwister, only: randomnumbersequence, &
1587 new_randomnumbersequence, getrandomreal
1588
1589 type(randomNumberSequence) :: randomNumbers
1590
1591! -- Arguments
1592
1593 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: ncol ! number of layers
1594 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nlay ! number of layers
1595 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: icld ! clear/cloud, cloud overlap flag
1596 integer(kind=im), intent(inout) :: irng ! flag for random number generator
1597 ! 0 = kissvec
1598 ! 1 = Mersenne Twister
1599 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nsubcol ! number of sub-columns (g-point intervals)
1600 integer(kind=im), optional, intent(in) :: changeSeed ! allows permuting seed
1601
1602! Column state (cloud fraction, cloud water, cloud ice) + variables needed to read physics state
1603 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: pmid(:,:) ! layer pressure (Pa)
1604 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1605 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cld(:,:) ! cloud fraction
1606 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1607 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: clwp(:,:) ! in-cloud liquid water path (g/m2)
1608 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1609 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ciwp(:,:) ! in-cloud ice water path (g/m2)
1610 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1611 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cswp(:,:) ! in-cloud snow water path (g/m2)
1612 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1613 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tauc(:,:,:) ! in-cloud optical depth (non-delta scaled)
1614 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1615 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ssac(:,:,:) ! in-cloud single scattering albedo (non-delta scaled)
1616 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1617 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: asmc(:,:,:) ! in-cloud asymmetry parameter (non-delta scaled)
1618 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1619 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: fsfc(:,:,:) ! in-cloud forward scattering fraction (non-delta scaled)
1620 ! Dimensions: (nbndsw,ncol,nlay)
1621
1622 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: cld_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn cloud fraction
1623 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1624 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: clwp_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn in-cloud liquid water path
1625 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1626 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ciwp_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn in-cloud ice water path
1627 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1628 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: cswp_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn in-cloud snow water path
1629 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1630 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: tauc_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn in-cloud optical depth
1631 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1632 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ssac_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn in-cloud single scattering albedo
1633 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1634 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: asmc_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn in-cloud asymmetry parameter
1635 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1636 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: fsfc_stoch(:,:,:) ! subcolumn in-cloud forward scattering fraction
1637 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
1638
1639! -- Local variables
1640 real(kind=rb) :: cldf(ncol,nlay) ! cloud fraction
1641 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
1642
1643! Mean over the subcolumns (cloud fraction, cloud water , cloud ice) - inactive
1644! real(kind=rb) :: mean_cld_stoch(ncol,nlay) ! cloud fraction
1645! real(kind=rb) :: mean_clwp_stoch(ncol,nlay) ! cloud water
1646! real(kind=rb) :: mean_ciwp_stoch(ncol,nlay) ! cloud ice
1647! real(kind=rb) :: mean_tauc_stoch(ncol,nlay) ! cloud optical depth
1648! real(kind=rb) :: mean_ssac_stoch(ncol,nlay) ! cloud single scattering albedo
1649! real(kind=rb) :: mean_asmc_stoch(ncol,nlay) ! cloud asymmetry parameter
1650! real(kind=rb) :: mean_fsfc_stoch(ncol,nlay) ! cloud forward scattering fraction
1651
1652! Set overlap
1653 integer(kind=im) :: overlap ! 1 = random overlap, 2 = maximum/random,
1654 ! 3 = maximum overlap,
1655! real(kind=rb), parameter :: Zo = 2500._rb ! length scale (m)
1656! real(kind=rb) :: zm(ncon,nlay) ! Height of midpoints (above surface)
1657! real(kind=rb), dimension(nlay) :: alpha=0.0_rb ! overlap parameter
1658
1659! Constants (min value for cloud fraction and cloud water and ice)
1660 real(kind=rb), parameter :: cldmin = 1.0e-20_rb ! min cloud fraction
1661! real(kind=rb), parameter :: qmin = 1.0e-10_rb ! min cloud water and cloud ice (not used)
1662
1663! Variables related to random number and seed
1664 real(kind=rb), dimension(nsubcol, ncol, nlay) :: cdf, cdf2 ! random numbers
1665 integer(kind=im), dimension(ncol) :: seed1, seed2, seed3, seed4 ! seed to create random number
1666 real(kind=rb), dimension(ncol) :: rand_num ! random number (kissvec)
1667 integer(kind=im) :: iseed ! seed to create random number (Mersenne Twister)
1668 real(kind=rb) :: rand_num_mt ! random number (Mersenne Twister)
1669
1670! Flag to identify cloud fraction in subcolumns
1671 logical, dimension(nsubcol, ncol, nlay) :: isCloudy ! flag that says whether a gridbox is cloudy
1672
1673! Indices
1674 integer(kind=im) :: ilev, isubcol, i, n, ngbm ! indices
1675
1676!------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1677
1678! Check that irng is in bounds; if not, set to default
1679 if (irng .ne. 0) irng = 1
1680
1681! Pass input cloud overlap setting to local variable
1682 overlap = icld
1683
1684! Ensure that cloud fractions are in bounds
1685 do ilev = 1, nlay
1686 do i = 1, ncol
1687 cldf(i,ilev) = cld(i,ilev)
1688 if (cldf(i,ilev) < cldmin) then
1689 cldf(i,ilev) = 0._rb
1690 endif
1691 enddo
1692 enddo
1693
1694! ----- Create seed --------
1695
1696! Advance randum number generator by changeseed values
1697 if (irng.eq.0) then
1698! For kissvec, create a seed that depends on the state of the columns. Maybe not the best way, but it works.
1699! Must use pmid from bottom four layers.
1700 do i=1,ncol
1701 if (pmid(i,1).lt.pmid(i,2)) then
1702 stop 'MCICA_SUBCOL: KISSVEC SEED GENERATOR REQUIRES PMID FROM BOTTOM FOUR LAYERS.'
1703 endif
1704 seed1(i) = (pmid(i,1) - int(pmid(i,1))) * 1000000000_im
1705 seed2(i) = (pmid(i,2) - int(pmid(i,2))) * 1000000000_im
1706 seed3(i) = (pmid(i,3) - int(pmid(i,3))) * 1000000000_im
1707 seed4(i) = (pmid(i,4) - int(pmid(i,4))) * 1000000000_im
1708 enddo
1709 do i=1,changeseed
1710 call kissvec(seed1, seed2, seed3, seed4, rand_num)
1711 enddo
1712 elseif (irng.eq.1) then
1713 randomnumbers = new_randomnumbersequence(seed = changeseed)
1714 endif
1715
1716
1717! ------ Apply overlap assumption --------
1718
1719! generate the random numbers
1720
1721 select case (overlap)
1722
1723 case(1)
1724! Random overlap
1725! i) pick a random value at every level
1726
1727 if (irng.eq.0) then
1728 do isubcol = 1,nsubcol
1729 do ilev = 1,nlay
1730 call kissvec(seed1, seed2, seed3, seed4, rand_num)
1731 cdf(isubcol,:,ilev) = rand_num
1732 enddo
1733 enddo
1734 elseif (irng.eq.1) then
1735 do isubcol = 1, nsubcol
1736 do i = 1, ncol
1737 do ilev = 1, nlay
1738 rand_num_mt = getrandomreal(randomnumbers)
1739 cdf(isubcol,i,ilev) = rand_num_mt
1740 enddo
1741 enddo
1742 enddo
1743 endif
1744
1745 case(2)
1746! Maximum-Random overlap
1747! i) pick a random number for top layer.
1748! ii) walk down the column:
1749! - if the layer above is cloudy, we use the same random number than in the layer above
1750! - if the layer above is clear, we use a new random number
1751
1752 if (irng.eq.0) then
1753 do isubcol = 1,nsubcol
1754 do ilev = 1,nlay
1755 call kissvec(seed1, seed2, seed3, seed4, rand_num)
1756 cdf(isubcol,:,ilev) = rand_num
1757 enddo
1758 enddo
1759 elseif (irng.eq.1) then
1760 do isubcol = 1, nsubcol
1761 do i = 1, ncol
1762 do ilev = 1, nlay
1763 rand_num_mt = getrandomreal(randomnumbers)
1764 cdf(isubcol,i,ilev) = rand_num_mt
1765 enddo
1766 enddo
1767 enddo
1768 endif
1769
1770 do ilev = 2,nlay
1771 do i = 1, ncol
1772 do isubcol = 1, nsubcol
1773 if (cdf(isubcol, i, ilev-1) > 1._rb - cldf(i,ilev-1) ) then
1774 cdf(isubcol,i,ilev) = cdf(isubcol,i,ilev-1)
1775 else
1776 cdf(isubcol,i,ilev) = cdf(isubcol,i,ilev) * (1._rb - cldf(i,ilev-1))
1777 endif
1778 enddo
1779 enddo
1780 enddo
1781
1782 case(3)
1783! Maximum overlap
1784! i) pick same random numebr at every level
1785
1786 if (irng.eq.0) then
1787 do isubcol = 1,nsubcol
1788 call kissvec(seed1, seed2, seed3, seed4, rand_num)
1789 do ilev = 1,nlay
1790 cdf(isubcol,:,ilev) = rand_num
1791 enddo
1792 enddo
1793 elseif (irng.eq.1) then
1794 do isubcol = 1, nsubcol
1795 do i = 1, ncol
1796 rand_num_mt = getrandomreal(randomnumbers)
1797 do ilev = 1, nlay
1798 cdf(isubcol,i,ilev) = rand_num_mt
1799 enddo
1800 enddo
1801 enddo
1802 endif
1803
1804! case(4) - inactive
1805! ! Exponential overlap: weighting between maximum and random overlap increases with the distance.
1806! ! The random numbers for exponential overlap verify:
1807! ! j=1 RAN(j)=RND1
1808! ! j>1 if RND1 < alpha(j,j-1) => RAN(j) = RAN(j-1)
1809! ! RAN(j) = RND2
1810! ! alpha is obtained from the equation
1811! ! alpha = exp(- (Zi-Zj-1)/Zo) where Zo is a characteristic length scale
1812
1813
1814! ! compute alpha
1815! zm = state%zm
1816! alpha(:, 1) = 0._rb
1817! do ilev = 2,nlay
1818! alpha(:, ilev) = exp( -( zm (:, ilev-1) - zm (:, ilev)) / Zo)
1819! end do
1820
1821! ! generate 2 streams of random numbers
1822! do isubcol = 1,nsubcol
1823! do ilev = 1,nlay
1824! call kissvec(seed1, seed2, seed3, seed4, rand_num)
1825! CDF(isubcol, :, ilev) = rand_num
1826! call kissvec(seed1, seed2, seed3, seed4, rand_num)
1827! CDF2(isubcol, :, ilev) = rand_num
1828! end do
1829! end do
1830
1831! ! generate random numbers
1832! do ilev = 2,nlay
1833! where (CDF2(:, :, ilev) < spread(alpha (:,ilev), dim=1, nCopies=nsubcol) )
1834! CDF(:,:,ilev) = CDF(:,:,ilev-1)
1835! end where
1836! end do
1837
1838 end select
1839
1840
1841! -- generate subcolumns for homogeneous clouds -----
1842 do ilev = 1, nlay
1843 iscloudy(:,:,ilev) = (cdf(:,:,ilev) >= 1._rb - spread(cldf(:,ilev), dim=1, ncopies=nsubcol) )
1844 enddo
1845
1846! where the subcolumn is cloudy, the subcolumn cloud fraction is 1;
1847! where the subcolumn is not cloudy, the subcolumn cloud fraction is 0;
1848! where there is a cloud, define the subcolumn cloud properties,
1849! otherwise set these to zero
1850
1851 ngbm = ngb(1) - 1
1852 do ilev = 1,nlay
1853 do i = 1, ncol
1854 do isubcol = 1, nsubcol
1855 if ( iscloudy(isubcol,i,ilev) ) then
1856 cld_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 1._rb
1857 clwp_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = clwp(i,ilev)
1858 ciwp_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = ciwp(i,ilev)
1859 cswp_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = cswp(i,ilev)
1860 n = ngb(isubcol) - ngbm
1861 tauc_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = tauc(n,i,ilev)
1862 ssac_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = ssac(n,i,ilev)
1863 asmc_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = asmc(n,i,ilev)
1864 fsfc_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = fsfc(n,i,ilev)
1865 else
1866 cld_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 0._rb
1867 clwp_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 0._rb
1868 ciwp_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 0._rb
1869 cswp_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 0._rb
1870 tauc_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 0._rb
1871 ssac_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 1._rb
1872 asmc_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 0._rb
1873 fsfc_stoch(isubcol,i,ilev) = 0._rb
1874 endif
1875 enddo
1876 enddo
1877 enddo
1878
1879! -- compute the means of the subcolumns ---
1880! mean_cld_stoch(:,:) = 0._rb
1881! mean_clwp_stoch(:,:) = 0._rb
1882! mean_ciwp_stoch(:,:) = 0._rb
1883! mean_tauc_stoch(:,:) = 0._rb
1884! mean_ssac_stoch(:,:) = 0._rb
1885! mean_asmc_stoch(:,:) = 0._rb
1886! mean_fsfc_stoch(:,:) = 0._rb
1887! do i = 1, nsubcol
1888! mean_cld_stoch(:,:) = cld_stoch(i,:,:) + mean_cld_stoch(:,:)
1889! mean_clwp_stoch(:,:) = clwp_stoch( i,:,:) + mean_clwp_stoch(:,:)
1890! mean_ciwp_stoch(:,:) = ciwp_stoch( i,:,:) + mean_ciwp_stoch(:,:)
1891! mean_tauc_stoch(:,:) = tauc_stoch( i,:,:) + mean_tauc_stoch(:,:)
1892! mean_ssac_stoch(:,:) = ssac_stoch( i,:,:) + mean_ssac_stoch(:,:)
1893! mean_asmc_stoch(:,:) = asmc_stoch( i,:,:) + mean_asmc_stoch(:,:)
1894! mean_fsfc_stoch(:,:) = fsfc_stoch( i,:,:) + mean_fsfc_stoch(:,:)
1895! end do
1896! mean_cld_stoch(:,:) = mean_cld_stoch(:,:) / nsubcol
1897! mean_clwp_stoch(:,:) = mean_clwp_stoch(:,:) / nsubcol
1898! mean_ciwp_stoch(:,:) = mean_ciwp_stoch(:,:) / nsubcol
1899! mean_tauc_stoch(:,:) = mean_tauc_stoch(:,:) / nsubcol
1900! mean_ssac_stoch(:,:) = mean_ssac_stoch(:,:) / nsubcol
1901! mean_asmc_stoch(:,:) = mean_asmc_stoch(:,:) / nsubcol
1902! mean_fsfc_stoch(:,:) = mean_fsfc_stoch(:,:) / nsubcol
1903
1904 end subroutine generate_stochastic_clouds_sw
1905
1906
1907!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1908 subroutine kissvec(seed1,seed2,seed3,seed4,ran_arr)
1909!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1910
1911! public domain code
1912! made available from http://www.fortran.com/
1913! downloaded by pjr on 03/16/04 for NCAR CAM
1914! converted to vector form, functions inlined by pjr,mvr on 05/10/2004
1915
1916! The KISS (Keep It Simple Stupid) random number generator. Combines:
1917! (1) The congruential generator x(n)=69069*x(n-1)+1327217885, period 2^32.
1918! (2) A 3-shift shift-register generator, period 2^32-1,
1919! (3) Two 16-bit multiply-with-carry generators, period 597273182964842497>2^59
1920! Overall period>2^123;
1921!
1922 real(kind=rb), dimension(:), intent(inout) :: ran_arr
1923 integer(kind=im), dimension(:), intent(inout) :: seed1,seed2,seed3,seed4
1924 integer(kind=im) :: i,sz,kiss
1925 integer(kind=im) :: m, k, n
1926
1927! inline function
1928 m(k, n) = ieor(k, ishft(k, n) )
1929
1930 sz = size(ran_arr)
1931 do i = 1, sz
1932 seed1(i) = 69069_im * seed1(i) + 1327217885_im
1933 seed2(i) = m(m(m(seed2(i), 13_im), - 17_im), 5_im)
1934 seed3(i) = 18000_im * iand(seed3(i), 65535_im) + ishft(seed3(i), - 16_im)
1935 seed4(i) = 30903_im * iand(seed4(i), 65535_im) + ishft(seed4(i), - 16_im)
1936 kiss = seed1(i) + seed2(i) + ishft(seed3(i), 16_im) + seed4(i)
1937 ran_arr(i) = kiss*2.328306e-10_rb + 0.5_rb
1938 end do
1939
1940 end subroutine kissvec
1941
1942 end module mcica_subcol_gen_sw
1943
1944! path: $Source: /cvsroot/NWP/WRFV3/phys/module_ra_rrtmg_sw.F,v $
1945! author: $Author: trn $
1946! revision: $Revision: 1.3 $
1947! created: $Date: 2009/04/16 19:54:22 $
1948
1949 module rrtmg_sw_cldprmc
1950
1951#if defined(mpas)
1952 use mpas_atmphys_utilities,only: physics_error_fatal
1953#define FATAL_ERROR(M) call physics_error_fatal( M )
1954#else
1955use module_wrf_error
1956#define FATAL_ERROR(M) call wrf_error_fatal( M )
1957#endif
1958
1959! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1960! | |
1961! | Copyright 2002-2008, Atmospheric & Environmental Research, Inc. (AER). |
1962! | This software may be used, copied, or redistributed as long as it is |
1963! | not sold and this copyright notice is reproduced on each copy made. |
1964! | This model is provided as is without any express or implied warranties. |
1965! | (http://www.rtweb.aer.com/) |
1966! | |
1967! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1968
1969! ------- Modules -------
1970
1971 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
1972 use parrrsw, only : ngptsw, jpband, jpb1, jpb2
1973 use rrsw_cld, only : extliq1, ssaliq1, asyliq1, &
1974 extice2, ssaice2, asyice2, &
1975 extice3, ssaice3, asyice3, fdlice3, &
1976 abari, bbari, cbari, dbari, ebari, fbari
1977 use rrsw_wvn, only : wavenum1, wavenum2, ngb
1978 use rrsw_vsn, only : hvrclc, hnamclc
1979
1980 implicit none
1981
1982 contains
1983
1984! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1985 subroutine cldprmc_sw(nlayers, inflag, iceflag, liqflag, cldfmc, &
1986 ciwpmc, clwpmc, cswpmc, reicmc, relqmc, resnmc, &
1987 taormc, taucmc, ssacmc, asmcmc, fsfcmc)
1988! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1989
1990! Purpose: Compute the cloud optical properties for each cloudy layer
1991! and g-point interval for use by the McICA method.
1992! Note: Only inflag = 0 and inflag=2/liqflag=1/iceflag=2,3 are available;
1993! (Hu & Stamnes, Key, and Fu) are implemented.
1994
1995! ------- Input -------
1996
1997 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nlayers ! total number of layers
1998 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: inflag ! see definitions
1999 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: iceflag ! see definitions
2000 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: liqflag ! see definitions
2001
2002 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cldfmc(:,:) ! cloud fraction [mcica]
2003 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2004 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ciwpmc(:,:) ! cloud ice water path [mcica]
2005 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2006 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: clwpmc(:,:) ! cloud liquid water path [mcica]
2007 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2008 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cswpmc(:,:) ! cloud snow water path [mcica]
2009 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2010 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: resnmc(:) ! cloud snow particle effective radius (microns)
2011 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2012 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: relqmc(:) ! cloud liquid particle effective radius (microns)
2013 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2014 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: reicmc(:) ! cloud ice particle effective radius (microns)
2015 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2016 ! specific definition of reicmc depends on setting of iceflag:
2017 ! iceflag = 1: ice effective radius, r_ec, (Ebert and Curry, 1992),
2018 ! r_ec range is limited to 13.0 to 130.0 microns
2019 ! iceflag = 2: ice effective radius, r_k, (Key, Streamer Ref. Manual, 1996)
2020 ! r_k range is limited to 5.0 to 131.0 microns
2021 ! iceflag = 3: generalized effective size, dge, (Fu, 1996),
2022 ! dge range is limited to 5.0 to 140.0 microns
2023 ! [dge = 1.0315 * r_ec]
2024 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: fsfcmc(:,:) ! cloud forward scattering fraction
2025 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2026
2027! ------- Output -------
2028
2029 real(kind=rb), intent(inout) :: taucmc(:,:) ! cloud optical depth (delta scaled)
2030 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2031 real(kind=rb), intent(inout) :: ssacmc(:,:) ! single scattering albedo (delta scaled)
2032 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2033 real(kind=rb), intent(inout) :: asmcmc(:,:) ! asymmetry parameter (delta scaled)
2034 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2035 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: taormc(:,:) ! cloud optical depth (non-delta scaled)
2036 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlayers)
2037
2038! ------- Local -------
2039
2040! integer(kind=im) :: ncbands
2041 integer(kind=im) :: ib, lay, istr, index, icx, ig
2042
2043 real(kind=rb), parameter :: eps = 1.e-06_rb ! epsilon
2044 real(kind=rb), parameter :: cldmin = 1.e-20_rb ! minimum value for cloud quantities
2045 real(kind=rb) :: cwp ! total cloud water path
2046 real(kind=rb) :: radliq ! cloud liquid droplet radius (microns)
2047 real(kind=rb) :: radice ! cloud ice effective size (microns)
2048 real(kind=rb) :: radsno ! cloud snow effective size (microns)
2049 real(kind=rb) :: factor
2050 real(kind=rb) :: fint
2051
2052 real(kind=rb) :: taucldorig_a, taucloud_a, ssacloud_a, ffp, ffp1, ffpssa
2053 real(kind=rb) :: tauiceorig, scatice, ssaice, tauice, tauliqorig, scatliq, ssaliq, tauliq
2054 real(kind=rb) :: tausnoorig, scatsno, ssasno, tausno
2055
2056 real(kind=rb) :: fdelta(ngptsw)
2057 real(kind=rb) :: extcoice(ngptsw), gice(ngptsw)
2058 real(kind=rb) :: ssacoice(ngptsw), forwice(ngptsw)
2059 real(kind=rb) :: extcoliq(ngptsw), gliq(ngptsw)
2060 real(kind=rb) :: ssacoliq(ngptsw), forwliq(ngptsw)
2061 real(kind=rb) :: extcosno(ngptsw), gsno(ngptsw)
2062 real(kind=rb) :: ssacosno(ngptsw), forwsno(ngptsw)
2063
2064 CHARACTER*80 errmess
2065
2066! Initialize
2067
2068!jm not thread safe hvrclc = '$Revision: 1.3 $'
2069
2070! Some of these initializations are done elsewhere
2071 do lay = 1, nlayers
2072 do ig = 1, ngptsw
2073 taormc(ig,lay) = taucmc(ig,lay)
2074! taucmc(ig,lay) = 0.0_rb
2075! ssacmc(ig,lay) = 1.0_rb
2076! asmcmc(ig,lay) = 0.0_rb
2077 enddo
2078 enddo
2079
2080! Main layer loop
2081 do lay = 1, nlayers
2082
2083! Main g-point interval loop
2084 do ig = 1, ngptsw
2085 cwp = ciwpmc(ig,lay) + clwpmc(ig,lay) + cswpmc(ig,lay)
2086
2087 if (cldfmc(ig,lay) .ge. cldmin .and. &
2088 (cwp .ge. cldmin .or. taucmc(ig,lay) .ge. cldmin)) then
2089
2090! (inflag=0): Cloud optical properties input directly
2091 if (inflag .eq. 0) then
2092! Cloud optical properties already defined in taucmc, ssacmc, asmcmc are unscaled;
2093! Apply delta-M scaling here (using Henyey-Greenstein approximation)
2094 taucldorig_a = taucmc(ig,lay)
2095 ffp = fsfcmc(ig,lay)
2096 ffp1 = 1.0_rb - ffp
2097 ffpssa = 1.0_rb - ffp * ssacmc(ig,lay)
2098 ssacloud_a = ffp1 * ssacmc(ig,lay) / ffpssa
2099 taucloud_a = ffpssa * taucldorig_a
2100
2101 taormc(ig,lay) = taucldorig_a
2102 ssacmc(ig,lay) = ssacloud_a
2103 taucmc(ig,lay) = taucloud_a
2104 asmcmc(ig,lay) = (asmcmc(ig,lay) - ffp) / (ffp1)
2105
2106 elseif (inflag .eq. 1) then
2107 stop 'INFLAG = 1 OPTION NOT AVAILABLE WITH MCICA'
2108
2109! (inflag=2): Separate treatement of ice clouds and water clouds.
2110 elseif (inflag .ge. 2) then
2111 radice = reicmc(lay)
2112
2113! Calculation of absorption coefficients due to ice clouds.
2114 if ((ciwpmc(ig,lay)+cswpmc(ig,lay)) .eq. 0.0_rb) then
2115 extcoice(ig) = 0.0_rb
2116 ssacoice(ig) = 0.0_rb
2117 gice(ig) = 0.0_rb
2118 forwice(ig) = 0.0_rb
2119
2120 extcosno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2121 ssacosno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2122 gsno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2123 forwsno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2124
2125! (iceflag = 1):
2126! Note: This option uses Ebert and Curry approach for all particle sizes similar to
2127! CAM3 implementation, though this is somewhat unjustified for large ice particles
2128 elseif (iceflag .eq. 1) then
2129 ib = ngb(ig)
2130 if (wavenum2(ib) .gt. 1.43e04_rb) then
2131 icx = 1
2132 elseif (wavenum2(ib) .gt. 7.7e03_rb) then
2133 icx = 2
2134 elseif (wavenum2(ib) .gt. 5.3e03_rb) then
2135 icx = 3
2136 elseif (wavenum2(ib) .gt. 4.0e03_rb) then
2137 icx = 4
2138 elseif (wavenum2(ib) .ge. 2.5e03_rb) then
2139 icx = 5
2140 endif
2141 extcoice(ig) = (abari(icx) + bbari(icx)/radice)
2142 ssacoice(ig) = 1._rb - cbari(icx) - dbari(icx) * radice
2143 gice(ig) = ebari(icx) + fbari(icx) * radice
2144! Check to ensure upper limit of gice is within physical limits for large particles
2145 if (gice(ig).ge.1._rb) gice(ig) = 1._rb - eps
2146 forwice(ig) = gice(ig)*gice(ig)
2147! Check to ensure all calculated quantities are within physical limits.
2148 if (extcoice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE EXTINCTION LESS THAN 0.0'
2149 if (ssacoice(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'ICE SSA GRTR THAN 1.0'
2150 if (ssacoice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE SSA LESS THAN 0.0'
2151 if (gice(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'ICE ASYM GRTR THAN 1.0'
2152 if (gice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE ASYM LESS THAN 0.0'
2153
2154! For iceflag=2 option, ice particle effective radius is limited to 5.0 to 131.0 microns
2155
2156 elseif (iceflag .eq. 2) then
2157 if (radice .lt. 5.0_rb .or. radice .gt. 131.0_rb) stop 'ICE RADIUS OUT OF BOUNDS'
2158 factor = (radice - 2._rb)/3._rb
2159 index = int(factor)
2160 if (index .eq. 43) index = 42
2161 fint = factor - float(index)
2162 ib = ngb(ig)
2163 extcoice(ig) = extice2(index,ib) + fint * &
2164 (extice2(index+1,ib) - extice2(index,ib))
2165 ssacoice(ig) = ssaice2(index,ib) + fint * &
2166 (ssaice2(index+1,ib) - ssaice2(index,ib))
2167 gice(ig) = asyice2(index,ib) + fint * &
2168 (asyice2(index+1,ib) - asyice2(index,ib))
2169 forwice(ig) = gice(ig)*gice(ig)
2170! Check to ensure all calculated quantities are within physical limits.
2171 if (extcoice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE EXTINCTION LESS THAN 0.0'
2172 if (ssacoice(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'ICE SSA GRTR THAN 1.0'
2173 if (ssacoice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE SSA LESS THAN 0.0'
2174 if (gice(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'ICE ASYM GRTR THAN 1.0'
2175 if (gice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE ASYM LESS THAN 0.0'
2176
2177! For iceflag=3 option, ice particle generalized effective size is limited to 5.0 to 140.0 microns
2178
2179 elseif (iceflag .ge. 3) then
2180 if (radice .lt. 5.0_rb .or. radice .gt. 140.0_rb) then
2181 write(errmess,'(A,i5,i5,f8.2,f8.2)' ) &
2182 'ERROR: ICE GENERALIZED EFFECTIVE SIZE OUT OF BOUNDS' &
2183 ,ig, lay, ciwpmc(ig,lay), radice
2184 fatal_error(errmess)
2185 end if
2186 factor = (radice - 2._rb)/3._rb
2187 index = int(factor)
2188 if (index .eq. 46) index = 45
2189 fint = factor - float(index)
2190 ib = ngb(ig)
2191 extcoice(ig) = extice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2192 (extice3(index+1,ib) - extice3(index,ib))
2193 ssacoice(ig) = ssaice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2194 (ssaice3(index+1,ib) - ssaice3(index,ib))
2195 gice(ig) = asyice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2196 (asyice3(index+1,ib) - asyice3(index,ib))
2197 fdelta(ig) = fdlice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2198 (fdlice3(index+1,ib) - fdlice3(index,ib))
2199 if (fdelta(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) then
2200 write(errmess, *) 'FDELTA LESS THAN 0.0'
2201 fatal_error(errmess)
2202 end if
2203 if (fdelta(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) then
2204 write(errmess, *) 'FDELTA GT THAN 1.0'
2205 fatal_error(errmess)
2206 end if
2207 forwice(ig) = fdelta(ig) + 0.5_rb / ssacoice(ig)
2208! See Fu 1996 p. 2067
2209 if (forwice(ig) .gt. gice(ig)) forwice(ig) = gice(ig)
2210! Check to ensure all calculated quantities are within physical limits.
2211 if (extcoice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE EXTINCTION LESS THAN 0.0'
2212 if (ssacoice(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'ICE SSA GRTR THAN 1.0'
2213 if (ssacoice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE SSA LESS THAN 0.0'
2214 if (gice(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'ICE ASYM GRTR THAN 1.0'
2215 if (gice(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'ICE ASYM LESS THAN 0.0'
2216
2217 endif
2218
2219!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Mukul !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
2220!!!! INSERT THE EQUIVALENT SNOW VARIABLE CODE HERE
2221!!!! Although far from perfect, the snow will utilize the
2222!!!! same lookup table constants as cloud ice. Changes
2223!!!! to those constants for larger particle snow would be
2224!!!! an improvement.
2225!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
2226
2227 if (cswpmc(ig,lay).gt.0.0_rb .and. iceflag .eq. 5) then
2228 radsno = resnmc(lay)
2229 if (radsno .lt. 5.0_rb .or. radsno .gt. 140.0_rb) then
2230 write(errmess,'(A,i5,i5,f8.2,f8.2)' ) &
2231 'ERROR: SNOW GENERALIZED EFFECTIVE SIZE OUT OF BOUNDS' &
2232 ,ig, lay, cswpmc(ig,lay), radsno
2233 fatal_error(errmess)
2234 end if
2235 factor = (radsno - 2._rb)/3._rb
2236 index = int(factor)
2237 if (index .eq. 46) index = 45
2238 fint = factor - float(index)
2239 ib = ngb(ig)
2240 extcosno(ig) = extice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2241 (extice3(index+1,ib) - extice3(index,ib))
2242 ssacosno(ig) = ssaice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2243 (ssaice3(index+1,ib) - ssaice3(index,ib))
2244 gsno(ig) = asyice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2245 (asyice3(index+1,ib) - asyice3(index,ib))
2246 fdelta(ig) = fdlice3(index,ib) + fint * &
2247 (fdlice3(index+1,ib) - fdlice3(index,ib))
2248 if (fdelta(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) then
2249 write(errmess, *) 'FDELTA LESS THAN 0.0'
2250 fatal_error(errmess)
2251 end if
2252 if (fdelta(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) then
2253 write(errmess, *) 'FDELTA GT THAN 1.0'
2254 fatal_error(errmess)
2255 end if
2256 forwsno(ig) = fdelta(ig) + 0.5_rb / ssacosno(ig)
2257! See Fu 1996 p. 2067
2258 if (forwsno(ig) .gt. gsno(ig)) forwsno(ig) = gsno(ig)
2259! Check to ensure all calculated quantities are within physical limits.
2260 if (extcosno(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) then
2261 write(errmess, *) 'SNOW EXTINCTION LESS THAN 0.0'
2262 fatal_error(errmess)
2263 end if
2264 if (ssacosno(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) then
2265 write(errmess, *) 'SNOW SSA GRTR THAN 1.0'
2266 fatal_error(errmess)
2267 end if
2268 if (ssacosno(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) then
2269 write(errmess, *) 'SNOW SSA LESS THAN 0.0'
2270 fatal_error(errmess)
2271 end if
2272 if (gsno(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) then
2273 write(errmess, *) 'SNOW ASYM GRTR THAN 1.0'
2274 fatal_error(errmess)
2275 end if
2276 if (gsno(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) then
2277 write(errmess, *) 'SNOW ASYM LESS THAN 0.0'
2278 fatal_error(errmess)
2279 end if
2280 else
2281 extcosno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2282 ssacosno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2283 gsno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2284 forwsno(ig) = 0.0_rb
2285 endif
2286
2287
2288! Calculation of absorption coefficients due to water clouds.
2289 if (clwpmc(ig,lay) .eq. 0.0_rb) then
2290 extcoliq(ig) = 0.0_rb
2291 ssacoliq(ig) = 0.0_rb
2292 gliq(ig) = 0.0_rb
2293 forwliq(ig) = 0.0_rb
2294
2295 elseif (liqflag .eq. 1) then
2296 radliq = relqmc(lay)
2297 if (radliq .lt. 1.5_rb .or. radliq .gt. 60._rb) stop &
2298 'liquid effective radius out of bounds'
2299 index = int(radliq - 1.5_rb)
2300 if (index .eq. 0) index = 1
2301 if (index .eq. 58) index = 57
2302 fint = radliq - 1.5_rb - float(index)
2303 ib = ngb(ig)
2304 extcoliq(ig) = extliq1(index,ib) + fint * &
2305 (extliq1(index+1,ib) - extliq1(index,ib))
2306 ssacoliq(ig) = ssaliq1(index,ib) + fint * &
2307 (ssaliq1(index+1,ib) - ssaliq1(index,ib))
2308 if (fint .lt. 0._rb .and. ssacoliq(ig) .gt. 1._rb) &
2309 ssacoliq(ig) = ssaliq1(index,ib)
2310 gliq(ig) = asyliq1(index,ib) + fint * &
2311 (asyliq1(index+1,ib) - asyliq1(index,ib))
2312 forwliq(ig) = gliq(ig)*gliq(ig)
2313! Check to ensure all calculated quantities are within physical limits.
2314 if (extcoliq(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'LIQUID EXTINCTION LESS THAN 0.0'
2315 if (ssacoliq(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'LIQUID SSA GRTR THAN 1.0'
2316 if (ssacoliq(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'LIQUID SSA LESS THAN 0.0'
2317 if (gliq(ig) .gt. 1.0_rb) stop 'LIQUID ASYM GRTR THAN 1.0'
2318 if (gliq(ig) .lt. 0.0_rb) stop 'LIQUID ASYM LESS THAN 0.0'
2319 endif
2320
2321
2322 if (iceflag .lt. 5) then
2323 tauliqorig = clwpmc(ig,lay) * extcoliq(ig)
2324 tauiceorig = ciwpmc(ig,lay) * extcoice(ig)
2325 taormc(ig,lay) = tauliqorig + tauiceorig
2326
2327 ssaliq = ssacoliq(ig) * (1._rb - forwliq(ig)) / &
2328 (1._rb - forwliq(ig) * ssacoliq(ig))
2329 tauliq = (1._rb - forwliq(ig) * ssacoliq(ig)) * tauliqorig
2330 ssaice = ssacoice(ig) * (1._rb - forwice(ig)) / &
2331 (1._rb - forwice(ig) * ssacoice(ig))
2332 tauice = (1._rb - forwice(ig) * ssacoice(ig)) * tauiceorig
2333 scatliq = ssaliq * tauliq
2334 scatice = ssaice * tauice
2335 scatsno = 0.0_rb
2336 taucmc(ig,lay) = tauliq + tauice
2337 else
2338 tauliqorig = clwpmc(ig,lay) * extcoliq(ig)
2339 tauiceorig = ciwpmc(ig,lay) * extcoice(ig)
2340 tausnoorig = cswpmc(ig,lay) * extcosno(ig)
2341 taormc(ig,lay) = tauliqorig + tauiceorig + tausnoorig
2342
2343 ssaliq = ssacoliq(ig) * (1._rb - forwliq(ig)) / &
2344 (1._rb - forwliq(ig) * ssacoliq(ig))
2345 tauliq = (1._rb - forwliq(ig) * ssacoliq(ig)) * tauliqorig
2346 ssaice = ssacoice(ig) * (1._rb - forwice(ig)) / &
2347 (1._rb - forwice(ig) * ssacoice(ig))
2348 tauice = (1._rb - forwice(ig) * ssacoice(ig)) * tauiceorig
2349 ssasno = ssacosno(ig) * (1._rb - forwsno(ig)) / &
2350 (1._rb - forwsno(ig) * ssacosno(ig))
2351 tausno = (1._rb - forwsno(ig) * ssacosno(ig)) * tausnoorig
2352 scatliq = ssaliq * tauliq
2353 scatice = ssaice * tauice
2354 scatsno = ssasno * tausno
2355 taucmc(ig,lay) = tauliq + tauice + tausno
2356 endif
2357
2358! Ensure non-zero taucmc and scatice
2359 if(taucmc(ig,lay).eq.0.) taucmc(ig,lay) = cldmin
2360 if(scatice.eq.0.) scatice = cldmin
2361 if(scatsno.eq.0.) scatsno = cldmin
2362
2363 if (iceflag .lt. 5) then
2364 ssacmc(ig,lay) = (scatliq + scatice) / taucmc(ig,lay)
2365 else
2366 ssacmc(ig,lay) = (scatliq + scatice + scatsno) / taucmc(ig,lay)
2367 endif
2368
2369 if (iceflag .eq. 3 .or. iceflag.eq.4) then
2370! In accordance with the 1996 Fu paper, equation A.3,
2371! the moments for ice were calculated depending on whether using spheres
2372! or hexagonal ice crystals.
2373! Set asymetry parameter to first moment (istr=1)
2374 istr = 1
2375 asmcmc(ig,lay) = (1.0_rb/(scatliq+scatice))* &
2376 (scatliq*(gliq(ig)**istr - forwliq(ig)) / &
2377 (1.0_rb - forwliq(ig)) + scatice * ((gice(ig)-forwice(ig))/ &
2378 (1.0_rb - forwice(ig)))**istr)
2379 elseif (iceflag .eq. 5) then
2380 istr = 1
2381 asmcmc(ig,lay) = (1.0_rb/(scatliq+scatice+scatsno)) &
2382 * (scatliq*(gliq(ig)**istr - forwliq(ig))/(1.0_rb - forwliq(ig)) &
2383 + scatice * ((gice(ig)-forwice(ig))/(1.0_rb - forwice(ig))) &
