2384 + scatsno * ((gsno(ig)-forwsno(ig))/(1.0_rb - forwsno(ig)))**istr)
2385
2386 else
2387! This code is the standard method for delta-m scaling.
2388! Set asymetry parameter to first moment (istr=1)
2389 istr = 1
2390 asmcmc(ig,lay) = (scatliq * &
2391 (gliq(ig)**istr - forwliq(ig)) / &
2392 (1.0_rb - forwliq(ig)) + scatice * (gice(ig)**istr - forwice(ig)) / &
2393 (1.0_rb - forwice(ig)))/(scatliq + scatice)
2394 endif
2395
2396 endif
2397
2398 endif
2399
2400! End g-point interval loop
2401 enddo
2402
2403! End layer loop
2404 enddo
2405
2406 end subroutine cldprmc_sw
2407
2408 end module rrtmg_sw_cldprmc
2409
2410! path: $Source: /cvsroot/NWP/WRFV3/phys/module_ra_rrtmg_sw.F,v $
2411! author: $Author: trn $
2412! revision: $Revision: 1.3 $
2413! created: $Date: 2009/04/16 19:54:22 $
2414
2415 module rrtmg_sw_reftra
2416
2417! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2418! | |
2419! | Copyright 2002-2008, Atmospheric & Environmental Research, Inc. (AER). |
2420! | This software may be used, copied, or redistributed as long as it is |
2421! | not sold and this copyright notice is reproduced on each copy made. |
2422! | This model is provided as is without any express or implied warranties. |
2423! | (http://www.rtweb.aer.com/) |
2424! | |
2425! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2426
2427! ------- Modules -------
2428
2429 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
2430 use rrsw_tbl, only : tblint, bpade, od_lo, exp_tbl
2431 use rrsw_vsn, only : hvrrft, hnamrft
2432
2433 implicit none
2434
2435 contains
2436
2437! --------------------------------------------------------------------
2438 subroutine reftra_sw(nlayers, lrtchk, pgg, prmuz, ptau, pw, &
2439 pref, prefd, ptra, ptrad)
2440! --------------------------------------------------------------------
2441
2442! Purpose: computes the reflectivity and transmissivity of a clear or
2443! cloudy layer using a choice of various approximations.
2444!
2445! Interface: *rrtmg_sw_reftra* is called by *rrtmg_sw_spcvrt*
2446!
2447! Description:
2448! explicit arguments :
2449! --------------------
2450! inputs
2451! ------
2452! lrtchk = .t. for all layers in clear profile
2453! lrtchk = .t. for cloudy layers in cloud profile
2454! = .f. for clear layers in cloud profile
2455! pgg = assymetry factor
2456! prmuz = cosine solar zenith angle
2457! ptau = optical thickness
2458! pw = single scattering albedo
2459!
2460! outputs
2461! -------
2462! pref : collimated beam reflectivity
2463! prefd : diffuse beam reflectivity
2464! ptra : collimated beam transmissivity
2465! ptrad : diffuse beam transmissivity
2466!
2467!
2468! Method:
2469! -------
2470! standard delta-eddington, p.i.f.m., or d.o.m. layer calculations.
2471! kmodts = 1 eddington (joseph et al., 1976)
2472! = 2 pifm (zdunkowski et al., 1980)
2473! = 3 discrete ordinates (liou, 1973)
2474!
2475!
2476! Modifications:
2477! --------------
2478! Original: J-JMorcrette, ECMWF, Feb 2003
2479! Revised for F90 reformatting: MJIacono, AER, Jul 2006
2480! Revised to add exponential lookup table: MJIacono, AER, Aug 2007
2481! Reformulated some code to avoid potential fpes: MJIacono, AER, Nov 2008
2482!
2483! ------------------------------------------------------------------
2484
2485! ------- Declarations ------
2486
2487! ------- Input -------
2488
2489 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nlayers
2490
2491 logical, intent(in) :: lrtchk(:) ! Logical flag for reflectivity and
2492 ! and transmissivity calculation;
2493 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2494
2495 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: pgg(:) ! asymmetry parameter
2496 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2497 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ptau(:) ! optical depth
2498 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2499 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: pw(:) ! single scattering albedo
2500 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2501 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: prmuz ! cosine of solar zenith angle
2502
2503! ------- Output -------
2504
2505 real(kind=rb), intent(inout) :: pref(:) ! direct beam reflectivity
2506 ! Dimensions: (nlayers+1)
2507 real(kind=rb), intent(inout) :: prefd(:) ! diffuse beam reflectivity
2508 ! Dimensions: (nlayers+1)
2509 real(kind=rb), intent(inout) :: ptra(:) ! direct beam transmissivity
2510 ! Dimensions: (nlayers+1)
2511 real(kind=rb), intent(inout) :: ptrad(:) ! diffuse beam transmissivity
2512 ! Dimensions: (nlayers+1)
2513
2514! ------- Local -------
2515
2516 integer(kind=im) :: jk, jl, kmodts
2517 integer(kind=im) :: itind
2518
2519 real(kind=rb) :: tblind
2520 real(kind=rb) :: za, za1, za2
2521 real(kind=rb) :: zbeta, zdend, zdenr, zdent
2522 real(kind=rb) :: ze1, ze2, zem1, zem2, zemm, zep1, zep2
2523 real(kind=rb) :: zg, zg3, zgamma1, zgamma2, zgamma3, zgamma4, zgt
2524 real(kind=rb) :: zr1, zr2, zr3, zr4, zr5
2525 real(kind=rb) :: zrk, zrk2, zrkg, zrm1, zrp, zrp1, zrpp
2526 real(kind=rb) :: zsr3, zt1, zt2, zt3, zt4, zt5, zto1
2527 real(kind=rb) :: zw, zwcrit, zwo
2528 real(kind=rb) :: denom
2529
2530 real(kind=rb), parameter :: eps = 1.e-08_rb
2531
2532! ------------------------------------------------------------------
2533
2534! Initialize
2535
2536!jm not thread safe hvrrft = '$Revision: 1.3 $'
2537
2538 zsr3=sqrt(3._rb)
2539 zwcrit=0.9999995_rb
2540 kmodts=2
2541
2542 do jk=1, nlayers
2543 if (.not.lrtchk(jk)) then
2544 pref(jk) =0._rb
2545 ptra(jk) =1._rb
2546 prefd(jk)=0._rb
2547 ptrad(jk)=1._rb
2548 else
2549 zto1=ptau(jk)
2550 zw =pw(jk)
2551 zg =pgg(jk)
2552
2553! General two-stream expressions
2554
2555 zg3= 3._rb * zg
2556 if (kmodts == 1) then
2557 zgamma1= (7._rb - zw * (4._rb + zg3)) * 0.25_rb
2558 zgamma2=-(1._rb - zw * (4._rb - zg3)) * 0.25_rb
2559 zgamma3= (2._rb - zg3 * prmuz ) * 0.25_rb
2560 else if (kmodts == 2) then
2561 zgamma1= (8._rb - zw * (5._rb + zg3)) * 0.25_rb
2562 zgamma2= 3._rb *(zw * (1._rb - zg )) * 0.25_rb
2563 zgamma3= (2._rb - zg3 * prmuz ) * 0.25_rb
2564 else if (kmodts == 3) then
2565 zgamma1= zsr3 * (2._rb - zw * (1._rb + zg)) * 0.5_rb
2566 zgamma2= zsr3 * zw * (1._rb - zg ) * 0.5_rb
2567 zgamma3= (1._rb - zsr3 * zg * prmuz ) * 0.5_rb
2568 end if
2569 zgamma4= 1._rb - zgamma3
2570
2571! Recompute original s.s.a. to test for conservative solution
2572 !Balwinder.Singh@pnnl.gov: Code added to avoid 'divide by zero' error in zwo computation
2573 denom = max((1._rb - (1._rb - zw) * (zg / (1._rb - zg))**2),1.0e-30_rb)
2574 zwo= zw / denom
2575
2576 if (zwo >= zwcrit) then
2577! Conservative scattering
2578
2579 za = zgamma1 * prmuz
2580 za1 = za - zgamma3
2581 zgt = zgamma1 * zto1
2582
2583! Homogeneous reflectance and transmittance,
2584! collimated beam
2585
2586 ze1 = min( zto1 / prmuz , 500._rb)
2587! ze2 = exp( -ze1 )
2588
2589! Use exponential lookup table for transmittance, or expansion of
2590! exponential for low tau
2591 if (ze1 .le. od_lo) then
2592 ze2 = 1._rb - ze1 + 0.5_rb * ze1 * ze1
2593 else
2594 tblind = ze1 / (bpade + ze1)
2595 itind = tblint * tblind + 0.5_rb
2596 ze2 = exp_tbl(itind)
2597 endif
2598!
2599
2600 pref(jk) = (zgt - za1 * (1._rb - ze2)) / (1._rb + zgt)
2601 ptra(jk) = 1._rb - pref(jk)
2602
2603! isotropic incidence
2604
2605 prefd(jk) = zgt / (1._rb + zgt)
2606 ptrad(jk) = 1._rb - prefd(jk)
2607
2608! This is applied for consistency between total (delta-scaled) and direct (unscaled)
2609! calculations at very low optical depths (tau < 1.e-4) when the exponential lookup
2610! table returns a transmittance of 1.0.
2611 if (ze2 .eq. 1.0_rb) then
2612 pref(jk) = 0.0_rb
2613 ptra(jk) = 1.0_rb
2614 prefd(jk) = 0.0_rb
2615 ptrad(jk) = 1.0_rb
2616 endif
2617
2618 else
2619! Non-conservative scattering
2620
2621 za1 = zgamma1 * zgamma4 + zgamma2 * zgamma3
2622 za2 = zgamma1 * zgamma3 + zgamma2 * zgamma4
2623 zrk = sqrt( zgamma1**2 - zgamma2**2)
2624 zrp = zrk * prmuz
2625 zrp1 = 1._rb + zrp
2626 zrm1 = 1._rb - zrp
2627 zrk2 = 2._rb * zrk
2628 zrpp = 1._rb - zrp*zrp
2629 zrkg = zrk + zgamma1
2630 zr1 = zrm1 * (za2 + zrk * zgamma3)
2631 zr2 = zrp1 * (za2 - zrk * zgamma3)
2632 zr3 = zrk2 * (zgamma3 - za2 * prmuz )
2633 zr4 = zrpp * zrkg
2634 zr5 = zrpp * (zrk - zgamma1)
2635 zt1 = zrp1 * (za1 + zrk * zgamma4)
2636 zt2 = zrm1 * (za1 - zrk * zgamma4)
2637 zt3 = zrk2 * (zgamma4 + za1 * prmuz )
2638 zt4 = zr4
2639 zt5 = zr5
2640
2641! mji - reformulated code to avoid potential floating point exceptions
2642! zbeta = - zr5 / zr4
2643 zbeta = (zgamma1 - zrk) / zrkg
2644!!
2645
2646! Homogeneous reflectance and transmittance
2647
2648 ze1 = min( zrk * zto1, 500._rb)
2649 ze2 = min( zto1 / prmuz , 500._rb)
2650!
2651! Original
2652! zep1 = exp( ze1 )
2653! zem1 = exp(-ze1 )
2654! zep2 = exp( ze2 )
2655! zem2 = exp(-ze2 )
2656!
2657! Revised original, to reduce exponentials
2658! zep1 = exp( ze1 )
2659! zem1 = 1._rb / zep1
2660! zep2 = exp( ze2 )
2661! zem2 = 1._rb / zep2
2662!
2663! Use exponential lookup table for transmittance, or expansion of
2664! exponential for low tau
2665 if (ze1 .le. od_lo) then
2666 zem1 = 1._rb - ze1 + 0.5_rb * ze1 * ze1
2667 zep1 = 1._rb / zem1
2668 else
2669 tblind = ze1 / (bpade + ze1)
2670 itind = tblint * tblind + 0.5_rb
2671 zem1 = exp_tbl(itind)
2672 zep1 = 1._rb / zem1
2673 endif
2674
2675 if (ze2 .le. od_lo) then
2676 zem2 = 1._rb - ze2 + 0.5_rb * ze2 * ze2
2677 zep2 = 1._rb / zem2
2678 else
2679 tblind = ze2 / (bpade + ze2)
2680 itind = tblint * tblind + 0.5_rb
2681 zem2 = exp_tbl(itind)
2682 zep2 = 1._rb / zem2
2683 endif
2684
2685! collimated beam
2686
2687! mji - reformulated code to avoid potential floating point exceptions
2688! zdenr = zr4*zep1 + zr5*zem1
2689! pref(jk) = zw * (zr1*zep1 - zr2*zem1 - zr3*zem2) / zdenr
2690! zdent = zt4*zep1 + zt5*zem1
2691! ptra(jk) = zem2 - zem2 * zw * (zt1*zep1 - zt2*zem1 - zt3*zep2) / zdent
2692
2693 zdenr = zr4*zep1 + zr5*zem1
2694 zdent = zt4*zep1 + zt5*zem1
2695 if (zdenr .ge. -eps .and. zdenr .le. eps) then
2696 pref(jk) = eps
2697 ptra(jk) = zem2
2698 else
2699 pref(jk) = zw * (zr1*zep1 - zr2*zem1 - zr3*zem2) / zdenr
2700 ptra(jk) = zem2 - zem2 * zw * (zt1*zep1 - zt2*zem1 - zt3*zep2) / zdent
2701 endif
2702!!
2703
2704! diffuse beam
2705
2706 zemm = zem1*zem1
2707 zdend = 1._rb / ( (1._rb - zbeta*zemm ) * zrkg)
2708 prefd(jk) = zgamma2 * (1._rb - zemm) * zdend
2709 ptrad(jk) = zrk2*zem1*zdend
2710
2711 endif
2712
2713 endif
2714
2715 enddo
2716
2717 end subroutine reftra_sw
2718
2719 end module rrtmg_sw_reftra
2720
2721! path: $Source: /cvsroot/NWP/WRFV3/phys/module_ra_rrtmg_sw.F,v $
2722! author: $Author: trn $
2723! revision: $Revision: 1.3 $
2724! created: $Date: 2009/04/16 19:54:22 $
2725
2726 module rrtmg_sw_setcoef
2727
2728! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2729! | |
2730! | Copyright 2002-2008, Atmospheric & Environmental Research, Inc. (AER). |
2731! | This software may be used, copied, or redistributed as long as it is |
2732! | not sold and this copyright notice is reproduced on each copy made. |
2733! | This model is provided as is without any express or implied warranties. |
2734! | (http://www.rtweb.aer.com/) |
2735! | |
2736! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2737
2738! ------- Modules -------
2739
2740 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
2741 use parrrsw, only : mxmol
2742 use rrsw_ref, only : pref, preflog, tref
2743 use rrsw_vsn, only : hvrset, hnamset
2744
2745 implicit none
2746
2747 contains
2748
2749!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2750 subroutine setcoef_sw(nlayers, pavel, tavel, pz, tz, tbound, coldry, wkl, &
2751 laytrop, layswtch, laylow, jp, jt, jt1, &
2752 co2mult, colch4, colco2, colh2o, colmol, coln2o, &
2753 colo2, colo3, fac00, fac01, fac10, fac11, &
2754 selffac, selffrac, indself, forfac, forfrac, indfor)
2755!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2756!
2757! Purpose: For a given atmosphere, calculate the indices and
2758! fractions related to the pressure and temperature interpolations.
2759
2760! Modifications:
2761! Original: J. Delamere, AER, Inc. (version 2.5, 02/04/01)
2762! Revised: Rewritten and adapted to ECMWF F90, JJMorcrette 030224
2763! Revised: For uniform rrtmg formatting, MJIacono, Jul 2006
2764
2765! ------ Declarations -------
2766
2767! ----- Input -----
2768 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nlayers ! total number of layers
2769
2770 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: pavel(:) ! layer pressures (mb)
2771 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2772 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tavel(:) ! layer temperatures (K)
2773 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2774 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: pz(0:) ! level (interface) pressures (hPa, mb)
2775 ! Dimensions: (0:nlayers)
2776 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tz(0:) ! level (interface) temperatures (K)
2777 ! Dimensions: (0:nlayers)
2778 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tbound ! surface temperature (K)
2779 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: coldry(:) ! dry air column density (mol/cm2)
2780 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2781 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: wkl(:,:) ! molecular amounts (mol/cm-2)
2782 ! Dimensions: (mxmol,nlayers)
2783
2784! ----- Output -----
2785 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: laytrop ! tropopause layer index
2786 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: layswtch !
2787 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: laylow !
2788
2789 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: jp(:) !
2790 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2791 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: jt(:) !
2792 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2793 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: jt1(:) !
2794 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2795
2796 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: colh2o(:) ! column amount (h2o)
2797 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2798 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: colco2(:) ! column amount (co2)
2799 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2800 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: colo3(:) ! column amount (o3)
2801 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2802 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: coln2o(:) ! column amount (n2o)
2803 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2804 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: colch4(:) ! column amount (ch4)
2805 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2806 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: colo2(:) ! column amount (o2)
2807 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2808 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: colmol(:) !
2809 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2810 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: co2mult(:) !
2811 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2812
2813 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: indself(:)
2814 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2815 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: indfor(:)
2816 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2817 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: selffac(:)
2818 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2819 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: selffrac(:)
2820 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2821 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: forfac(:)
2822 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2823 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: forfrac(:)
2824 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2825
2826 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: & !
2827 fac00(:), fac01(:), & ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
2828 fac10(:), fac11(:)
2829
2830! ----- Local -----
2831
2832 integer(kind=im) :: indbound
2833 integer(kind=im) :: indlev0
2834 integer(kind=im) :: lay
2835 integer(kind=im) :: jp1
2836
2837 real(kind=rb) :: stpfac
2838 real(kind=rb) :: tbndfrac
2839 real(kind=rb) :: t0frac
2840 real(kind=rb) :: plog
2841 real(kind=rb) :: fp
2842 real(kind=rb) :: ft
2843 real(kind=rb) :: ft1
2844 real(kind=rb) :: water
2845 real(kind=rb) :: scalefac
2846 real(kind=rb) :: factor
2847 real(kind=rb) :: co2reg
2848 real(kind=rb) :: compfp
2849
2850
2851! Initializations
2852 stpfac = 296._rb/1013._rb
2853
2854 indbound = tbound - 159._rb
2855 tbndfrac = tbound - int(tbound)
2856 indlev0 = tz(0) - 159._rb
2857 t0frac = tz(0) - int(tz(0))
2858
2859 laytrop = 0
2860 layswtch = 0
2861 laylow = 0
2862
2863! Begin layer loop
2864 do lay = 1, nlayers
2865! Find the two reference pressures on either side of the
2866! layer pressure. Store them in JP and JP1. Store in FP the
2867! fraction of the difference (in ln(pressure)) between these
2868! two values that the layer pressure lies.
2869
2870 plog = log(pavel(lay))
2871 jp(lay) = int(36._rb - 5*(plog+0.04_rb))
2872 if (jp(lay) .lt. 1) then
2873 jp(lay) = 1
2874 elseif (jp(lay) .gt. 58) then
2875 jp(lay) = 58
2876 endif
2877 jp1 = jp(lay) + 1
2878 fp = 5._rb * (preflog(jp(lay)) - plog)
2879
2880! Determine, for each reference pressure (JP and JP1), which
2881! reference temperature (these are different for each
2882! reference pressure) is nearest the layer temperature but does
2883! not exceed it. Store these indices in JT and JT1, resp.
2884! Store in FT (resp. FT1) the fraction of the way between JT
2885! (JT1) and the next highest reference temperature that the
2886! layer temperature falls.
2887
2888 jt(lay) = int(3._rb + (tavel(lay)-tref(jp(lay)))/15._rb)
2889 if (jt(lay) .lt. 1) then
2890 jt(lay) = 1
2891 elseif (jt(lay) .gt. 4) then
2892 jt(lay) = 4
2893 endif
2894 ft = ((tavel(lay)-tref(jp(lay)))/15._rb) - float(jt(lay)-3)
2895 jt1(lay) = int(3._rb + (tavel(lay)-tref(jp1))/15._rb)
2896 if (jt1(lay) .lt. 1) then
2897 jt1(lay) = 1
2898 elseif (jt1(lay) .gt. 4) then
2899 jt1(lay) = 4
2900 endif
2901 ft1 = ((tavel(lay)-tref(jp1))/15._rb) - float(jt1(lay)-3)
2902
2903 water = wkl(1,lay)/coldry(lay)
2904 scalefac = pavel(lay) * stpfac / tavel(lay)
2905
2906! If the pressure is less than ~100mb, perform a different
2907! set of species interpolations.
2908
2909 if (plog .le. 4.56_rb) go to 5300
2910 laytrop = laytrop + 1
2911 if (plog .ge. 6.62_rb) laylow = laylow + 1
2912
2913! Set up factors needed to separately include the water vapor
2914! foreign-continuum in the calculation of absorption coefficient.
2915
2916 forfac(lay) = scalefac / (1.+water)
2917 factor = (332.0_rb-tavel(lay))/36.0_rb
2918 indfor(lay) = min(2, max(1, int(factor)))
2919 forfrac(lay) = factor - float(indfor(lay))
2920
2921! Set up factors needed to separately include the water vapor
2922! self-continuum in the calculation of absorption coefficient.
2923
2924 selffac(lay) = water * forfac(lay)
2925 factor = (tavel(lay)-188.0_rb)/7.2_rb
2926 indself(lay) = min(9, max(1, int(factor)-7))
2927 selffrac(lay) = factor - float(indself(lay) + 7)
2928
2929! Calculate needed column amounts.
2930
2931 colh2o(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(1,lay)
2932 colco2(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(2,lay)
2933 colo3(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(3,lay)
2934! colo3(lay) = 0._rb
2935! colo3(lay) = colo3(lay)/1.16_rb
2936 coln2o(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(4,lay)
2937 colch4(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(6,lay)
2938 colo2(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(7,lay)
2939 colmol(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * coldry(lay) + colh2o(lay)
2940! colco2(lay) = 0._rb
2941! colo3(lay) = 0._rb
2942! coln2o(lay) = 0._rb
2943! colch4(lay) = 0._rb
2944! colo2(lay) = 0._rb
2945! colmol(lay) = 0._rb
2946 if (colco2(lay) .eq. 0._rb) colco2(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2947 if (coln2o(lay) .eq. 0._rb) coln2o(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2948 if (colch4(lay) .eq. 0._rb) colch4(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2949 if (colo2(lay) .eq. 0._rb) colo2(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2950! Using E = 1334.2 cm-1.
2951 co2reg = 3.55e-24_rb * coldry(lay)
2952 co2mult(lay)= (colco2(lay) - co2reg) * &
2953 272.63_rb*exp(-1919.4_rb/tavel(lay))/(8.7604e-4_rb*tavel(lay))
2954 goto 5400
2955
2956! Above laytrop.
2957 5300 continue
2958
2959! Set up factors needed to separately include the water vapor
2960! foreign-continuum in the calculation of absorption coefficient.
2961
2962 forfac(lay) = scalefac / (1.+water)
2963 factor = (tavel(lay)-188.0_rb)/36.0_rb
2964 indfor(lay) = 3
2965 forfrac(lay) = factor - 1.0_rb
2966
2967! Calculate needed column amounts.
2968
2969 colh2o(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(1,lay)
2970 colco2(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(2,lay)
2971 colo3(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(3,lay)
2972 coln2o(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(4,lay)
2973 colch4(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(6,lay)
2974 colo2(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * wkl(7,lay)
2975 colmol(lay) = 1.e-20_rb * coldry(lay) + colh2o(lay)
2976 if (colco2(lay) .eq. 0._rb) colco2(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2977 if (coln2o(lay) .eq. 0._rb) coln2o(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2978 if (colch4(lay) .eq. 0._rb) colch4(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2979 if (colo2(lay) .eq. 0._rb) colo2(lay) = 1.e-32_rb * coldry(lay)
2980 co2reg = 3.55e-24_rb * coldry(lay)
2981 co2mult(lay)= (colco2(lay) - co2reg) * &
2982 272.63_rb*exp(-1919.4_rb/tavel(lay))/(8.7604e-4_rb*tavel(lay))
2983
2984 selffac(lay) = 0._rb
2985 selffrac(lay)= 0._rb
2986 indself(lay) = 0
2987
2988 5400 continue
2989
2990! We have now isolated the layer ln pressure and temperature,
2991! between two reference pressures and two reference temperatures
2992! (for each reference pressure). We multiply the pressure
2993! fraction FP with the appropriate temperature fractions to get
2994! the factors that will be needed for the interpolation that yields
2995! the optical depths (performed in routines TAUGBn for band n).
2996
2997 compfp = 1._rb - fp
2998 fac10(lay) = compfp * ft
2999 fac00(lay) = compfp * (1._rb - ft)
3000 fac11(lay) = fp * ft1
3001 fac01(lay) = fp * (1._rb - ft1)
3002
3003! End layer loop
3004 enddo
3005
3006 end subroutine setcoef_sw
3007
3008!***************************************************************************
3009 subroutine swatmref
3010!***************************************************************************
3011
3012 save
3013
3014! These pressures are chosen such that the ln of the first pressure
3015! has only a few non-zero digits (i.e. ln(PREF(1)) = 6.96000) and
3016! each subsequent ln(pressure) differs from the previous one by 0.2.
3017
3018 pref(:) = (/ &
3019 1.05363e+03_rb,8.62642e+02_rb,7.06272e+02_rb,5.78246e+02_rb,4.73428e+02_rb, &
3020 3.87610e+02_rb,3.17348e+02_rb,2.59823e+02_rb,2.12725e+02_rb,1.74164e+02_rb, &
3021 1.42594e+02_rb,1.16746e+02_rb,9.55835e+01_rb,7.82571e+01_rb,6.40715e+01_rb, &
3022 5.24573e+01_rb,4.29484e+01_rb,3.51632e+01_rb,2.87892e+01_rb,2.35706e+01_rb, &
3023 1.92980e+01_rb,1.57998e+01_rb,1.29358e+01_rb,1.05910e+01_rb,8.67114e+00_rb, &
3024 7.09933e+00_rb,5.81244e+00_rb,4.75882e+00_rb,3.89619e+00_rb,3.18993e+00_rb, &
3025 2.61170e+00_rb,2.13828e+00_rb,1.75067e+00_rb,1.43333e+00_rb,1.17351e+00_rb, &
3026 9.60789e-01_rb,7.86628e-01_rb,6.44036e-01_rb,5.27292e-01_rb,4.31710e-01_rb, &
3027 3.53455e-01_rb,2.89384e-01_rb,2.36928e-01_rb,1.93980e-01_rb,1.58817e-01_rb, &
3028 1.30029e-01_rb,1.06458e-01_rb,8.71608e-02_rb,7.13612e-02_rb,5.84256e-02_rb, &
3029 4.78349e-02_rb,3.91639e-02_rb,3.20647e-02_rb,2.62523e-02_rb,2.14936e-02_rb, &
3030 1.75975e-02_rb,1.44076e-02_rb,1.17959e-02_rb,9.65769e-03_rb /)
3031
3032 preflog(:) = (/ &
3033 6.9600e+00_rb, 6.7600e+00_rb, 6.5600e+00_rb, 6.3600e+00_rb, 6.1600e+00_rb, &
3034 5.9600e+00_rb, 5.7600e+00_rb, 5.5600e+00_rb, 5.3600e+00_rb, 5.1600e+00_rb, &
3035 4.9600e+00_rb, 4.7600e+00_rb, 4.5600e+00_rb, 4.3600e+00_rb, 4.1600e+00_rb, &
3036 3.9600e+00_rb, 3.7600e+00_rb, 3.5600e+00_rb, 3.3600e+00_rb, 3.1600e+00_rb, &
3037 2.9600e+00_rb, 2.7600e+00_rb, 2.5600e+00_rb, 2.3600e+00_rb, 2.1600e+00_rb, &
3038 1.9600e+00_rb, 1.7600e+00_rb, 1.5600e+00_rb, 1.3600e+00_rb, 1.1600e+00_rb, &
3039 9.6000e-01_rb, 7.6000e-01_rb, 5.6000e-01_rb, 3.6000e-01_rb, 1.6000e-01_rb, &
3040 -4.0000e-02_rb,-2.4000e-01_rb,-4.4000e-01_rb,-6.4000e-01_rb,-8.4000e-01_rb, &
3041 -1.0400e+00_rb,-1.2400e+00_rb,-1.4400e+00_rb,-1.6400e+00_rb,-1.8400e+00_rb, &
3042 -2.0400e+00_rb,-2.2400e+00_rb,-2.4400e+00_rb,-2.6400e+00_rb,-2.8400e+00_rb, &
3043 -3.0400e+00_rb,-3.2400e+00_rb,-3.4400e+00_rb,-3.6400e+00_rb,-3.8400e+00_rb, &
3044 -4.0400e+00_rb,-4.2400e+00_rb,-4.4400e+00_rb,-4.6400e+00_rb /)
3045
3046! These are the temperatures associated with the respective
3047! pressures for the MLS standard atmosphere.
3048
3049 tref(:) = (/ &
3050 2.9420e+02_rb, 2.8799e+02_rb, 2.7894e+02_rb, 2.6925e+02_rb, 2.5983e+02_rb, &
3051 2.5017e+02_rb, 2.4077e+02_rb, 2.3179e+02_rb, 2.2306e+02_rb, 2.1578e+02_rb, &
3052 2.1570e+02_rb, 2.1570e+02_rb, 2.1570e+02_rb, 2.1706e+02_rb, 2.1858e+02_rb, &
3053 2.2018e+02_rb, 2.2174e+02_rb, 2.2328e+02_rb, 2.2479e+02_rb, 2.2655e+02_rb, &
3054 2.2834e+02_rb, 2.3113e+02_rb, 2.3401e+02_rb, 2.3703e+02_rb, 2.4022e+02_rb, &
3055 2.4371e+02_rb, 2.4726e+02_rb, 2.5085e+02_rb, 2.5457e+02_rb, 2.5832e+02_rb, &
3056 2.6216e+02_rb, 2.6606e+02_rb, 2.6999e+02_rb, 2.7340e+02_rb, 2.7536e+02_rb, &
3057 2.7568e+02_rb, 2.7372e+02_rb, 2.7163e+02_rb, 2.6955e+02_rb, 2.6593e+02_rb, &
3058 2.6211e+02_rb, 2.5828e+02_rb, 2.5360e+02_rb, 2.4854e+02_rb, 2.4348e+02_rb, &
3059 2.3809e+02_rb, 2.3206e+02_rb, 2.2603e+02_rb, 2.2000e+02_rb, 2.1435e+02_rb, &
3060 2.0887e+02_rb, 2.0340e+02_rb, 1.9792e+02_rb, 1.9290e+02_rb, 1.8809e+02_rb, &
3061 1.8329e+02_rb, 1.7849e+02_rb, 1.7394e+02_rb, 1.7212e+02_rb /)
3062
3063 end subroutine swatmref
3064
3065 end module rrtmg_sw_setcoef
3066
3067! path: $Source: /cvsroot/NWP/WRFV3/phys/module_ra_rrtmg_sw.F,v $
3068! author: $Author: trn $
3069! revision: $Revision: 1.3 $
3070! created: $Date: 2009/04/16 19:54:22 $
3071
3072 module rrtmg_sw_taumol
3073
3074! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3075! | |
3076! | Copyright 2002-2008, Atmospheric & Environmental Research, Inc. (AER). |
3077! | This software may be used, copied, or redistributed as long as it is |
3078! | not sold and this copyright notice is reproduced on each copy made. |
3079! | This model is provided as is without any express or implied warranties. |
3080! | (http://www.rtweb.aer.com/) |
3081! | |
3082! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
3083
3084! ------- Modules -------
3085
3086 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
3087! use parrrsw, only : mg, jpband, nbndsw, ngptsw
3088 use rrsw_con, only: oneminus
3089 use rrsw_wvn, only: nspa, nspb
3090 use rrsw_vsn, only: hvrtau, hnamtau
3091
3092 implicit none
3093
3094 contains
3095
3096!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3097 subroutine taumol_sw(nlayers, &
3098 colh2o, colco2, colch4, colo2, colo3, colmol, &
3099 laytrop, jp, jt, jt1, &
3100 fac00, fac01, fac10, fac11, &
3101 selffac, selffrac, indself, forfac, forfrac, indfor, &
3102 sfluxzen, taug, taur)
3103!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3104
3105! ******************************************************************************
3106! * *
3107! * Optical depths developed for the *
3108! * *
3109! * RAPID RADIATIVE TRANSFER MODEL (RRTM) *
3110! * *
3111! * *
3112! * ATMOSPHERIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH, INC. *
3113! * 131 HARTWELL AVENUE *
3114! * LEXINGTON, MA 02421 *
3115! * *
3116! * *
3117! * ELI J. MLAWER *
3118! * JENNIFER DELAMERE *
3119! * STEVEN J. TAUBMAN *
3120! * SHEPARD A. CLOUGH *
3121! * *
3122! * *
3123! * *
3124! * *
3125! * email: mlawer@aer.com *
3126! * email: jdelamer@aer.com *
3127! * *
3128! * The authors wish to acknowledge the contributions of the *
3129! * following people: Patrick D. Brown, Michael J. Iacono, *
3130! * Ronald E. Farren, Luke Chen, Robert Bergstrom. *
3131! * *
3132! ******************************************************************************
3133! * TAUMOL *
3134! * *
3135! * This file contains the subroutines TAUGBn (where n goes from *
3136! * 1 to 28). TAUGBn calculates the optical depths and Planck fractions *
3137! * per g-value and layer for band n. *
3138! * *
3139! * Output: optical depths (unitless) *
3140! * fractions needed to compute Planck functions at every layer *
3141! * and g-value *
3142! * *
3143! * COMMON /TAUGCOM/ TAUG(MXLAY,MG) *
3144! * COMMON /PLANKG/ FRACS(MXLAY,MG) *
3145! * *
3146! * Input *
3147! * *
3148! * PARAMETER (MG=16, MXLAY=203, NBANDS=14) *
3149! * *
3150! * COMMON /FEATURES/ NG(NBANDS),NSPA(NBANDS),NSPB(NBANDS) *
3151! * COMMON /PRECISE/ ONEMINUS *
3152! * COMMON /PROFILE/ NLAYERS,PAVEL(MXLAY),TAVEL(MXLAY), *
3153! * & PZ(0:MXLAY),TZ(0:MXLAY),TBOUND *
3154! * COMMON /PROFDATA/ LAYTROP,LAYSWTCH,LAYLOW, *
3155! * & COLH2O(MXLAY),COLCO2(MXLAY), *
3156! * & COLO3(MXLAY),COLN2O(MXLAY),COLCH4(MXLAY), *
3157! * & COLO2(MXLAY),CO2MULT(MXLAY) *
3158! * COMMON /INTFAC/ FAC00(MXLAY),FAC01(MXLAY), *
3159! * & FAC10(MXLAY),FAC11(MXLAY) *
3160! * COMMON /INTIND/ JP(MXLAY),JT(MXLAY),JT1(MXLAY) *
3161! * COMMON /SELF/ SELFFAC(MXLAY), SELFFRAC(MXLAY), INDSELF(MXLAY) *
3162! * *
3163! * Description: *
3164! * NG(IBAND) - number of g-values in band IBAND *
3165! * NSPA(IBAND) - for the lower atmosphere, the number of reference *
3166! * atmospheres that are stored for band IBAND per *
3167! * pressure level and temperature. Each of these *
3168! * atmospheres has different relative amounts of the *
3169! * key species for the band (i.e. different binary *
3170! * species parameters). *
3171! * NSPB(IBAND) - same for upper atmosphere *
3172! * ONEMINUS - since problems are caused in some cases by interpolation *
3173! * parameters equal to or greater than 1, for these cases *
3174! * these parameters are set to this value, slightly < 1. *
3175! * PAVEL - layer pressures (mb) *
3176! * TAVEL - layer temperatures (degrees K) *
3177! * PZ - level pressures (mb) *
3178! * TZ - level temperatures (degrees K) *
3179! * LAYTROP - layer at which switch is made from one combination of *
3180! * key species to another *
3181! * COLH2O, COLCO2, COLO3, COLN2O, COLCH4 - column amounts of water *
3182! * vapor,carbon dioxide, ozone, nitrous ozide, methane, *
3183! * respectively (molecules/cm**2) *
3184! * CO2MULT - for bands in which carbon dioxide is implemented as a *
3185! * trace species, this is the factor used to multiply the *
3186! * band's average CO2 absorption coefficient to get the added *
3187! * contribution to the optical depth relative to 355 ppm. *
3188! * FACij(LAY) - for layer LAY, these are factors that are needed to *
3189! * compute the interpolation factors that multiply the *
3190! * appropriate reference k-values. A value of 0 (1) for *
3191! * i,j indicates that the corresponding factor multiplies *
3192! * reference k-value for the lower (higher) of the two *
3193! * appropriate temperatures, and altitudes, respectively. *
3194! * JP - the index of the lower (in altitude) of the two appropriate *
3195! * reference pressure levels needed for interpolation *
3196! * JT, JT1 - the indices of the lower of the two appropriate reference *
3197! * temperatures needed for interpolation (for pressure *
3198! * levels JP and JP+1, respectively) *
3199! * SELFFAC - scale factor needed to water vapor self-continuum, equals *
3200! * (water vapor density)/(atmospheric density at 296K and *
3201! * 1013 mb) *
3202! * SELFFRAC - factor needed for temperature interpolation of reference *
3203! * water vapor self-continuum data *
3204! * INDSELF - index of the lower of the two appropriate reference *
3205! * temperatures needed for the self-continuum interpolation *
3206! * *
3207! * Data input *
3208! * COMMON /Kn/ KA(NSPA(n),5,13,MG), KB(NSPB(n),5,13:59,MG), SELFREF(10,MG) *
3209! * (note: n is the band number) *
3210! * *
3211! * Description: *
3212! * KA - k-values for low reference atmospheres (no water vapor *
3213! * self-continuum) (units: cm**2/molecule) *
3214! * KB - k-values for high reference atmospheres (all sources) *
3215! * (units: cm**2/molecule) *
3216! * SELFREF - k-values for water vapor self-continuum for reference *
3217! * atmospheres (used below LAYTROP) *
3218! * (units: cm**2/molecule) *
3219! * *
3220! * DIMENSION ABSA(65*NSPA(n),MG), ABSB(235*NSPB(n),MG) *
3221! * EQUIVALENCE (KA,ABSA),(KB,ABSB) *
3222! * *
3223! *****************************************************************************
3224!
3225! Modifications
3226!
3227! Revised: Adapted to F90 coding, J.-J.Morcrette, ECMWF, Feb 2003
3228! Revised: Modified for g-point reduction, MJIacono, AER, Dec 2003
3229! Revised: Reformatted for consistency with rrtmg_lw, MJIacono, AER, Jul 2006
3230!
3231! ------- Declarations -------
3232
3233! ----- Input -----
3234 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nlayers ! total number of layers
3235
3236 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: laytrop ! tropopause layer index
3237 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: jp(:) !
3238 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3239 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: jt(:) !
3240 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3241 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: jt1(:) !
3242 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3243
3244 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: colh2o(:) ! column amount (h2o)
3245 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3246 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: colco2(:) ! column amount (co2)
3247 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3248 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: colo3(:) ! column amount (o3)
3249 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3250 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: colch4(:) ! column amount (ch4)
3251 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3252 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3253 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: colo2(:) ! column amount (o2)
3254 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3255 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: colmol(:) !
3256 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3257
3258 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: indself(:)
3259 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3260 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: indfor(:)
3261 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3262 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: selffac(:)
3263 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3264 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: selffrac(:)
3265 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3266 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: forfac(:)
3267 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3268 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: forfrac(:)
3269 ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3270
3271 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: & !
3272 fac00(:), fac01(:), & ! Dimensions: (nlayers)
3273 fac10(:), fac11(:)
3274
3275! ----- Output -----
3276 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: sfluxzen(:) ! solar source function
3277 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw)
3278 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: taug(:,:) ! gaseous optical depth
3279 ! Dimensions: (nlayers,ngptsw)
3280 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: taur(:,:) ! Rayleigh
3281 ! Dimensions: (nlayers,ngptsw)
3282! real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ssa(:,:) ! single scattering albedo (inactive)
3283 ! Dimensions: (nlayers,ngptsw)
3284
3285!jm not thread safe hvrtau = '$Revision: 1.3 $'
3286
3287! Calculate gaseous optical depth and planck fractions for each spectral band.
3288
3289 call taumol16
3290 call taumol17
3291 call taumol18
3292 call taumol19
3293 call taumol20
3294 call taumol21
3295 call taumol22
3296 call taumol23
3297 call taumol24
3298 call taumol25
3299 call taumol26
3300 call taumol27
3301 call taumol28
3302 call taumol29
3303
3304!-------------
3305 contains
3306!-------------
3307
3308!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3309 subroutine taumol16
3310!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3311!
3312! band 16: 2600-3250 cm-1 (low - h2o,ch4; high - ch4)
3313!
3314!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3315
3316! ------- Modules -------
3317
3318 use parrrsw, only : ng16
3319 use rrsw_kg16, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
3320 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, strrat1
3321
3322! ------- Declarations -------
3323
3324! Local
3325
3326 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
3327 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
3328 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
3329 tauray
3330
3331! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
3332! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
3333! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
3334
3335! Lower atmosphere loop
3336 do lay = 1, laytrop
3337 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat1*colch4(lay)
3338 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3339 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3340 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
3341 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3342 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3343 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3344 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3345 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3346 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3347 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3348 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3349 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3350 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3351 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(16) + js
3352 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(16) + js
3353 inds = indself(lay)
3354 indf = indfor(lay)
3355 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3356
3357 do ig = 1, ng16
3358 taug(lay,ig) = speccomb * &
3359 (fac000 * absa(ind0 ,ig) + &
3360 fac100 * absa(ind0 +1,ig) + &
3361 fac010 * absa(ind0 +9,ig) + &
3362 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
3363 fac001 * absa(ind1 ,ig) + &
3364 fac101 * absa(ind1 +1,ig) + &
3365 fac011 * absa(ind1 +9,ig) + &
3366 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig)) + &
3367 colh2o(lay) * &
3368 (selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
3369 selffrac(lay) * &
3370 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
3371 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3372 forfrac(lay) * &
3373 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig))))
3374! ssa(lay,ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ig)
3375 taur(lay,ig) = tauray
3376 enddo
3377 enddo
3378
3379 laysolfr = nlayers
3380
3381! Upper atmosphere loop
3382 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
3383 if (jp(lay-1) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay) .ge. layreffr) &
3384 laysolfr = lay
3385 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(16) + 1
3386 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(16) + 1
3387 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3388
3389 do ig = 1, ng16
3390 taug(lay,ig) = colch4(lay) * &
3391 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0 ,ig) + &
3392 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
3393 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1 ,ig) + &
3394 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig))
3395! ssa(lay,ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ig)
3396 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ig) = sfluxref(ig)
3397 taur(lay,ig) = tauray
3398 enddo
3399 enddo
3400
3401 end subroutine taumol16
3402
3403!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3404 subroutine taumol17
3405!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3406!
3407! band 17: 3250-4000 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - h2o,co2)
3408!
3409!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3410
3411! ------- Modules -------
3412
3413 use parrrsw, only : ng17, ngs16
3414 use rrsw_kg17, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
3415 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, strrat
3416
3417! ------- Declarations -------
3418
3419! Local
3420
3421 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
3422 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
3423 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
3424 tauray
3425
3426! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
3427! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
3428! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
3429
3430! Lower atmosphere loop
3431 do lay = 1, laytrop
3432 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat*colco2(lay)
3433 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3434 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3435 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
3436 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3437 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3438 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3439 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3440 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3441 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3442 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3443 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3444 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3445 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3446 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(17) + js
3447 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(17) + js
3448 inds = indself(lay)
3449 indf = indfor(lay)
3450 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3451
3452 do ig = 1, ng17
3453 taug(lay,ngs16+ig) = speccomb * &
3454 (fac000 * absa(ind0,ig) + &
3455 fac100 * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
3456 fac010 * absa(ind0+9,ig) + &
3457 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
3458 fac001 * absa(ind1,ig) + &
3459 fac101 * absa(ind1+1,ig) + &
3460 fac011 * absa(ind1+9,ig) + &
3461 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig)) + &
3462 colh2o(lay) * &
3463 (selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
3464 selffrac(lay) * &
3465 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
3466 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3467 forfrac(lay) * &
3468 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig))))
3469! ssa(lay,ngs16+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs16+ig)
3470 taur(lay,ngs16+ig) = tauray
3471 enddo
3472 enddo
3473
3474 laysolfr = nlayers
3475
3476! Upper atmosphere loop
3477 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
3478 if (jp(lay-1) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay) .ge. layreffr) &
3479 laysolfr = lay
3480 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat*colco2(lay)
3481 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3482 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3483 specmult = 4._rb*(specparm)
3484 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3485 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3486 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3487 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3488 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3489 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3490 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3491 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3492 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3493 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3494 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(17) + js
3495 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(17) + js
3496 indf = indfor(lay)
3497 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3498
3499 do ig = 1, ng17
3500 taug(lay,ngs16+ig) = speccomb * &
3501 (fac000 * absb(ind0,ig) + &
3502 fac100 * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
3503 fac010 * absb(ind0+5,ig) + &
3504 fac110 * absb(ind0+6,ig) + &
3505 fac001 * absb(ind1,ig) + &
3506 fac101 * absb(ind1+1,ig) + &
3507 fac011 * absb(ind1+5,ig) + &
3508 fac111 * absb(ind1+6,ig)) + &
3509 colh2o(lay) * &
3510 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3511 forfrac(lay) * &
3512 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig)))
3513! ssa(lay,ngs16+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs16+ig)
3514 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs16+ig) = sfluxref(ig,js) &
3515 + fs * (sfluxref(ig,js+1) - sfluxref(ig,js))
3516 taur(lay,ngs16+ig) = tauray
3517 enddo
3518 enddo
3519
3520 end subroutine taumol17
3521
3522!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3523 subroutine taumol18
3524!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3525!
3526! band 18: 4000-4650 cm-1 (low - h2o,ch4; high - ch4)
3527!
3528!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3529
3530! ------- Modules -------
3531
3532 use parrrsw, only : ng18, ngs17
3533 use rrsw_kg18, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
3534 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, strrat
3535
3536! ------- Declarations -------
3537
3538! Local
3539
3540 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
3541 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
3542 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
3543 tauray
3544
3545! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
3546! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
3547! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
3548
3549 laysolfr = laytrop
3550
3551! Lower atmosphere loop
3552 do lay = 1, laytrop
3553 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
3554 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
3555 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat*colch4(lay)
3556 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3557 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3558 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
3559 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3560 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3561 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3562 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3563 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3564 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3565 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3566 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3567 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3568 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3569 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(18) + js
3570 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(18) + js
3571 inds = indself(lay)
3572 indf = indfor(lay)
3573 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3574
3575 do ig = 1, ng18
3576 taug(lay,ngs17+ig) = speccomb * &
3577 (fac000 * absa(ind0,ig) + &
3578 fac100 * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
3579 fac010 * absa(ind0+9,ig) + &
3580 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
3581 fac001 * absa(ind1,ig) + &
3582 fac101 * absa(ind1+1,ig) + &
3583 fac011 * absa(ind1+9,ig) + &
3584 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig)) + &
3585 colh2o(lay) * &
3586 (selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
3587 selffrac(lay) * &
3588 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
3589 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3590 forfrac(lay) * &
3591 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig))))
3592! ssa(lay,ngs17+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs17+ig)
3593 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs17+ig) = sfluxref(ig,js) &
3594 + fs * (sfluxref(ig,js+1) - sfluxref(ig,js))
3595 taur(lay,ngs17+ig) = tauray
3596 enddo
3597 enddo
3598
3599! Upper atmosphere loop
3600 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
3601 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(18) + 1
3602 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(18) + 1
3603 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3604
3605 do ig = 1, ng18
3606 taug(lay,ngs17+ig) = colch4(lay) * &
3607 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0,ig) + &
3608 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
3609 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1,ig) + &
3610 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig))
3611! ssa(lay,ngs17+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs17+ig)
3612 taur(lay,ngs17+ig) = tauray
3613 enddo
3614 enddo
3615
3616 end subroutine taumol18
3617
3618!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3619 subroutine taumol19
3620!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3621!
3622! band 19: 4650-5150 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - co2)
3623!
3624!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3625
3626! ------- Modules -------
3627
3628 use parrrsw, only : ng19, ngs18
3629 use rrsw_kg19, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
3630 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, strrat
3631
3632! ------- Declarations -------
3633
3634! Local
3635
3636 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
3637 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
3638 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
3639 tauray
3640
3641! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
3642! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
3643! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
3644
3645 laysolfr = laytrop
3646
3647! Lower atmosphere loop
3648 do lay = 1, laytrop
3649 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
3650 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
3651 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat*colco2(lay)
3652 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3653 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3654 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
3655 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3656 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3657 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3658 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3659 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3660 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3661 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3662 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3663 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3664 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3665 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(19) + js
3666 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(19) + js
3667 inds = indself(lay)
3668 indf = indfor(lay)
3669 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3670
3671 do ig = 1 , ng19
3672 taug(lay,ngs18+ig) = speccomb * &
3673 (fac000 * absa(ind0,ig) + &
3674 fac100 * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
3675 fac010 * absa(ind0+9,ig) + &
3676 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
3677 fac001 * absa(ind1,ig) + &
3678 fac101 * absa(ind1+1,ig) + &
3679 fac011 * absa(ind1+9,ig) + &
3680 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig)) + &
3681 colh2o(lay) * &
3682 (selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
3683 selffrac(lay) * &
3684 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
3685 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3686 forfrac(lay) * &
3687 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig))))
3688! ssa(lay,ngs18+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs18+ig)
3689 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs18+ig) = sfluxref(ig,js) &
3690 + fs * (sfluxref(ig,js+1) - sfluxref(ig,js))
3691 taur(lay,ngs18+ig) = tauray
3692 enddo
3693 enddo
3694
3695! Upper atmosphere loop
3696 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
3697 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(19) + 1
3698 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(19) + 1
3699 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3700
3701 do ig = 1 , ng19
3702 taug(lay,ngs18+ig) = colco2(lay) * &
3703 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0,ig) + &
3704 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
3705 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1,ig) + &
3706 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig))
3707! ssa(lay,ngs18+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs18+ig)
3708 taur(lay,ngs18+ig) = tauray
3709 enddo
3710 enddo
3711
3712 end subroutine taumol19
3713
3714!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3715 subroutine taumol20
3716!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3717!
3718! band 20: 5150-6150 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - h2o)
3719!
3720!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3721
3722! ------- Modules -------
3723
3724 use parrrsw, only : ng20, ngs19
3725 use rrsw_kg20, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
3726 sfluxref, absch4, rayl, layreffr
3727
3728 implicit none
3729
3730! ------- Declarations -------
3731
3732! Local
3733
3734 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
3735 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
3736 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
3737 tauray
3738
3739! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
3740! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
3741! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
3742
3743 laysolfr = laytrop
3744
3745! Lower atmosphere loop
3746 do lay = 1, laytrop
3747 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
3748 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
3749 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(20) + 1
3750 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(20) + 1
3751 inds = indself(lay)
3752 indf = indfor(lay)
3753 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3754
3755 do ig = 1, ng20
3756 taug(lay,ngs19+ig) = colh2o(lay) * &
3757 ((fac00(lay) * absa(ind0,ig) + &
3758 fac10(lay) * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
3759 fac01(lay) * absa(ind1,ig) + &
3760 fac11(lay) * absa(ind1+1,ig)) + &
3761 selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
3762 selffrac(lay) * &
3763 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
3764 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3765 forfrac(lay) * &
3766 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig)))) &
3767 + colch4(lay) * absch4(ig)
3768! ssa(lay,ngs19+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs19+ig)
3769 taur(lay,ngs19+ig) = tauray
3770 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs19+ig) = sfluxref(ig)
3771 enddo
3772 enddo
3773
3774! Upper atmosphere loop
3775 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
3776 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(20) + 1
3777 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(20) + 1
3778 indf = indfor(lay)
3779 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3780
3781 do ig = 1, ng20
3782 taug(lay,ngs19+ig) = colh2o(lay) * &
3783 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0,ig) + &
3784 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
3785 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1,ig) + &
3786 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig) + &
3787 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3788 forfrac(lay) * &
3789 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig)))) + &
3790 colch4(lay) * absch4(ig)
3791! ssa(lay,ngs19+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs19+ig)
3792 taur(lay,ngs19+ig) = tauray
3793 enddo
3794 enddo
3795
3796 end subroutine taumol20
3797
3798!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3799 subroutine taumol21
3800!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3801!
3802! band 21: 6150-7700 cm-1 (low - h2o,co2; high - h2o,co2)
3803!
3804!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3805
3806! ------- Modules -------
3807
3808 use parrrsw, only : ng21, ngs20
3809 use rrsw_kg21, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
3810 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, strrat
3811
3812! ------- Declarations -------
3813
3814! Local
3815
3816 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
3817 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
3818 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
3819 tauray
3820
3821! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
3822! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
3823! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
3824
3825 laysolfr = laytrop
3826
3827! Lower atmosphere loop
3828 do lay = 1, laytrop
3829 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
3830 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
3831 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat*colco2(lay)
3832 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3833 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3834 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
3835 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3836 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3837 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3838 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3839 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3840 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3841 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3842 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3843 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3844 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3845 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(21) + js
3846 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(21) + js
3847 inds = indself(lay)
3848 indf = indfor(lay)
3849 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3850
3851 do ig = 1, ng21
3852 taug(lay,ngs20+ig) = speccomb * &
3853 (fac000 * absa(ind0,ig) + &
3854 fac100 * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
3855 fac010 * absa(ind0+9,ig) + &
3856 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
3857 fac001 * absa(ind1,ig) + &
3858 fac101 * absa(ind1+1,ig) + &
3859 fac011 * absa(ind1+9,ig) + &
3860 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig)) + &
3861 colh2o(lay) * &
3862 (selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
3863 selffrac(lay) * &
3864 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
3865 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3866 forfrac(lay) * &
3867 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig))))
3868! ssa(lay,ngs20+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs20+ig)
3869 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs20+ig) = sfluxref(ig,js) &
3870 + fs * (sfluxref(ig,js+1) - sfluxref(ig,js))
3871 taur(lay,ngs20+ig) = tauray
3872 enddo
3873 enddo
3874
3875! Upper atmosphere loop
3876 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
3877 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat*colco2(lay)
3878 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3879 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3880 specmult = 4._rb*(specparm)
3881 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3882 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3883 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3884 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3885 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3886 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3887 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3888 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3889 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3890 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3891 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(21) + js
3892 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(21) + js
3893 indf = indfor(lay)
3894 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3895
3896 do ig = 1, ng21
3897 taug(lay,ngs20+ig) = speccomb * &
3898 (fac000 * absb(ind0,ig) + &
3899 fac100 * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
3900 fac010 * absb(ind0+5,ig) + &
3901 fac110 * absb(ind0+6,ig) + &
3902 fac001 * absb(ind1,ig) + &
3903 fac101 * absb(ind1+1,ig) + &
3904 fac011 * absb(ind1+5,ig) + &
3905 fac111 * absb(ind1+6,ig)) + &
3906 colh2o(lay) * &
3907 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3908 forfrac(lay) * &
3909 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig)))
3910! ssa(lay,ngs20+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs20+ig)
3911 taur(lay,ngs20+ig) = tauray
3912 enddo
3913 enddo
3914
3915 end subroutine taumol21
3916
3917!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3918 subroutine taumol22
3919!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3920!
3921! band 22: 7700-8050 cm-1 (low - h2o,o2; high - o2)
3922!
3923!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3924
3925! ------- Modules -------
3926
3927 use parrrsw, only : ng22, ngs21
3928 use rrsw_kg22, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
3929 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, strrat
3930
3931! ------- Declarations -------
3932
3933! Local
3934
3935 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
3936 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
3937 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
3938 tauray, o2adj, o2cont
3939
3940! The following factor is the ratio of total O2 band intensity (lines
3941! and Mate continuum) to O2 band intensity (line only). It is needed
3942! to adjust the optical depths since the k's include only lines.
3943 o2adj = 1.6_rb
3944
3945! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
3946! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
3947! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
3948
3949 laysolfr = laytrop
3950
3951! Lower atmosphere loop
3952 do lay = 1, laytrop
3953 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
3954 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
3955 o2cont = 4.35e-4_rb*colo2(lay)/(350.0_rb*2.0_rb)
3956 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + o2adj*strrat*colo2(lay)
3957 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
3958 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
3959 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
3960! odadj = specparm + o2adj * (1._rb - specparm)
3961 js = 1 + int(specmult)
3962 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
3963 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
3964 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
3965 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
3966 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
3967 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
3968 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
3969 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
3970 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
3971 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(22) + js
3972 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(22) + js
3973 inds = indself(lay)
3974 indf = indfor(lay)
3975 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
3976
3977 do ig = 1, ng22
3978 taug(lay,ngs21+ig) = speccomb * &
3979 (fac000 * absa(ind0,ig) + &
3980 fac100 * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
3981 fac010 * absa(ind0+9,ig) + &
3982 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
3983 fac001 * absa(ind1,ig) + &
3984 fac101 * absa(ind1+1,ig) + &
3985 fac011 * absa(ind1+9,ig) + &
3986 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig)) + &
3987 colh2o(lay) * &
3988 (selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
3989 selffrac(lay) * &
3990 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
3991 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
3992 forfrac(lay) * &
3993 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig)))) &
3994 + o2cont
3995! ssa(lay,ngs21+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs21+ig)
3996 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs21+ig) = sfluxref(ig,js) &
3997 + fs * (sfluxref(ig,js+1) - sfluxref(ig,js))
3998 taur(lay,ngs21+ig) = tauray
3999 enddo
4000 enddo
4001
4002! Upper atmosphere loop
4003 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4004 o2cont = 4.35e-4_rb*colo2(lay)/(350.0_rb*2.0_rb)
4005 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(22) + 1
4006 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(22) + 1
4007 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
4008
4009 do ig = 1, ng22
4010 taug(lay,ngs21+ig) = colo2(lay) * o2adj * &
4011 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0,ig) + &
4012 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
4013 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1,ig) + &
4014 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig)) + &
4015 o2cont
4016! ssa(lay,ngs21+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs21+ig)
4017 taur(lay,ngs21+ig) = tauray
4018 enddo
4019 enddo
4020
4021 end subroutine taumol22
4022
4023!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4024 subroutine taumol23
4025!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4026!
4027! band 23: 8050-12850 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - nothing)
4028!
4029!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4030
4031! ------- Modules -------
4032
4033 use parrrsw, only : ng23, ngs22
4034 use rrsw_kg23, only : absa, ka, forref, selfref, &
4035 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, givfac
4036
4037! ------- Declarations -------
4038
4039! Local
4040
4041 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
4042 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
4043 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
4044 tauray
4045
4046! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
4047! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
4048! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
4049
4050 laysolfr = laytrop
4051
4052! Lower atmosphere loop
4053 do lay = 1, laytrop
4054 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
4055 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
4056 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(23) + 1
4057 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(23) + 1
4058 inds = indself(lay)
4059 indf = indfor(lay)
4060
4061 do ig = 1, ng23
4062 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4063 taug(lay,ngs22+ig) = colh2o(lay) * &
4064 (givfac * (fac00(lay) * absa(ind0,ig) + &
4065 fac10(lay) * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
4066 fac01(lay) * absa(ind1,ig) + &
4067 fac11(lay) * absa(ind1+1,ig)) + &
4068 selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
4069 selffrac(lay) * &
4070 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
4071 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
4072 forfrac(lay) * &
4073 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig))))
4074! ssa(lay,ngs22+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs22+ig)
4075 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs22+ig) = sfluxref(ig)
4076 taur(lay,ngs22+ig) = tauray
4077 enddo
4078 enddo
4079
4080! Upper atmosphere loop
4081 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4082 do ig = 1, ng23
4083! taug(lay,ngs22+ig) = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4084! ssa(lay,ngs22+ig) = 1.0_rb
4085 taug(lay,ngs22+ig) = 0._rb
4086 taur(lay,ngs22+ig) = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4087 enddo
4088 enddo
4089
4090 end subroutine taumol23
4091
4092!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4093 subroutine taumol24
4094!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4095!
4096! band 24: 12850-16000 cm-1 (low - h2o,o2; high - o2)
4097!
4098!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4099
4100! ------- Modules -------
4101
4102 use parrrsw, only : ng24, ngs23
4103 use rrsw_kg24, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
4104 sfluxref, abso3a, abso3b, rayla, raylb, &
4105 layreffr, strrat
4106
4107! ------- Declarations -------
4108
4109! Local
4110
4111 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
4112 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
4113 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
4114 tauray
4115
4116! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
4117! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
4118! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
4119
4120 laysolfr = laytrop
4121
4122! Lower atmosphere loop
4123 do lay = 1, laytrop
4124 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
4125 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
4126 speccomb = colh2o(lay) + strrat*colo2(lay)
4127 specparm = colh2o(lay)/speccomb
4128 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
4129 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
4130 js = 1 + int(specmult)
4131 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
4132 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
4133 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
4134 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
4135 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
4136 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
4137 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
4138 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
4139 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
4140 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(24) + js
4141 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(24) + js
4142 inds = indself(lay)
4143 indf = indfor(lay)
4144
4145 do ig = 1, ng24
4146 tauray = colmol(lay) * (rayla(ig,js) + &
4147 fs * (rayla(ig,js+1) - rayla(ig,js)))
4148 taug(lay,ngs23+ig) = speccomb * &
4149 (fac000 * absa(ind0,ig) + &
4150 fac100 * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
4151 fac010 * absa(ind0+9,ig) + &
4152 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
4153 fac001 * absa(ind1,ig) + &
4154 fac101 * absa(ind1+1,ig) + &
4155 fac011 * absa(ind1+9,ig) + &
4156 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig)) + &
4157 colo3(lay) * abso3a(ig) + &
4158 colh2o(lay) * &
4159 (selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
4160 selffrac(lay) * &
4161 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
4162 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
4163 forfrac(lay) * &
4164 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig))))
4165! ssa(lay,ngs23+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs23+ig)
4166 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs23+ig) = sfluxref(ig,js) &
4167 + fs * (sfluxref(ig,js+1) - sfluxref(ig,js))
4168 taur(lay,ngs23+ig) = tauray
4169 enddo
4170 enddo
4171
4172! Upper atmosphere loop
4173 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4174 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(24) + 1
4175 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(24) + 1
4176
4177 do ig = 1, ng24
4178 tauray = colmol(lay) * raylb(ig)
4179 taug(lay,ngs23+ig) = colo2(lay) * &
4180 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0,ig) + &
4181 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
4182 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1,ig) + &
4183 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig)) + &
4184 colo3(lay) * abso3b(ig)
4185! ssa(lay,ngs23+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs23+ig)
4186 taur(lay,ngs23+ig) = tauray
4187 enddo
4188 enddo
4189
4190 end subroutine taumol24
4191
4192!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4193 subroutine taumol25
4194!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4195!
4196! band 25: 16000-22650 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - nothing)
4197!
4198!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4199
4200! ------- Modules -------
4201
4202 use parrrsw, only : ng25, ngs24
4203 use rrsw_kg25, only : absa, ka, &
4204 sfluxref, abso3a, abso3b, rayl, layreffr
4205
4206! ------- Declarations -------
4207
4208! Local
4209
4210 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
4211 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
4212 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
4213 tauray
4214
4215! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
4216! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
4217! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
4218
4219 laysolfr = laytrop
4220
4221! Lower atmosphere loop
4222 do lay = 1, laytrop
4223 if (jp(lay) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay+1) .ge. layreffr) &
4224 laysolfr = min(lay+1,laytrop)
4225 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(25) + 1
4226 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(25) + 1
4227
4228 do ig = 1, ng25
4229 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4230 taug(lay,ngs24+ig) = colh2o(lay) * &
4231 (fac00(lay) * absa(ind0,ig) + &
4232 fac10(lay) * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
4233 fac01(lay) * absa(ind1,ig) + &
4234 fac11(lay) * absa(ind1+1,ig)) + &
4235 colo3(lay) * abso3a(ig)
4236! ssa(lay,ngs24+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs24+ig)
4237 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs24+ig) = sfluxref(ig)
4238 taur(lay,ngs24+ig) = tauray
4239 enddo
4240 enddo
4241
4242! Upper atmosphere loop
4243 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4244 do ig = 1, ng25
4245 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4246 taug(lay,ngs24+ig) = colo3(lay) * abso3b(ig)
4247! ssa(lay,ngs24+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs24+ig)
4248 taur(lay,ngs24+ig) = tauray
4249 enddo
4250 enddo
4251
4252 end subroutine taumol25
4253
4254!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4255 subroutine taumol26
4256!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4257!
4258! band 26: 22650-29000 cm-1 (low - nothing; high - nothing)
4259!
4260!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4261
4262! ------- Modules -------
4263
4264 use parrrsw, only : ng26, ngs25
4265 use rrsw_kg26, only : sfluxref, rayl
4266
4267! ------- Declarations -------
4268
4269! Local
4270
4271 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
4272 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
4273 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
4274 tauray
4275
4276! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
4277! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
4278! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
4279
4280 laysolfr = laytrop
4281
4282! Lower atmosphere loop
4283 do lay = 1, laytrop
4284 do ig = 1, ng26
4285! taug(lay,ngs25+ig) = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4286! ssa(lay,ngs25+ig) = 1.0_rb
4287 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs25+ig) = sfluxref(ig)
4288 taug(lay,ngs25+ig) = 0._rb
4289 taur(lay,ngs25+ig) = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4290 enddo
4291 enddo
4292
4293! Upper atmosphere loop
4294 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4295 do ig = 1, ng26
4296! taug(lay,ngs25+ig) = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4297! ssa(lay,ngs25+ig) = 1.0_rb
4298 taug(lay,ngs25+ig) = 0._rb
4299 taur(lay,ngs25+ig) = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4300 enddo
4301 enddo
4302
4303 end subroutine taumol26
4304
4305!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4306 subroutine taumol27
4307!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4308!
4309! band 27: 29000-38000 cm-1 (low - o3; high - o3)
4310!
4311!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4312
4313! ------- Modules -------
4314
4315 use parrrsw, only : ng27, ngs26
4316 use rrsw_kg27, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, &
4317 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, scalekur
4318
4319! ------- Declarations -------
4320
4321! Local
4322
4323 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
4324 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
4325 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
4326 tauray
4327
4328! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
4329! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
4330! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
4331
4332! Lower atmosphere loop
4333 do lay = 1, laytrop
4334 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(27) + 1
4335 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(27) + 1
4336
4337 do ig = 1, ng27
4338 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4339 taug(lay,ngs26+ig) = colo3(lay) * &
4340 (fac00(lay) * absa(ind0,ig) + &
4341 fac10(lay) * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
4342 fac01(lay) * absa(ind1,ig) + &
4343 fac11(lay) * absa(ind1+1,ig))
4344! ssa(lay,ngs26+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs26+ig)
4345 taur(lay,ngs26+ig) = tauray
4346 enddo
4347 enddo
4348
4349 laysolfr = nlayers
4350
4351! Upper atmosphere loop
4352 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4353 if (jp(lay-1) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay) .ge. layreffr) &
4354 laysolfr = lay
4355 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(27) + 1
4356 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(27) + 1
4357
4358 do ig = 1, ng27
4359 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl(ig)
4360 taug(lay,ngs26+ig) = colo3(lay) * &
4361 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0,ig) + &
4362 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
4363 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1,ig) + &
4364 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig))
4365! ssa(lay,ngs26+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs26+ig)
4366 if (lay.eq.laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs26+ig) = scalekur * sfluxref(ig)
4367 taur(lay,ngs26+ig) = tauray
4368 enddo
4369 enddo
4370
4371 end subroutine taumol27
4372
4373!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4374 subroutine taumol28
4375!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4376!
4377! band 28: 38000-50000 cm-1 (low - o3,o2; high - o3,o2)
4378!
4379!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4380
4381! ------- Modules -------
4382
4383 use parrrsw, only : ng28, ngs27
4384 use rrsw_kg28, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, &
4385 sfluxref, rayl, layreffr, strrat
4386
4387! ------- Declarations -------
4388
4389! Local
4390
4391 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
4392 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
4393 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
4394 tauray
4395
4396! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
4397! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
4398! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
4399
4400! Lower atmosphere loop
4401 do lay = 1, laytrop
4402 speccomb = colo3(lay) + strrat*colo2(lay)
4403 specparm = colo3(lay)/speccomb
4404 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
4405 specmult = 8._rb*(specparm)
4406 js = 1 + int(specmult)
4407 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
4408 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
4409 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
4410 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
4411 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
4412 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
4413 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
4414 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
4415 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
4416 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(28) + js
4417 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(28) + js
4418 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
4419
4420 do ig = 1, ng28
4421 taug(lay,ngs27+ig) = speccomb * &
4422 (fac000 * absa(ind0,ig) + &
4423 fac100 * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
4424 fac010 * absa(ind0+9,ig) + &
4425 fac110 * absa(ind0+10,ig) + &
4426 fac001 * absa(ind1,ig) + &
4427 fac101 * absa(ind1+1,ig) + &
4428 fac011 * absa(ind1+9,ig) + &
4429 fac111 * absa(ind1+10,ig))
4430! ssa(lay,ngs27+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs27+ig)
4431 taur(lay,ngs27+ig) = tauray
4432 enddo
4433 enddo
4434
4435 laysolfr = nlayers
4436
4437! Upper atmosphere loop
4438 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4439 if (jp(lay-1) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay) .ge. layreffr) &
4440 laysolfr = lay
4441 speccomb = colo3(lay) + strrat*colo2(lay)
4442 specparm = colo3(lay)/speccomb
4443 if (specparm .ge. oneminus) specparm = oneminus
4444 specmult = 4._rb*(specparm)
4445 js = 1 + int(specmult)
4446 fs = mod(specmult, 1._rb )
4447 fac000 = (1._rb - fs) * fac00(lay)
4448 fac010 = (1._rb - fs) * fac10(lay)
4449 fac100 = fs * fac00(lay)
4450 fac110 = fs * fac10(lay)
4451 fac001 = (1._rb - fs) * fac01(lay)
4452 fac011 = (1._rb - fs) * fac11(lay)
4453 fac101 = fs * fac01(lay)
4454 fac111 = fs * fac11(lay)
4455 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(28) + js
4456 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(28) + js
4457 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
4458
4459 do ig = 1, ng28
4460 taug(lay,ngs27+ig) = speccomb * &
4461 (fac000 * absb(ind0,ig) + &
4462 fac100 * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
4463 fac010 * absb(ind0+5,ig) + &
4464 fac110 * absb(ind0+6,ig) + &
4465 fac001 * absb(ind1,ig) + &
4466 fac101 * absb(ind1+1,ig) + &
4467 fac011 * absb(ind1+5,ig) + &
4468 fac111 * absb(ind1+6,ig))
4469! ssa(lay,ngs27+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs27+ig)
4470 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs27+ig) = sfluxref(ig,js) &
4471 + fs * (sfluxref(ig,js+1) - sfluxref(ig,js))
4472 taur(lay,ngs27+ig) = tauray
4473 enddo
4474 enddo
4475
4476 end subroutine taumol28
4477
4478!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4479 subroutine taumol29
4480!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4481!
4482! band 29: 820-2600 cm-1 (low - h2o; high - co2)
4483!
4484!----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4485
4486! ------- Modules -------
4487
4488 use parrrsw, only : ng29, ngs28
4489 use rrsw_kg29, only : absa, ka, absb, kb, forref, selfref, &
4490 sfluxref, absh2o, absco2, rayl, layreffr
4491
4492! ------- Declarations -------
4493
4494! Local
4495
4496 integer(kind=im) :: ig, ind0, ind1, inds, indf, js, lay, laysolfr
4497 real(kind=rb) :: fac000, fac001, fac010, fac011, fac100, fac101, &
4498 fac110, fac111, fs, speccomb, specmult, specparm, &
4499 tauray
4500
4501! Compute the optical depth by interpolating in ln(pressure),
4502! temperature, and appropriate species. Below LAYTROP, the water
4503! vapor self-continuum is interpolated (in temperature) separately.
4504
4505! Lower atmosphere loop
4506 do lay = 1, laytrop
4507 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-1)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspa(29) + 1
4508 ind1 = (jp(lay)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspa(29) + 1
4509 inds = indself(lay)
4510 indf = indfor(lay)
4511 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
4512
4513 do ig = 1, ng29
4514 taug(lay,ngs28+ig) = colh2o(lay) * &
4515 ((fac00(lay) * absa(ind0,ig) + &
4516 fac10(lay) * absa(ind0+1,ig) + &
4517 fac01(lay) * absa(ind1,ig) + &
4518 fac11(lay) * absa(ind1+1,ig)) + &
4519 selffac(lay) * (selfref(inds,ig) + &
4520 selffrac(lay) * &
4521 (selfref(inds+1,ig) - selfref(inds,ig))) + &
4522 forfac(lay) * (forref(indf,ig) + &
4523 forfrac(lay) * &
4524 (forref(indf+1,ig) - forref(indf,ig)))) &
4525 + colco2(lay) * absco2(ig)
4526! ssa(lay,ngs28+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs28+ig)
4527 taur(lay,ngs28+ig) = tauray
4528 enddo
4529 enddo
4530
4531 laysolfr = nlayers
4532
4533! Upper atmosphere loop
4534 do lay = laytrop+1, nlayers
4535 if (jp(lay-1) .lt. layreffr .and. jp(lay) .ge. layreffr) &
4536 laysolfr = lay
4537 ind0 = ((jp(lay)-13)*5+(jt(lay)-1))*nspb(29) + 1
4538 ind1 = ((jp(lay)-12)*5+(jt1(lay)-1))*nspb(29) + 1
4539 tauray = colmol(lay) * rayl
4540
4541 do ig = 1, ng29
4542 taug(lay,ngs28+ig) = colco2(lay) * &
4543 (fac00(lay) * absb(ind0,ig) + &
4544 fac10(lay) * absb(ind0+1,ig) + &
4545 fac01(lay) * absb(ind1,ig) + &
4546 fac11(lay) * absb(ind1+1,ig)) &
4547 + colh2o(lay) * absh2o(ig)
4548! ssa(lay,ngs28+ig) = tauray/taug(lay,ngs28+ig)
4549 if (lay .eq. laysolfr) sfluxzen(ngs28+ig) = sfluxref(ig)
4550 taur(lay,ngs28+ig) = tauray
4551 enddo
4552 enddo
4553
4554 end subroutine taumol29
4555
4556 end subroutine taumol_sw
4557
4558 end module rrtmg_sw_taumol
4559
4560! path: $Source: /cvsroot/NWP/WRFV3/phys/module_ra_rrtmg_sw.F,v $
4561! author: $Author: trn $
4562! revision: $Revision: 1.3 $
4563! created: $Date: 2009/04/16 19:54:22 $
4564
4565 module rrtmg_sw_init
4566
4567! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4568! | |
4569! | Copyright 2002-2008, Atmospheric & Environmental Research, Inc. (AER). |
4570! | This software may be used, copied, or redistributed as long as it is |
4571! | not sold and this copyright notice is reproduced on each copy made. |
4572! | This model is provided as is without any express or implied warranties. |
4573! | (http://www.rtweb.aer.com/) |
4574! | |
4575! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4576
4577! ------- Modules -------
4578 use parkind, only : im => kind_im, rb => kind_rb
4579 use rrsw_wvn
4580 use rrtmg_sw_setcoef, only: swatmref
4581
4582 implicit none
4583
4584 contains
4585
4586! **************************************************************************
4587 subroutine rrtmg_sw_ini(cpdair)
4588! **************************************************************************
4589!
4590! Original version: Michael J. Iacono; February, 2004
4591! Revision for F90 formatting: M. J. Iacono, July, 2006
4592!
4593! This subroutine performs calculations necessary for the initialization
4594! of the shortwave model. Lookup tables are computed for use in the SW
4595! radiative transfer, and input absorption coefficient data for each
4596! spectral band are reduced from 224 g-point intervals to 112.
4597! **************************************************************************
4598
4599 use parrrsw, only : mg, nbndsw, ngptsw
4600 use rrsw_tbl, only: ntbl, tblint, pade, bpade, tau_tbl, exp_tbl
4601 use rrsw_vsn, only: hvrini, hnamini
4602
4603 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cpdair ! Specific heat capacity of dry air
4604 ! at constant pressure at 273 K
4605 ! (J kg-1 K-1)
4606
4607! ------- Local -------
4608
4609 integer(kind=im) :: ibnd, igc, ig, ind, ipr
4610 integer(kind=im) :: igcsm, iprsm
4611 integer(kind=im) :: itr
4612
4613 real(kind=rb) :: wtsum, wtsm(mg)
4614 real(kind=rb) :: tfn
4615
4616 real(kind=rb), parameter :: expeps = 1.e-20 ! Smallest value for exponential table
4617
4618! ------- Definitions -------
4619! Arrays for 10000-point look-up tables:
4620! TAU_TBL Clear-sky optical depth
4621! EXP_TBL Exponential lookup table for transmittance
4622! PADE Pade approximation constant (= 0.278)
4623! BPADE Inverse of the Pade approximation constant
4624!
4625
4626!jm not thread safe hvrini = '$Revision: 1.3 $'
4627
4628! Initialize model data
4629 call swdatinit(cpdair)
4630 call swcmbdat ! g-point interval reduction data
4631 call swaerpr ! aerosol optical properties
4632 call swcldpr ! cloud optical properties
4633 call swatmref ! reference MLS profile
4634! Moved to module_ra_rrtmg_sw for WRF
4635! call sw_kgb16 ! molecular absorption coefficients
4636! call sw_kgb17
4637! call sw_kgb18
4638! call sw_kgb19
4639! call sw_kgb20
4640! call sw_kgb21
4641! call sw_kgb22
4642! call sw_kgb23
4643! call sw_kgb24
4644! call sw_kgb25
4645! call sw_kgb26
4646! call sw_kgb27
4647! call sw_kgb28
4648! call sw_kgb29
4649
4650! Define exponential lookup tables for transmittance. Tau is
4651! computed as a function of the tau transition function, and transmittance
4652! is calculated as a function of tau. All tables are computed at intervals
4653! of 0.0001. The inverse of the constant used in the Pade approximation to
4654! the tau transition function is set to bpade.
4655
4656 exp_tbl(0) = 1.0_rb
4657 exp_tbl(ntbl) = expeps
4658 bpade = 1.0_rb / pade
4659 do itr = 1, ntbl-1
4660 tfn = float(itr) / float(ntbl)
4661 tau_tbl = bpade * tfn / (1._rb - tfn)
