8903 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: dyofyr ! Day of the year (used to get Earth/Sun
8904 ! distance if adjflx not provided)
8905 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: adjes ! Flux adjustment for Earth/Sun distance
8906 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: coszen(:) ! Cosine of solar zenith angle
8907 ! Dimensions: (ncol)
8908 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: scon ! Solar constant (W/m2)
8909
8910 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: inflgsw ! Flag for cloud optical properties
8911 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: iceflgsw ! Flag for ice particle specification
8912 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: liqflgsw ! Flag for liquid droplet specification
8913
8914 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cldfmcl(:,:,:) ! Cloud fraction
8915 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8916 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: taucmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud optical depth
8917 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8918 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ssacmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud single scattering albedo
8919 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8920 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: asmcmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud asymmetry parameter
8921 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8922 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: fsfcmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud forward scattering fraction
8923 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8924 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ciwpmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud ice water path (g/m2)
8925 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8926 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: clwpmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud liquid water path (g/m2)
8927 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8928 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cswpmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud snow water path (g/m2)
8929 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
8930 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: reicmcl(:,:) ! Cloud ice effective radius (microns)
8931 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
8932 ! specific definition of reicmcl depends on setting of iceflglw:
8933 ! iceflglw = 0: ice effective radius, r_ec, (Ebert and Curry, 1992),
8934 ! r_ec must be >= 10.0 microns
8935 ! iceflglw = 1: ice effective radius, r_ec, (Ebert and Curry, 1992),
8936 ! r_ec range is limited to 13.0 to 130.0 microns
8937 ! iceflglw = 2: ice effective radius, r_k, (Key, Streamer Ref. Manual, 1996)
8938 ! r_k range is limited to 5.0 to 131.0 microns
8939 ! iceflglw = 3: generalized effective size, dge, (Fu, 1996),
8940 ! dge range is limited to 5.0 to 140.0 microns
8941 ! [dge = 1.0315 * r_ec]
8942 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: relqmcl(:,:) ! Cloud water drop effective radius (microns)
8943 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
8944 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: resnmcl(:,:) ! Cloud snow effective radius (microns)
8945 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
8946 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tauaer(:,:,:) ! Aerosol optical depth (iaer=10 only)
8947 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay,nbndsw)
8948 ! (non-delta scaled)
8949 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ssaaer(:,:,:) ! Aerosol single scattering albedo (iaer=10 only)
8950 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay,nbndsw)
8951 ! (non-delta scaled)
8952 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: asmaer(:,:,:) ! Aerosol asymmetry parameter (iaer=10 only)
8953 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay,nbndsw)
8954 ! (non-delta scaled)
8955 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ecaer(:,:,:) ! Aerosol optical depth at 0.55 micron (iaer=6 only)
8956 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay,naerec)
8957 ! (non-delta scaled)
8958
8959! ----- Output -----
8960
8961 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: swuflx(:,:) ! Total sky shortwave upward flux (W/m2)
8962 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1)
8963 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: swdflx(:,:) ! Total sky shortwave downward flux (W/m2)
8964 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1)
8965 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: sibvisdir(:,:) ! visible direct downward flux (W/m2)
8966 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1) Zhenxin (2011/06/20)
8967 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: sibvisdif(:,:) ! visible diffusion downward flux (W/m2)
8968 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1) Zhenxin (2011/06/20)
8969 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: sibnirdir(:,:) ! Near IR direct downward flux (W/m2)
8970 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1) Zhenxin (2011/06/20)
8971 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: sibnirdif(:,:) ! Near IR diffusion downward flux (W/m2)
8972 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1) Zhenxin (2011/06/20)
8973 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: swhr(:,:) ! Total sky shortwave radiative heating rate (K/d)
8974 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
8975 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: swuflxc(:,:) ! Clear sky shortwave upward flux (W/m2)
8976 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1)
8977 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: swdflxc(:,:) ! Clear sky shortwave downward flux (W/m2)
8978 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1)
8979 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: swhrc(:,:) ! Clear sky shortwave radiative heating rate (K/d)
8980 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
8981
8982 integer, intent(in) :: aer_opt
8983 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: &
8984 swdkdir(:,:), & ! Total shortwave downward direct flux (W/m2), Dimensions: (ncol,nlay) jararias, 2013/08/10
8985 swdkdif(:,:) ! Total shortwave downward diffuse flux (W/m2), Dimensions: (ncol,nlay) jararias, 2013/08/10
8986
8987
8988
8989
8990
8991! ----- Local -----
8992
8993! Control
8994 integer(kind=im) :: nlayers ! total number of layers
8995 integer(kind=im) :: istart ! beginning band of calculation
8996 integer(kind=im) :: iend ! ending band of calculation
8997 integer(kind=im) :: icpr ! cldprop/cldprmc use flag
8998 integer(kind=im) :: iout ! output option flag (inactive)
8999 integer(kind=im) :: iaer ! aerosol option flag
9000 integer(kind=im) :: idelm ! delta-m scaling flag (inactive)
9001 integer(kind=im) :: isccos ! instrumental cosine response flag (inactive)
9002 integer(kind=im) :: iplon ! column loop index
9003 integer(kind=im) :: i ! layer loop index ! jk
9004 integer(kind=im) :: ib ! band loop index ! jsw
9005 integer(kind=im) :: ia, ig ! indices
9006 integer(kind=im) :: k ! layer loop index
9007 integer(kind=im) :: ims ! value for changing mcica permute seed
9008 integer(kind=im) :: imca ! flag for mcica [0=off, 1=on]
9009
9010 real(kind=rb) :: zepsec, zepzen ! epsilon
9011 real(kind=rb) :: zdpgcp ! flux to heating conversion ratio
9012
9013! Atmosphere
9014 real(kind=rb) :: pavel(nlay+1) ! layer pressures (mb)
9015 real(kind=rb) :: tavel(nlay+1) ! layer temperatures (K)
9016 real(kind=rb) :: pz(0:nlay+1) ! level (interface) pressures (hPa, mb)
9017 real(kind=rb) :: tz(0:nlay+1) ! level (interface) temperatures (K)
9018 real(kind=rb) :: tbound ! surface temperature (K)
9019 real(kind=rb) :: pdp(nlay+1) ! layer pressure thickness (hPa, mb)
9020 real(kind=rb) :: coldry(nlay+1) ! dry air column amount
9021 real(kind=rb) :: wkl(mxmol,nlay+1) ! molecular amounts (mol/cm-2)
9022
9023! real(kind=rb) :: earth_sun ! function for Earth/Sun distance factor
9024 real(kind=rb) :: cossza ! Cosine of solar zenith angle
9025 real(kind=rb) :: adjflux(jpband) ! adjustment for current Earth/Sun distance
9026 real(kind=rb) :: solvar(jpband) ! solar constant scaling factor from rrtmg_sw
9027 ! default value of 1368.22 Wm-2 at 1 AU
9028 real(kind=rb) :: albdir(nbndsw) ! surface albedo, direct ! zalbp
9029 real(kind=rb) :: albdif(nbndsw) ! surface albedo, diffuse ! zalbd
9030
9031 real(kind=rb) :: taua(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! Aerosol optical depth
9032 real(kind=rb) :: ssaa(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! Aerosol single scattering albedo
9033 real(kind=rb) :: asma(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! Aerosol asymmetry parameter
9034
9035! Atmosphere - setcoef
9036 integer(kind=im) :: laytrop ! tropopause layer index
9037 integer(kind=im) :: layswtch ! tropopause layer index
9038 integer(kind=im) :: laylow ! tropopause layer index
9039 integer(kind=im) :: jp(nlay+1) !
9040 integer(kind=im) :: jt(nlay+1) !
9041 integer(kind=im) :: jt1(nlay+1) !
9042
9043 real(kind=rb) :: colh2o(nlay+1) ! column amount (h2o)
9044 real(kind=rb) :: colco2(nlay+1) ! column amount (co2)
9045 real(kind=rb) :: colo3(nlay+1) ! column amount (o3)
9046 real(kind=rb) :: coln2o(nlay+1) ! column amount (n2o)
9047 real(kind=rb) :: colch4(nlay+1) ! column amount (ch4)
9048 real(kind=rb) :: colo2(nlay+1) ! column amount (o2)
9049 real(kind=rb) :: colmol(nlay+1) ! column amount
9050 real(kind=rb) :: co2mult(nlay+1) ! column amount
9051
9052 integer(kind=im) :: indself(nlay+1)
9053 integer(kind=im) :: indfor(nlay+1)
9054 real(kind=rb) :: selffac(nlay+1)
9055 real(kind=rb) :: selffrac(nlay+1)
9056 real(kind=rb) :: forfac(nlay+1)
9057 real(kind=rb) :: forfrac(nlay+1)
9058
9059 real(kind=rb) :: & !
9060 fac00(nlay+1), fac01(nlay+1), &
9061 fac10(nlay+1), fac11(nlay+1)
9062
9063! Atmosphere/clouds - cldprop
9064 integer(kind=im) :: ncbands ! number of cloud spectral bands
9065 integer(kind=im) :: inflag ! flag for cloud property method
9066 integer(kind=im) :: iceflag ! flag for ice cloud properties
9067 integer(kind=im) :: liqflag ! flag for liquid cloud properties
9068
9069! real(kind=rb) :: cldfrac(nlay+1) ! layer cloud fraction
9070! real(kind=rb) :: tauc(nlay+1) ! in-cloud optical depth (non-delta scaled)
9071! real(kind=rb) :: ssac(nlay+1) ! in-cloud single scattering albedo (non-delta scaled)
9072! real(kind=rb) :: asmc(nlay+1) ! in-cloud asymmetry parameter (non-delta scaled)
9073! real(kind=rb) :: fsfc(nlay+1) ! in-cloud forward scattering fraction (non-delta scaled)
9074! real(kind=rb) :: ciwp(nlay+1) ! in-cloud ice water path
9075! real(kind=rb) :: clwp(nlay+1) ! in-cloud liquid water path
9076! real(kind=rb) :: rei(nlay+1) ! cloud ice particle size
9077! real(kind=rb) :: rel(nlay+1) ! cloud liquid particle size
9078
9079! real(kind=rb) :: taucloud(nlay+1,jpband) ! in-cloud optical depth
9080! real(kind=rb) :: taucldorig(nlay+1,jpband)! in-cloud optical depth (non-delta scaled)
9081! real(kind=rb) :: ssacloud(nlay+1,jpband) ! in-cloud single scattering albedo
9082! real(kind=rb) :: asmcloud(nlay+1,jpband) ! in-cloud asymmetry parameter
9083
9084! Atmosphere/clouds - cldprmc [mcica]
9085 real(kind=rb) :: cldfmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! cloud fraction [mcica]
9086 real(kind=rb) :: ciwpmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! in-cloud ice water path [mcica]
9087 real(kind=rb) :: clwpmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! in-cloud liquid water path [mcica]
9088 real(kind=rb) :: cswpmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! in-cloud snow water path [mcica]
9089 real(kind=rb) :: relqmc(nlay+1) ! liquid particle effective radius (microns)
9090 real(kind=rb) :: reicmc(nlay+1) ! ice particle effective size (microns)
9091 real(kind=rb) :: resnmc(nlay+1) ! snow particle effective size (microns)
9092 real(kind=rb) :: taucmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! in-cloud optical depth [mcica]
9093 real(kind=rb) :: taormc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! unscaled in-cloud optical depth [mcica]
9094 real(kind=rb) :: ssacmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! in-cloud single scattering albedo [mcica]
9095 real(kind=rb) :: asmcmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! in-cloud asymmetry parameter [mcica]
9096 real(kind=rb) :: fsfcmc(ngptsw,nlay+1) ! in-cloud forward scattering fraction [mcica]
9097
9098! Atmosphere/clouds/aerosol - spcvrt,spcvmc
9099 real(kind=rb) :: ztauc(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! cloud optical depth
9100 real(kind=rb) :: ztaucorig(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! unscaled cloud optical depth
9101 real(kind=rb) :: zasyc(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! cloud asymmetry parameter
9102 ! (first moment of phase function)
9103 real(kind=rb) :: zomgc(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! cloud single scattering albedo
9104 real(kind=rb) :: ztaua(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! total aerosol optical depth
9105 real(kind=rb) :: zasya(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! total aerosol asymmetry parameter
9106 real(kind=rb) :: zomga(nlay+1,nbndsw) ! total aerosol single scattering albedo
9107
9108 real(kind=rb) :: zcldfmc(nlay+1,ngptsw) ! cloud fraction [mcica]
9109 real(kind=rb) :: ztaucmc(nlay+1,ngptsw) ! cloud optical depth [mcica]
9110 real(kind=rb) :: ztaormc(nlay+1,ngptsw) ! unscaled cloud optical depth [mcica]
9111 real(kind=rb) :: zasycmc(nlay+1,ngptsw) ! cloud asymmetry parameter [mcica]
9112 real(kind=rb) :: zomgcmc(nlay+1,ngptsw) ! cloud single scattering albedo [mcica]
9113
9114 real(kind=rb) :: zbbfu(nlay+2) ! temporary upward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9115 real(kind=rb) :: zbbfd(nlay+2) ! temporary downward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9116 real(kind=rb) :: zbbcu(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky upward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9117 real(kind=rb) :: zbbcd(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky downward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9118 real(kind=rb) :: zbbfddir(nlay+2) ! temporary downward direct shortwave flux (w/m2)
9119 real(kind=rb) :: zbbcddir(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky downward direct shortwave flux (w/m2)
9120 real(kind=rb) :: zuvfd(nlay+2) ! temporary UV downward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9121 real(kind=rb) :: zuvcd(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky UV downward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9122 real(kind=rb) :: zuvfddir(nlay+2) ! temporary UV downward direct shortwave flux (w/m2)
9123 real(kind=rb) :: zuvcddir(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky UV downward direct shortwave flux (w/m2)
9124 real(kind=rb) :: znifd(nlay+2) ! temporary near-IR downward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9125 real(kind=rb) :: znicd(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky near-IR downward shortwave flux (w/m2)
9126 real(kind=rb) :: znifddir(nlay+2) ! temporary near-IR downward direct shortwave flux (w/m2)
9127 real(kind=rb) :: znicddir(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky near-IR downward direct shortwave flux (w/m2)
9128
9129! Optional output fields
9130 real(kind=rb) :: swnflx(nlay+2) ! Total sky shortwave net flux (W/m2)
9131 real(kind=rb) :: swnflxc(nlay+2) ! Clear sky shortwave net flux (W/m2)
9132 real(kind=rb) :: dirdflux(nlay+2) ! Direct downward shortwave surface flux
9133 real(kind=rb) :: difdflux(nlay+2) ! Diffuse downward shortwave surface flux
9134 real(kind=rb) :: uvdflx(nlay+2) ! Total sky downward shortwave flux, UV/vis
9135 real(kind=rb) :: nidflx(nlay+2) ! Total sky downward shortwave flux, near-IR
9136 real(kind=rb) :: dirdnuv(nlay+2) ! Direct downward shortwave flux, UV/vis
9137 real(kind=rb) :: difdnuv(nlay+2) ! Diffuse downward shortwave flux, UV/vis
9138 real(kind=rb) :: dirdnir(nlay+2) ! Direct downward shortwave flux, near-IR
9139 real(kind=rb) :: difdnir(nlay+2) ! Diffuse downward shortwave flux, near-IR
9140
9141! Output - inactive
9142! real(kind=rb) :: zuvfu(nlay+2) ! temporary upward UV shortwave flux (w/m2)
9143! real(kind=rb) :: zuvfd(nlay+2) ! temporary downward UV shortwave flux (w/m2)
9144! real(kind=rb) :: zuvcu(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky upward UV shortwave flux (w/m2)
9145! real(kind=rb) :: zuvcd(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky downward UV shortwave flux (w/m2)
9146! real(kind=rb) :: zvsfu(nlay+2) ! temporary upward visible shortwave flux (w/m2)
9147! real(kind=rb) :: zvsfd(nlay+2) ! temporary downward visible shortwave flux (w/m2)
9148! real(kind=rb) :: zvscu(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky upward visible shortwave flux (w/m2)
9149! real(kind=rb) :: zvscd(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky downward visible shortwave flux (w/m2)
9150! real(kind=rb) :: znifu(nlay+2) ! temporary upward near-IR shortwave flux (w/m2)
9151! real(kind=rb) :: znifd(nlay+2) ! temporary downward near-IR shortwave flux (w/m2)
9152! real(kind=rb) :: znicu(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky upward near-IR shortwave flux (w/m2)
9153! real(kind=rb) :: znicd(nlay+2) ! temporary clear sky downward near-IR shortwave flux (w/m2)
9154
9155
9156! Initializations
9157
9158 iout = 0 !BSINGH(PNNL) initializing iout to zero(Might be wrong!) as this variable is never initialized but used in spcvmc_sw
9159 zepsec = 1.e-06_rb
9160 zepzen = 1.e-10_rb
9161!jm not thread safe oneminus = 1.0_rb - zepsec
9162!jm not thread safe pi = 2._rb * asin(1._rb)
9163
9164 istart = jpb1
9165 iend = jpb2
9166 icpr = 0
9167 ims = 2
9168
9169! In a GCM with or without McICA, set nlon to the longitude dimension
9170!
9171! Set imca to select calculation type:
9172! imca = 0, use standard forward model calculation (clear and overcast only)
9173! imca = 1, use McICA for Monte Carlo treatment of sub-grid cloud variability
9174! (clear, overcast or partial cloud conditions)
9175
9176! *** This version uses McICA (imca = 1) ***
9177
9178! Set icld to select of clear or cloud calculation and cloud
9179! overlap method (read by subroutine readprof from input file INPUT_RRTM):
9180! icld = 0, clear only
9181! icld = 1, with clouds using random cloud overlap (McICA only)
9182! icld = 2, with clouds using maximum/random cloud overlap (McICA only)
9183! icld = 3, with clouds using maximum cloud overlap (McICA only)
9184 if (icld.lt.0.or.icld.gt.3) icld = 2
9185
9186! Set iaer to select aerosol option
9187! iaer = 0, no aerosols
9188! iaer = 6, use six ECMWF aerosol types
9189! input aerosol optical depth at 0.55 microns for each aerosol type (ecaer)
9190! iaer = 10, input total aerosol optical depth, single scattering albedo
9191! and asymmetry parameter (tauaer, ssaaer, asmaer) directly
9192 if ( aer_opt.eq.0 .or. aer_opt.eq.2 .or. aer_opt.eq.3) then
9193 iaer = 10
9194 else if ( aer_opt .eq. 1 ) then
9195 iaer = 6
9196 endif
9197
9198! Call model and data initialization, compute lookup tables, perform
9199! reduction of g-points from 224 to 112 for input absorption
9200! coefficient data and other arrays.
9201!
9202! In a GCM this call should be placed in the model initialization
9203! area, since this has to be called only once.
9204! call rrtmg_sw_ini(cpdair)
9205
9206! This is the main longitude/column loop in RRTMG.
9207! Modify to loop over all columns (nlon) or over daylight columns
9208
9209 do iplon = 1, ncol
9210
9211! Prepare atmosphere profile from GCM for use in RRTMG, and define
9212! other input parameters
9213
9214 call inatm_sw (iplon, nlay, icld, iaer, &
9215 play, plev, tlay, tlev, tsfc, h2ovmr, &
9216 o3vmr, co2vmr, ch4vmr, n2ovmr, o2vmr, &
9217 adjes, dyofyr, scon, inflgsw, iceflgsw, liqflgsw, &
9218 cldfmcl, taucmcl, ssacmcl, asmcmcl, fsfcmcl, ciwpmcl, clwpmcl, cswpmcl, &
9219 reicmcl, relqmcl, resnmcl, tauaer, ssaaer, asmaer, &
9220 nlayers, pavel, pz, pdp, tavel, tz, tbound, coldry, wkl, &
9221 adjflux, solvar, inflag, iceflag, liqflag, cldfmc, taucmc, &
9222 ssacmc, asmcmc, fsfcmc, ciwpmc, clwpmc, cswpmc, reicmc, relqmc, resnmc, &
9223 taua, ssaa, asma)
9224
9225! For cloudy atmosphere, use cldprop to set cloud optical properties based on
9226! input cloud physical properties. Select method based on choices described
9227! in cldprop. Cloud fraction, water path, liquid droplet and ice particle
9228! effective radius must be passed in cldprop. Cloud fraction and cloud
9229! optical properties are transferred to rrtmg_sw arrays in cldprop.
9230
9231 call cldprmc_sw(nlayers, inflag, iceflag, liqflag, cldfmc, &
9232 ciwpmc, clwpmc, cswpmc, reicmc, relqmc, resnmc, &
9233 taormc, taucmc, ssacmc, asmcmc, fsfcmc)
9234 icpr = 1
9235
9236! Calculate coefficients for the temperature and pressure dependence of the
9237! molecular absorption coefficients by interpolating data from stored
9238! reference atmospheres.
9239
9240 call setcoef_sw(nlayers, pavel, tavel, pz, tz, tbound, coldry, wkl, &
9241 laytrop, layswtch, laylow, jp, jt, jt1, &
9242 co2mult, colch4, colco2, colh2o, colmol, coln2o, &
9243 colo2, colo3, fac00, fac01, fac10, fac11, &
9244 selffac, selffrac, indself, forfac, forfrac, indfor)
9245
9246
9247! Cosine of the solar zenith angle
9248! Prevent using value of zero; ideally, SW model is not called from host model when sun
9249! is below horizon
9250
9251 cossza = coszen(iplon)
9252 if (cossza .le. zepzen) cossza = zepzen
9253
9254! Transfer albedo, cloud and aerosol properties into arrays for 2-stream radiative transfer
9255
9256! Surface albedo
9257! Near-IR bands 16-24 and 29 (1-9 and 14), 820-16000 cm-1, 0.625-12.195 microns
9258 do ib=1,9
9259 albdir(ib) = aldir(iplon)
9260 albdif(ib) = aldif(iplon)
9261 enddo
9262 albdir(nbndsw) = aldir(iplon)
9263 albdif(nbndsw) = aldif(iplon)
9264! UV/visible bands 25-28 (10-13), 16000-50000 cm-1, 0.200-0.625 micron
9265 do ib=10,13
9266 albdir(ib) = asdir(iplon)
9267 albdif(ib) = asdif(iplon)
9268 enddo
9269
9270
9271! Clouds
9272 if (icld.eq.0) then
9273
9274 zcldfmc(:,:) = 0._rb
9275 ztaucmc(:,:) = 0._rb
9276 ztaormc(:,:) = 0._rb
9277 zasycmc(:,:) = 0._rb
9278 zomgcmc(:,:) = 1._rb
9279
9280 elseif (icld.ge.1) then
9281 do i=1,nlayers
9282 do ig=1,ngptsw
9283 zcldfmc(i,ig) = cldfmc(ig,i)
9284 ztaucmc(i,ig) = taucmc(ig,i)
9285 ztaormc(i,ig) = taormc(ig,i)
9286 zasycmc(i,ig) = asmcmc(ig,i)
9287 zomgcmc(i,ig) = ssacmc(ig,i)
9288 enddo
9289 enddo
9290
9291 endif
9292
9293! Aerosol
9294! IAER = 0: no aerosols
9295 if (iaer.eq.0) then
9296
9297 ztaua(:,:) = 0._rb
9298 zasya(:,:) = 0._rb
9299 zomga(:,:) = 1._rb
9300
9301! IAER = 6: Use ECMWF six aerosol types. See rrsw_aer.f90 for details.
9302! Input aerosol optical thickness at 0.55 micron for each aerosol type (ecaer),
9303! or set manually here for each aerosol and layer.
9304 elseif (iaer.eq.6) then
9305
9306! do i = 1, nlayers
9307! do ia = 1, naerec
9308! ecaer(iplon,i,ia) = 1.0e-15_rb
9309! enddo
9310! enddo
9311
9312 do i = 1, nlayers
9313 do ib = 1, nbndsw
9314 ztaua(i,ib) = 0._rb
9315 zasya(i,ib) = 0._rb
9316 zomga(i,ib) = 0._rb
9317 do ia = 1, naerec
9318 ztaua(i,ib) = ztaua(i,ib) + rsrtaua(ib,ia) * ecaer(iplon,i,ia)
9319 zomga(i,ib) = zomga(i,ib) + rsrtaua(ib,ia) * ecaer(iplon,i,ia) * &
9320 rsrpiza(ib,ia)
9321 zasya(i,ib) = zasya(i,ib) + rsrtaua(ib,ia) * ecaer(iplon,i,ia) * &
9322 rsrpiza(ib,ia) * rsrasya(ib,ia)
9323 enddo
9324 if (zomga(i,ib) /= 0._rb) then
9325 zasya(i,ib) = zasya(i,ib) / zomga(i,ib)
9326 endif
9327 if (ztaua(i,ib) /= 0._rb) then
9328 zomga(i,ib) = zomga(i,ib) / ztaua(i,ib)
9329 endif
9330 enddo
9331 enddo
9332
9333! IAER=10: Direct specification of aerosol optical properties from GCM
9334 elseif (iaer.eq.10) then
9335
9336 do i = 1 ,nlayers
9337 do ib = 1 ,nbndsw
9338 ztaua(i,ib) = taua(i,ib)
9339 zasya(i,ib) = asma(i,ib)
9340 zomga(i,ib) = ssaa(i,ib)
9341 enddo
9342 enddo
9343
9344 endif
9345
9346
9347! Call the 2-stream radiation transfer model
9348
9349 do i=1,nlayers+1
9350 zbbcu(i) = 0._rb
9351 zbbcd(i) = 0._rb
9352 zbbfu(i) = 0._rb
9353 zbbfd(i) = 0._rb
9354 zbbcddir(i) = 0._rb
9355 zbbfddir(i) = 0._rb
9356 zuvcd(i) = 0._rb
9357 zuvfd(i) = 0._rb
9358 zuvcddir(i) = 0._rb
9359 zuvfddir(i) = 0._rb
9360 znicd(i) = 0._rb
9361 znifd(i) = 0._rb
9362 znicddir(i) = 0._rb
9363 znifddir(i) = 0._rb
9364 enddo
9365
9366 call spcvmc_sw &
9367 (nlayers, istart, iend, icpr, iout, &
9368 pavel, tavel, pz, tz, tbound, albdif, albdir, &
9369 zcldfmc, ztaucmc, zasycmc, zomgcmc, ztaormc, &
9370 ztaua, zasya, zomga, cossza, coldry, wkl, adjflux, &
9371 laytrop, layswtch, laylow, jp, jt, jt1, &
9372 co2mult, colch4, colco2, colh2o, colmol, coln2o, colo2, colo3, &
9373 fac00, fac01, fac10, fac11, &
9374 selffac, selffrac, indself, forfac, forfrac, indfor, &
9375 zbbfd, zbbfu, zbbcd, zbbcu, zuvfd, zuvcd, znifd, znicd, &
9376 zbbfddir, zbbcddir, zuvfddir, zuvcddir, znifddir, znicddir)
9377
9378! Transfer up and down, clear and total sky fluxes to output arrays.
9379! Vertical indexing goes from bottom to top; reverse here for GCM if necessary.
9380
9381 do i = 1, nlayers+1
9382 swuflxc(iplon,i) = zbbcu(i)
9383 swdflxc(iplon,i) = zbbcd(i)
9384 swuflx(iplon,i) = zbbfu(i)
9385 swdflx(iplon,i) = zbbfd(i)
9386 uvdflx(i) = zuvfd(i)
9387 nidflx(i) = znifd(i)
9388
9389! Direct/diffuse fluxes
9390 dirdflux(i) = zbbfddir(i)
9391 difdflux(i) = swdflx(iplon,i) - dirdflux(i)
9392 swdkdir(iplon,i) = dirdflux(i) ! all-sky direct flux jararias, 2013/08/10
9393 swdkdif(iplon,i) = difdflux(i) ! all-sky diffuse flux jararias, 2013/08/10
9394
9395! UV/visible direct/diffuse fluxes
9396 dirdnuv(i) = zuvfddir(i)
9397 difdnuv(i) = zuvfd(i) - dirdnuv(i)
9398! ------- Zhenxin add vis/uv downwards dir or dif here --!
9399 sibvisdir(iplon,i) = dirdnuv(i)
9400 sibvisdif(iplon,i) = difdnuv(i)
9401! ----- End of Zhenxin addition ------------!
9402! Near-IR direct/diffuse fluxes
9403 dirdnir(i) = znifddir(i)
9404 difdnir(i) = znifd(i) - dirdnir(i)
9405! ---------Zhenxin add nir downwards dir and dif here --!
9406 sibnirdir(iplon,i) = dirdnir(i)
9407 sibnirdif(iplon,i) = difdnir(i)
9408! -------- End of Zhenxin addition 2011-05 ---------!
9409 enddo
9410
9411! Total and clear sky net fluxes
9412 do i = 1, nlayers+1
9413 swnflxc(i) = swdflxc(iplon,i) - swuflxc(iplon,i)
9414 swnflx(i) = swdflx(iplon,i) - swuflx(iplon,i)
9415 enddo
9416
9417! Total and clear sky heating rates
9418 do i = 1, nlayers
9419 zdpgcp = heatfac / pdp(i)
9420 swhrc(iplon,i) = (swnflxc(i+1) - swnflxc(i)) * zdpgcp
9421 swhr(iplon,i) = (swnflx(i+1) - swnflx(i)) * zdpgcp
9422 enddo
9423 swhrc(iplon,nlayers) = 0._rb
9424 swhr(iplon,nlayers) = 0._rb
9425
9426! End longitude loop
9427 enddo
9428
9429 end subroutine rrtmg_sw
9430
9431!*************************************************************************
9432 real(kind=rb) function earth_sun(idn)
9433!*************************************************************************
9434!
9435! Purpose: Function to calculate the correction factor of Earth's orbit
9436! for current day of the year
9437
9438! idn : Day of the year
9439! earth_sun : square of the ratio of mean to actual Earth-Sun distance
9440
9441! ------- Modules -------
9442
9443 use rrsw_con, only : pi
9444
9445 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: idn
9446
9447 real(kind=rb) :: gamma
9448
9449 gamma = 2._rb*pi*(idn-1)/365._rb
9450
9451! Use Iqbal's equation 1.2.1
9452
9453 earth_sun = 1.000110_rb + .034221_rb * cos(gamma) + .001289_rb * sin(gamma) + &
9454 .000719_rb * cos(2._rb*gamma) + .000077_rb * sin(2._rb*gamma)
9455
9456 end function earth_sun
9457
9458!***************************************************************************
9459 subroutine inatm_sw (iplon, nlay, icld, iaer, &
9460 play, plev, tlay, tlev, tsfc, h2ovmr, &
9461 o3vmr, co2vmr, ch4vmr, n2ovmr, o2vmr, &
9462 adjes, dyofyr, scon, inflgsw, iceflgsw, liqflgsw, &
9463 cldfmcl, taucmcl, ssacmcl, asmcmcl, fsfcmcl, ciwpmcl, clwpmcl, cswpmcl, &
9464 reicmcl, relqmcl, resnmcl, tauaer, ssaaer, asmaer, &
9465 nlayers, pavel, pz, pdp, tavel, tz, tbound, coldry, wkl, &
9466 adjflux, solvar, inflag, iceflag, liqflag, cldfmc, taucmc, &
9467 ssacmc, asmcmc, fsfcmc, ciwpmc, clwpmc, cswpmc, reicmc, relqmc, resnmc, &
9468 taua, ssaa, asma)
9469!***************************************************************************
9470!
9471! Input atmospheric profile from GCM, and prepare it for use in RRTMG_SW.
9472! Set other RRTMG_SW input parameters.
9473!
9474!***************************************************************************
9475
9476! --------- Modules ----------
9477
9478 use parrrsw, only : nbndsw, ngptsw, nstr, nmol, mxmol, &
9479 jpband, jpb1, jpb2, rrsw_scon
9480 use rrsw_con, only : heatfac, oneminus, pi, grav, avogad
9481 use rrsw_wvn, only : ng, nspa, nspb, wavenum1, wavenum2, delwave
9482
9483! ------- Declarations -------
9484
9485! ----- Input -----
9486 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: iplon ! column loop index
9487 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: nlay ! number of model layers
9488 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: icld ! clear/cloud and cloud overlap flag
9489 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: iaer ! aerosol option flag
9490
9491 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: play(:,:) ! Layer pressures (hPa, mb)
9492 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9493 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: plev(:,:) ! Interface pressures (hPa, mb)
9494 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1)
9495 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tlay(:,:) ! Layer temperatures (K)
9496 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9497 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tlev(:,:) ! Interface temperatures (K)
9498 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay+1)
9499 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tsfc(:) ! Surface temperature (K)
9500 ! Dimensions: (ncol)
9501 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: h2ovmr(:,:) ! H2O volume mixing ratio
9502 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9503 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: o3vmr(:,:) ! O3 volume mixing ratio
9504 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9505 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: co2vmr(:,:) ! CO2 volume mixing ratio
9506 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9507 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ch4vmr(:,:) ! Methane volume mixing ratio
9508 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9509 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: n2ovmr(:,:) ! Nitrous oxide volume mixing ratio
9510 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9511 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: o2vmr(:,:) ! Oxygen volume mixing ratio
9512 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9513
9514 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: dyofyr ! Day of the year (used to get Earth/Sun
9515 ! distance if adjflx not provided)
9516 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: adjes ! Flux adjustment for Earth/Sun distance
9517 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: scon ! Solar constant (W/m2)
9518
9519 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: inflgsw ! Flag for cloud optical properties
9520 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: iceflgsw ! Flag for ice particle specification
9521 integer(kind=im), intent(in) :: liqflgsw ! Flag for liquid droplet specification
9522
9523 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cldfmcl(:,:,:) ! Cloud fraction
9524 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9525 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: taucmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud optical depth (optional)
9526 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9527 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ssacmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud single scattering albedo
9528 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9529 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: asmcmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud asymmetry parameter
9530 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9531 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: fsfcmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud forward scattering fraction
9532 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9533 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ciwpmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud ice water path (g/m2)
9534 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9535 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: clwpmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud liquid water path (g/m2)
9536 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9537 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: cswpmcl(:,:,:) ! In-cloud snow water path (g/m2)
9538 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,ncol,nlay)
9539 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: reicmcl(:,:) ! Cloud ice effective size (microns)
9540 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9541 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: relqmcl(:,:) ! Cloud water drop effective radius (microns)
9542 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9543 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: resnmcl(:,:) ! Cloud snow effective radius (microns)
9544 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay)
9545
9546 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: tauaer(:,:,:) ! Aerosol optical depth
9547 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay,nbndsw)
9548 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: ssaaer(:,:,:) ! Aerosol single scattering albedo
9549 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay,nbndsw)
9550 real(kind=rb), intent(in) :: asmaer(:,:,:) ! Aerosol asymmetry parameter
9551 ! Dimensions: (ncol,nlay,nbndsw)
9552
9553! Atmosphere
9554 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: nlayers ! number of layers
9555
9556 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: pavel(:) ! layer pressures (mb)
9557 ! Dimensions: (nlay)
9558 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: tavel(:) ! layer temperatures (K)
9559 ! Dimensions: (nlay)
9560 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: pz(0:) ! level (interface) pressures (hPa, mb)
9561 ! Dimensions: (0:nlay)
9562 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: tz(0:) ! level (interface) temperatures (K)
9563 ! Dimensions: (0:nlay)
9564 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: tbound ! surface temperature (K)
9565 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: pdp(:) ! layer pressure thickness (hPa, mb)
9566 ! Dimensions: (nlay)
9567 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: coldry(:) ! dry air column density (mol/cm2)
9568 ! Dimensions: (nlay)
9569 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: wkl(:,:) ! molecular amounts (mol/cm-2)
9570 ! Dimensions: (mxmol,nlay)
9571
9572 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: adjflux(:) ! adjustment for current Earth/Sun distance
9573 ! Dimensions: (jpband)
9574 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: solvar(:) ! solar constant scaling factor from rrtmg_sw
9575 ! Dimensions: (jpband)
9576 ! default value of 1368.22 Wm-2 at 1 AU
9577 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: taua(:,:) ! Aerosol optical depth
9578 ! Dimensions: (nlay,nbndsw)
9579 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ssaa(:,:) ! Aerosol single scattering albedo
9580 ! Dimensions: (nlay,nbndsw)
9581 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: asma(:,:) ! Aerosol asymmetry parameter
9582 ! Dimensions: (nlay,nbndsw)
9583
9584! Atmosphere/clouds - cldprop
9585 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: inflag ! flag for cloud property method
9586 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: iceflag ! flag for ice cloud properties
9587 integer(kind=im), intent(out) :: liqflag ! flag for liquid cloud properties
9588
9589 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: cldfmc(:,:) ! layer cloud fraction
9590 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9591 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: taucmc(:,:) ! in-cloud optical depth (non-delta scaled)
9592 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9593 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ssacmc(:,:) ! in-cloud single scattering albedo (non-delta-scaled)
9594 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9595 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: asmcmc(:,:) ! in-cloud asymmetry parameter (non-delta scaled)
9596 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9597 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: fsfcmc(:,:) ! in-cloud forward scattering fraction (non-delta scaled)
9598 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9599 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: ciwpmc(:,:) ! in-cloud ice water path
9600 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9601 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: clwpmc(:,:) ! in-cloud liquid water path
9602 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9603 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: cswpmc(:,:) ! in-cloud snow path
9604 ! Dimensions: (ngptsw,nlay)
9605 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: relqmc(:) ! liquid particle effective radius (microns)
9606 ! Dimensions: (nlay)
9607 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: reicmc(:) ! ice particle effective size (microns)
9608 ! Dimensions: (nlay)
9609 real(kind=rb), intent(out) :: resnmc(:) ! snow particle effective size (microns)
9610 ! Dimensions: (nlay)
9611
9612! ----- Local -----
9613 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amd = 28.9660_rb ! Effective molecular weight of dry air (g/mol)
9614 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amw = 18.0160_rb ! Molecular weight of water vapor (g/mol)
9615! real(kind=rb), parameter :: amc = 44.0098_rb ! Molecular weight of carbon dioxide (g/mol)
9616! real(kind=rb), parameter :: amo = 47.9998_rb ! Molecular weight of ozone (g/mol)
9617! real(kind=rb), parameter :: amo2 = 31.9999_rb ! Molecular weight of oxygen (g/mol)
9618! real(kind=rb), parameter :: amch4 = 16.0430_rb ! Molecular weight of methane (g/mol)
9619! real(kind=rb), parameter :: amn2o = 44.0128_rb ! Molecular weight of nitrous oxide (g/mol)
9620
9621! Set molecular weight ratios (for converting mmr to vmr)
9622! e.g. h2ovmr = h2ommr * amdw)
9623 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdw = 1.607793_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / water vapor
9624 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdc = 0.658114_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / carbon dioxide
9625 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdo = 0.603428_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / ozone
9626 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdm = 1.805423_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / methane
9627 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdn = 0.658090_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / nitrous oxide
9628 real(kind=rb), parameter :: amdo2 = 0.905140_rb ! Molecular weight of dry air / oxygen
9629
9630 real(kind=rb), parameter :: sbc = 5.67e-08_rb ! Stefan-Boltzmann constant (W/m2K4)
9631
9632 integer(kind=im) :: isp, l, ix, n, imol, ib, ig ! Loop indices
9633 real(kind=rb) :: amm, summol !
9634 real(kind=rb) :: adjflx ! flux adjustment for Earth/Sun distance
9635! real(kind=rb) :: earth_sun ! function for Earth/Sun distance adjustment
9636
9637 nlayers = nlay
9638
9639! Initialize all molecular amounts to zero here, then pass input amounts
9640! into RRTM array WKL below.
9641
9642 wkl(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9643 cldfmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9644 taucmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9645 ssacmc(:,:) = 1.0_rb
9646 asmcmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9647 fsfcmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9648 ciwpmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9649 clwpmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9650 cswpmc(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9651 reicmc(:) = 0.0_rb
9652 relqmc(:) = 0.0_rb
9653 resnmc(:) = 0.0_rb
9654 taua(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9655 ssaa(:,:) = 1.0_rb
9656 asma(:,:) = 0.0_rb
9657
9658! Set flux adjustment for current Earth/Sun distance (two options).
9659! 1) Use Earth/Sun distance flux adjustment provided by GCM (input as adjes);
9660 adjflx = adjes
9661!
9662! 2) Calculate Earth/Sun distance from DYOFYR, the cumulative day of the year.
9663! (Set adjflx to 1. to use constant Earth/Sun distance of 1 AU).
9664 if (dyofyr .gt. 0) then
9665 adjflx = earth_sun(dyofyr)
9666 endif
9667
9668! Set incoming solar flux adjustment to include adjustment for
9669! current Earth/Sun distance (ADJFLX) and scaling of default internal
9670! solar constant (rrsw_scon = 1368.22 Wm-2) by band (SOLVAR). SOLVAR can be set
9671! to a single scaling factor as needed, or to a different value in each
9672! band, which may be necessary for paleoclimate simulations.
9673!
9674 do ib = jpb1,jpb2
9675! solvar(ib) = 1._rb
9676 solvar(ib) = scon / rrsw_scon
9677 adjflux(ib) = adjflx * solvar(ib)
9678 enddo
9679
9680! Set surface temperature.
9681 tbound = tsfc(iplon)
9682
9683! Install input GCM arrays into RRTMG_SW arrays for pressure, temperature,
9684! and molecular amounts.
9685! Pressures are input in mb, or are converted to mb here.
9686! Molecular amounts are input in volume mixing ratio, or are converted from
9687! mass mixing ratio (or specific humidity for h2o) to volume mixing ratio
9688! here. These are then converted to molecular amount (molec/cm2) below.
9689! The dry air column COLDRY (in molec/cm2) is calculated from the level
9690! pressures, pz (in mb), based on the hydrostatic equation and includes a
9691! correction to account for h2o in the layer. The molecular weight of moist
9692! air (amm) is calculated for each layer.
9693! Note: In RRTMG, layer indexing goes from bottom to top, and coding below
9694! assumes GCM input fields are also bottom to top. Input layer indexing
9695! from GCM fields should be reversed here if necessary.
9696
9697 pz(0) = plev(iplon,1)
9698 tz(0) = tlev(iplon,1)
9699 do l = 1, nlayers
9700 pavel(l) = play(iplon,l)
9701 tavel(l) = tlay(iplon,l)
9702 pz(l) = plev(iplon,l+1)
9703 tz(l) = tlev(iplon,l+1)
9704 pdp(l) = pz(l-1) - pz(l)
9705! For h2o input in vmr:
9706 wkl(1,l) = h2ovmr(iplon,l)
9707! For h2o input in mmr:
9708! wkl(1,l) = h2o(iplon,l)*amdw
9709! For h2o input in specific humidity;
9710! wkl(1,l) = (h2o(iplon,l)/(1._rb - h2o(iplon,l)))*amdw
9711 wkl(2,l) = co2vmr(iplon,l)
9712 wkl(3,l) = o3vmr(iplon,l)
9713 wkl(4,l) = n2ovmr(iplon,l)
9714 wkl(6,l) = ch4vmr(iplon,l)
9715 wkl(7,l) = o2vmr(iplon,l)
9716 amm = (1._rb - wkl(1,l)) * amd + wkl(1,l) * amw
9717 coldry(l) = (pz(l-1)-pz(l)) * 1.e3_rb * avogad / &
9718 (1.e2_rb * grav * amm * (1._rb + wkl(1,l)))
9719 enddo
9720
9721! The following section can be used to set values for an additional layer (from
9722! the GCM top level to 1.e-4 mb) for improved calculation of TOA fluxes.
9723! Temperature and molecular amounts in the extra model layer are set to
9724! their values in the top GCM model layer, though these can be modified
9725! here if necessary.
9726! If this feature is utilized, increase nlayers by one above, limit the two
9727! loops above to (nlayers-1), and set the top most (nlayers) layer values here.
9728
9729! pavel(nlayers) = 0.5_rb * pz(nlayers-1)
9730! tavel(nlayers) = tavel(nlayers-1)
9731! pz(nlayers) = 1.e-4_rb
9732! tz(nlayers-1) = 0.5_rb * (tavel(nlayers)+tavel(nlayers-1))
9733! tz(nlayers) = tz(nlayers-1)
9734! pdp(nlayers) = pz(nlayers-1) - pz(nlayers)
9735! wkl(1,nlayers) = wkl(1,nlayers-1)
9736! wkl(2,nlayers) = wkl(2,nlayers-1)
9737! wkl(3,nlayers) = wkl(3,nlayers-1)
9738! wkl(4,nlayers) = wkl(4,nlayers-1)
9739! wkl(6,nlayers) = wkl(6,nlayers-1)
9740! wkl(7,nlayers) = wkl(7,nlayers-1)
9741! amm = (1._rb - wkl(1,nlayers-1)) * amd + wkl(1,nlayers-1) * amw
9742! coldry(nlayers) = (pz(nlayers-1)) * 1.e3_rb * avogad / &
9743! (1.e2_rb * grav * amm * (1._rb + wkl(1,nlayers-1)))
9744
9745! At this point all molecular amounts in wkl are in volume mixing ratio;
9746! convert to molec/cm2 based on coldry for use in rrtm.
9747
9748 do l = 1, nlayers
9749 do imol = 1, nmol
9750 wkl(imol,l) = coldry(l) * wkl(imol,l)
9751 enddo
9752 enddo
9753
9754! Transfer aerosol optical properties to RRTM variables;
9755! modify to reverse layer indexing here if necessary.
9756
9757 if (iaer .ge. 1) then
9758 do l = 1, nlayers
9759 do ib = 1, nbndsw
9760 taua(l,ib) = tauaer(iplon,l,ib)
9761 ssaa(l,ib) = ssaaer(iplon,l,ib)
9762 asma(l,ib) = asmaer(iplon,l,ib)
9763 enddo
9764 enddo
9765 endif
9766
9767! Transfer cloud fraction and cloud optical properties to RRTM variables;
9768! modify to reverse layer indexing here if necessary.
9769
9770 if (icld .ge. 1) then
9771 inflag = inflgsw
9772 iceflag = iceflgsw
9773 liqflag = liqflgsw
9774
9775! Move incoming GCM cloud arrays to RRTMG cloud arrays.
9776! For GCM input, incoming reicmcl is defined based on selected ice parameterization (inflgsw)
9777
9778 do l = 1, nlayers
9779 do ig = 1, ngptsw
9780 cldfmc(ig,l) = cldfmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9781 taucmc(ig,l) = taucmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9782 ssacmc(ig,l) = ssacmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9783 asmcmc(ig,l) = asmcmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9784 fsfcmc(ig,l) = fsfcmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9785 ciwpmc(ig,l) = ciwpmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9786 clwpmc(ig,l) = clwpmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9787 if (iceflag.eq.5) then
9788 cswpmc(ig,l)=cswpmcl(ig,iplon,l)
9789 endif
9790 enddo
9791 reicmc(l) = reicmcl(iplon,l)
9792 relqmc(l) = relqmcl(iplon,l)
9793 if (iceflag.eq.5) then
9794 resnmc(l) = resnmcl(iplon,l)
9795 endif
9796 enddo
9797
9798! If an extra layer is being used in RRTMG, set all cloud properties to zero in the extra layer.
9799
9800! cldfmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9801! taucmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9802! ssacmc(:,nlayers) = 1.0_rb
9803! asmcmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9804! fsfcmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9805! ciwpmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9806! clwpmc(:,nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9807! reicmc(nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9808! relqmc(nlayers) = 0.0_rb
9809
9810 endif
9811
9812 end subroutine inatm_sw
9813
9814 end module rrtmg_sw_rad
9815
9816!------------------------------------------------------------------
9817MODULE module_ra_rrtmg_sw
9818
9819#if defined(mpas)
9820!MPAS specific (Laura D. Fowler):
9821use mpas_atmphys_constants,only : cp,g=>gravity
9822use module_ra_rrtmg_vinterp,only: vinterp_ozn
9823
9843!MPAS specfic end.
9844
9845#else
9846use module_model_constants,only : cp
9847USE module_wrf_error
9848#if (HWRF == 1)
9849USE module_state_description, ONLY : fer_mp_hires, fer_mp_hires_advect, etamp_hwrf
9850#else
9851USE module_state_description, ONLY : fer_mp_hires, fer_mp_hires_advect
9852#endif
9853!USE module_dm
9854#endif
9855
9856use parrrsw, only : nbndsw, ngptsw, naerec
9857use rrtmg_sw_init, only: rrtmg_sw_ini
9858use rrtmg_sw_rad, only: rrtmg_sw
9859use mcica_subcol_gen_sw, only: mcica_subcol_sw
9860
9861use module_ra_rrtmg_lw, only : inirad, o3data, relcalc, reicalc, retab
9862! mcica_random_numbers, randomNumberSequence, &
9863! new_RandomNumberSequence, getRandomReal
9864
9865CONTAINS
9866
9867!=================================================================================================================
9868 subroutine rrtmg_swrad( &
9869 p3d,p8w,pi3d,t3d,t8w,dz8w,qv3d,qc3d,qr3d, &
9870 qi3d,qs3d,qg3d,cldfra3d,o33d,tsk,albedo, &
9871 xland,xice,snow,coszr,xtime,gmt,julday,radt, &
9872 degrad,declin,solcon,xlat,xlong,icloud,o3input, &
9873 noznlevels,pin,o3clim,gsw,swcf,rthratensw, &
9874 has_reqc,has_reqi,has_reqs,re_cloud, &
9875 re_ice,re_snow, &
9876 swupt, swuptc, swdnt, swdntc, &
9877 swupb, swupbc, swdnb, swdnbc, &
9878 swupflx, swupflxc, swdnflx, swdnflxc, &
9879 ids,ide, jds,jde, kds,kde, &
9880 ims,ime, jms,jme, kms,kme, &
9881 its,ite, jts,jte, kts,kte &
9882 )
9883
9884 implicit none
9885
9886!=================================================================================================================
9887
9888!--- input arguments:
9889 integer,intent(in):: ids,ide, jds,jde, kds,kde, &
9890 ims,ime, jms,jme, kms,kme, &
9891 its,ite, jts,jte, kts,kte
9892 integer,intent(in):: icloud,has_reqc,has_reqi,has_reqs
9893 integer,intent(in):: julday
9894 integer,intent(in),optional:: o3input
9895
9896 real,intent(in):: radt,degrad,xtime,declin,solcon,gmt
9897 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,jms:jme):: xlat,xlong
9898 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,jms:jme):: albedo,tsk,snow,xice,xland
9899 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: t3d,p3d,pi3d
9900 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: dz8w,p8w,t8w
9901
9902 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: re_cloud,re_ice,re_snow
9903 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme),optional:: &
9904 cldfra3d,qv3d,qc3d,qr3d,qi3d,qs3d,qg3d,o33d
9905
9906!--- additional input arguments to use the CAM ozone climatology:
9907 integer,intent(in):: noznlevels
9908 real,intent(in),dimension(1:noznlevels),optional:: pin
9909 real,intent(in),dimension(ims:ime,1:noznlevels,jms:jme),optional:: o3clim
9910
9911!--- inout arguments:
9912 real,intent(inout),dimension(ims:ime,jms:jme):: coszr,gsw,swcf
9913 real,intent(inout),dimension(ims:ime,jms:jme),optional:: &
9914 swupt,swuptc,swdnt,swdntc,swupb,swupbc,swdnb,swdnbc
9915
9916 real,intent(inout),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme,jms:jme):: rthratensw
9917
9918!--- output arguments:
9919 real,intent(out),dimension(ims:ime,kms:kme+2,jms:jme ),optional:: &
9920 swupflx,swupflxc,swdnflx,swdnflxc
9921
9922!local variables and arrays:
9923 logical:: dorrsw
9924
9925 integer:: na,nb,ncol,nlay,icld,inflgsw,iceflgsw,liqflgsw
9926 integer:: dyofyr
9927 integer:: iplon,irng,permuteseed
9928 integer:: pcols,pver
9929 integer:: idx_rei
9930 integer:: i,j,k,n
9931
9932 real:: coszrs,xt24,tloctm,hrang,xxlat,adjes,scon
9933 real:: ro,dz
9934 real:: corr
9935 real:: gliqwp,gicewp,gsnowp,gravmks
9936 real:: snow_mass_factor
9937 real,dimension(1):: tsfc,landfrac,landm,snowh,icefrac
9938 real,dimension(1):: asdir,asdif,aldir,aldif,coszen
9939 real,dimension(1,1:kte-kts+1):: pdel,cicewp,cliqwp,csnowp,reliq,reice,resnow
9940 real,dimension(kts:kte):: &
9941 tten1d,cldfra1d,dz1d,p1d,t1d,qv1d,qc1d,qr1d,qi1d,qs1d,qg1d,o31d
9942 real,dimension(kts:kte+1):: pw1d,tw1d
9943 real,dimension(kts:kte+1):: o3mmr
9944
9945!--- additional local variables and arrays needed to include additional layers between the model top
9946! and the top of the atmosphere:
9947 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+1):: play,tlay,h2ovmr,o3vmr,co2vmr,o2vmr,ch4vmr,n2ovmr
9948 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+1):: clwpth,ciwpth,cswpth,rel,rei,res,cldfrac,relqmcl,reicmcl,resnmcl
9949 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+1):: swhr,swhrc
9950
9951 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+2):: plev,tlev
9952 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+2):: swuflx,swdflx,swuflxc,swdflxc
9953 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+2):: sibvisdir,sibvisdif,sibnirdir,sibnirdif
9954 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+2):: swdkdir,swdkdif
9955
9956 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+1,nbndsw):: tauaer,ssaaer,asmaer
9957
9958 real,dimension(nbndsw,1,kts:kte+1):: taucld,ssacld,asmcld,fsfcld
9959 real,dimension(ngptsw,1,kts:kte+1):: cldfmcl,clwpmcl,ciwpmcl,cswpmcl,taucmcl,ssacmcl,asmcmcl,fsfcmcl
9960
9961!--- additional local variables and arrays needed for the CAM ozone climatologyL
9962 real,dimension(1:noznlevels):: o3clim1d
9963
9964!--- additional local variables related to the implementation of aerosols in rrtmg_swrad in WRF 3.8.
9965! In WRF 3.8, these variables are in the argument list of subroutine rrtmg_swrad, but are made
9966! local here:
9967 integer:: aer_opt
9968 real,dimension(1,kts:kte+1,naerec):: ecaer
9969
9970!--- set trace gas volume mixing ratios, 2005 values, IPCC (2007):
9971!carbon dioxide (379 ppmv)
9972 real :: co2
9973 data co2 / 379.e-6 /
9974!methane (1774 ppbv)
9975 real :: ch4
9976 data ch4 / 1774.e-9 /
9977!nitrous oxide (319 ppbv)
9978 real :: n2o
9979 data n2o / 319.e-9 /
9980
9981!--- set oxygen volume mixing ratio (for o2mmr=0.23143):
9982 real :: o2
9983 data o2 / 0.209488 /
9984
9985!--- molecular weights and ratios for converting mmr to vmr units
9986! real :: amd ! Effective molecular weight of dry air (g/mol)
9987! real :: amw ! Molecular weight of water vapor (g/mol)
9988! real :: amo ! Molecular weight of ozone (g/mol)
9989! real :: amo2 ! Molecular weight of oxygen (g/mol)
9990! Atomic weights for conversion from mass to volume mixing ratios
9991! data amd / 28.9660 /
9992! data amw / 18.0160 /
9993! data amo / 47.9998 /
9994! data amo2 / 31.9999 /
9995
9996 real :: amdw ! Molecular weight of dry air / water vapor
9997 real :: amdo ! Molecular weight of dry air / ozone
9998 real :: amdo2 ! Molecular weight of dry air / oxygen
9999 data amdw / 1.607793 /
10000 data amdo / 0.603461 /
10001 data amdo2 / 0.905190 /
10002
10003!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10004
10005!--- all fields are ordered vertically from bottom to top (pressures are in mb):
10006 ncol = 1
10007
10008!--- initialize option for the calculation of the cloud optical properties:
10009 icld = 2 ! with clouds using maximum/random cloud overlap in subroutine mcica_subcol_lw.
10010 inflgsw = 2
10011 iceflgsw = 3
10012 liqflgsw = 1
10013
10014!--- latitude loop:
10015 j_loop: do j = jts,jte
10016
10017!--- longitude loop:
10018 i_loop: do i = its,ite
10019
10020 !--- calculate the cosine of the solar zenith angle at the current time step to determine if the sun is
10021 ! above or below the horizon (xt24 is the fractional part of simulation days plus half of radt in
10022 ! units of minutes, julian is in days, and radt is in minutes). do not call rrtmg_sw is night-time:
10023 dorrsw = .true.
10024 xt24 = mod(xtime+radt*0.5,1440.)
10025 tloctm = gmt + xt24/60. + xlong(i,j)/15.
10026 hrang = 15. * (tloctm-12.) * degrad
10027 xxlat = xlat(i,j) * degrad
10028 coszrs = sin(xxlat) * sin(declin) + cos(xxlat) * cos(declin) * cos(hrang)
10029 coszr(i,j) = coszrs
10030
10031 if (coszrs.le.0.0) dorrsw = .false.
10032
10033 if(dorrsw) then
10034
10035 !--- INITIALIZE COLUMN SOUNDING (the call to the short wave radiation code is done one column
10036 ! at a time):
10037 do k = kts, kte+1
10038 pw1d(k) = p8w(i,k,j) / 100.
10039 tw1d(k) = t8w(i,k,j)
10040 enddo
10041
10042 do k = kts, kte
10043 p1d(k) = p3d(i,k,j) / 100.
10044 dz1d(k) = dz8w(i,k,j)
10045 t1d(k) = t3d(i,k,j)
10046 qv1d(k) = amax1(qv3d(i,k,j),1.e-12)
10047 o31d(k) = 0.
10048 qc1d(k) = 0.
10049 qr1d(k) = 0.
10050 qi1d(k) = 0.
10051 qs1d(k) = 0.
10052 qg1d(k) = 0.
10053 cldfra1d(k) = 0.
10054 if(present(o33d)) o31d(k) = o33d(i,k,j)
10055 enddo
10056
10057 !--- initialize the local arrays containing the different cloud water and ice condenstates:
10058 if(icloud .gt. 0) then
10059 do k = kts,kte
10060 if(present(qc3d)) qc1d(k) = amax1(qc3d(i,k,j),0.)
10061 if(present(qr3d)) qr1d(k) = amax1(qr3d(i,k,j),0.)
10062 if(present(qi3d)) qi1d(k) = amax1(qi3d(i,k,j),0.)
10063 if(present(qs3d)) qs1d(k) = amax1(qs3d(i,k,j),0.)
10064 if((present(qc3d) .or. present(qi3d) .or. present(qs3d)) .and. present(cldfra3d)) &
10065 cldfra1d(k) = cldfra3d(i,k,j)
10066 enddo
10067 endif
10068
10069 !--- initialize the local radiative heating rate:
10070 do k = kts, kte
10071 tten1d(k) = 0.
10072 enddo
10073
10074 !--- add extra layer to include absorption between the top of the model and the top of the atmosphere:
10075 nlay = (kte-kts+1) + 1
10076
10077 !--- initialize local arrays called in the calculation of the cloud optical properties and radiative
10078 ! fluxes:
10079 do n = 1, ncol
10080 do k = kts, kte
10081 reliq(ncol,k) = 10.
10082 reice(ncol,k) = 10.
10083 resnow(ncol,k) = 10.
10084 cliqwp(ncol,k) = 0.
10085 cicewp(ncol,k) = 0.
10086 csnowp(ncol,k) = 0.
10087 enddo
10088
10089 do k = 1, nlay
10090 clwpth(n,k) = 0.
10091 ciwpth(n,k) = 0.
10092 cswpth(n,k) = 0.
10093 rel(n,k) = 0.
10094 rei(n,k) = 0.
10095 res(n,k) = 0.
10096 cldfrac(n,k) = 0.
10097 relqmcl(n,k) = 0.
10098 reicmcl(n,k) = 0.
10099 resnmcl(n,k) = 0.
10100 swuflx(n,k) = 0.
10101 swuflxc(n,k) = 0.
10102 swdflx(n,k) = 0.
10103 swdflxc(n,k) = 0.
10104 swhr(n,k) = 0.
10105 swhrc(n,k) = 0.
10106 taucld(1:nbndsw,n,k) = 0.
10107 tauaer(n,k,1:nbndsw) = 0.
10108 ssaaer(n,k,1:nbndsw) = 0.
10109 asmaer(n,k,1:nbndsw) = 0.
10110 cldfmcl(1:ngptsw,n,k) = 0.
10111 clwpmcl(1:ngptsw,n,k) = 0.
10112 ciwpmcl(1:ngptsw,n,k) = 0.
10113 cswpmcl(1:ngptsw,n,k) = 0.
10114 taucmcl(1:ngptsw,n,k) = 0.
10115 enddo
10116 do k = 1, nlay + 1
10117 sibvisdir(ncol,k) = 0.
10118 sibvisdif(ncol,k) = 0.
10119 sibnirdir(ncol,k) = 0.
10120 sibnirdif(ncol,k) = 0.
10121 swdkdir(n,k) = 0.
10122 swdkdif(n,k) = 0.
10123 enddo
10124 swuflx(n,nlay+1) = 0.
10125 swuflxc(n,nlay+1) = 0.
10126 swdflx(n,nlay+1) = 0.
10127 swdflxc(n,nlay+1) = 0.
10128 enddo
10129
10130 !--- initialization of aerosol optical properties:
10131 aer_opt = 0
10132 do n = 1, ncol
10133 do k = 1, nlay
10134 do na = 1, naerec
10135 ecaer(n,k,na) = 0.
10136 enddo
10137 enddo
10138 enddo
10139
10140 !--- fill local arrays with input sounding. convert water vapor mass mixing ratio to
10141 ! volume mixing ratio:
10142 plev(ncol,1) = pw1d(1)
10143 tlev(ncol,1) = tw1d(1)
10144 tsfc(ncol) = tsk(i,j)
10145 do k = kts, kte
10146 plev(ncol,k+1) = pw1d(k+1)
10147 tlev(ncol,k+1) = tw1d(k+1)
10148 play(ncol,k) = p1d(k)
10149 pdel(ncol,k) = plev(ncol,k) - plev(ncol,k+1)
10150 tlay(ncol,k) = t1d(k)
10151 h2ovmr(ncol,k) = qv1d(k) * amdw
10152 co2vmr(ncol,k) = co2
10153 o2vmr(ncol,k) = o2
10154 ch4vmr(ncol,k) = ch4
10155 n2ovmr(ncol,k) = n2o
10156 enddo
10157 plev(ncol,kte+2) = 1.0e-5
10158 tlev(ncol,kte+2) = tlev(ncol,kte+1) + 0.0
10159 play(ncol,kte+1) = 0.5 * plev(ncol,kte+1)
10160 tlay(ncol,kte+1) = tlev(ncol,kte+1) + 0.0
10161 h2ovmr(ncol,kte+1) = h2ovmr(ncol,kte)
10162 co2vmr(ncol,kte+1) = co2vmr(ncol,kte)
10163 o2vmr(ncol,kte+1) = o2vmr(ncol,kte)
10164 ch4vmr(ncol,kte+1) = ch4vmr(ncol,kte)
10165 n2ovmr(ncol,kte+1) = n2ovmr(ncol,kte)
10166
10167 !--- initialize the ozone voume mixing ratio:
10168 call inirad(o3mmr,plev,kts,kte)
10169 if(o3input .eq. 2) then
10170 do k = 1, noznlevels
10171 o3clim1d(k) = o3clim(i,k,j)
10172 enddo
10173 call vinterp_ozn(1,ncol,ncol,kte+1,play,pin,noznlevels,o3clim1d,o3mmr)
10174 do k = kts,kte+1
10175 o3vmr(ncol,k) = o3mmr(k)
10176 enddo
10177 else
10178 do k = kts,kte+1
10179 o3vmr(ncol,k) = o3mmr(k)*amdo
10180 enddo
10181 endif
10182
10183 !--- initialize the surface albedo:
10184 asdir(ncol) = albedo(i,j)
10185 asdif(ncol) = albedo(i,j)
10186 aldir(ncol) = albedo(i,j)
10187 aldif(ncol) = albedo(i,j)
10188
10189 !--- set solar constant:
10190 scon = solcon
10191 !--- set cosine of solar zenith angle:
10192 coszen(ncol) = coszrs
10193 !--- in MPAS, the solar constant is already provided with eccentricity adjustment, so do not do
10194 ! this here:
10195 dyofyr = 0
10196 adjes = 1.0
10197
10198
10199
10200 !--- CALCULATE CLOUD OPTICAL PROPERTIES:
10201 if(inflgsw .gt. 0) then
10202
10203 do k = kts, kte
10204 cldfrac(ncol,k) = cldfra1d(k)
10205 enddo
10206
10207 !--- zero out cloud optical properties here (not used when passing physical properties to rrtmg_sw):
10208 do k = kts, kte
10209 do nb = 1, nbndsw
10210 taucld(nb,ncol,k) = 0.0
10211 ssacld(nb,ncol,k) = 1.0
10212 asmcld(nb,ncol,k) = 0.0
10213 fsfcld(nb,ncol,k) = 0.0
10214 enddo
10215 enddo
10216
10217 pcols = ncol
10218 pver = kte - kts + 1
10219 gravmks = g
10220
10221 if(has_reqc .ne. 0) then
10222 !--- fill the effective radius for cloud water with that calculated in the Thompson cloud
10223 ! microphysics parameterization:
10224 inflgsw = 3
10225 do k = kts, kte
10226 reliq(ncol,k) = max(2.5,re_cloud(i,k,j)*1.e6)
10227 if(reliq(ncol,k).le.2.5 .and. cldfrac(ncol,k).gt.0. .and. &
10228 (xland(i,j)-1.5).gt.0.) then !--- ocean.
10229 reliq(ncol,k) = 10.5
10230 elseif(reliq(ncol,k).le.2.5 .and. cldfrac(ncol,k).gt.0. .and. &
10231 (xland(i,j)-1.5).lt.0.) then !--- land.
10232 reliq(ncol,k) = 7.5
10233 endif
10234 enddo
10235
10236 else
10237
10238 !--- calculate the effective radius for cloud water in layers below the model top. we added the
10239 ! dimensions pcols, pver so that the calls to subroutines relcalc and reicalc remain the same
10240 ! as in WRF although the two dimensions are duplicate and not needed inside the subroutines:
10241 landfrac(ncol) = 2.-xland(i,j)
10242 landm(ncol) = landfrac(ncol)
10243 snowh(ncol) = 0.001*snow(i,j)
10244 icefrac(ncol) = xice(i,j)
10245
10246 call relcalc(ncol,pcols,pver,tlay,landfrac,landm,icefrac,reliq,snowh)
10247 endif
10248
10249 if(has_reqi .ne. 0) then
10250 !--- fill the effective radius for cloud ice with that calculated in the Thompson cloud
10251 ! microphysics parameterization:
10252 inflgsw = 4
10253 iceflgsw = 4
10254 do k = kts, kte
10255 reice(ncol,k) = max(5.,re_ice(i,k,j)*1.e6)
10256 if(reice(ncol,k).le.5. .and. cldfrac(ncol,k).gt.0.) then
10257 idx_rei = int(t3d(i,k,j)-179.)
10258 idx_rei = min(max(idx_rei,1),75)
10259 corr = t3d(i,k,j) - int(t3d(i,k,j))
10260 reice(ncol,k) = retab(idx_rei)*(1.-corr) + retab(idx_rei+1)*corr
10261 reice(ncol,k) = max(reice(ncol,k),5.0)
10262 endif
10263 enddo
10264
10265 else
10266
10267 !--- calculate the effective radius for cloud ice in layers below the model top, following
10268 ! Kristjansson and Mitchell. limit upper bound of reice for Fu ice parameterization and
10269 ! convert effective radius to generalized effective size (*1.0315; Fu, 1996):
10270
10271 call reicalc(ncol,pcols,pver,tlay,reice)
10272
10273 if(iceflgsw .eq. 3) then
10274 do k = kts, kte
10275 reice(ncol,k) = reice(ncol,k) * 1.0315
10276 reice(ncol,k) = min(140.0,reice(ncol,k))
10277 enddo
10278 endif
10279 endif
10280
10281 if(has_reqs .ne. 0) then
10282 !--- fill the effective radius for snow with that calculated in the Thompson cloud
10283 ! microphysics parameterization:
10284 inflgsw = 5
10285 iceflgsw = 5
10286 do k = kts, kte
10287 resnow(ncol,k) = max(10.,re_snow(i,k,j)*1.e6)
10288 enddo
10289 else
10290 do k = kts, kte
10291 resnow(ncol,k) = 10.
10292 enddo
10293 endif
10294
10295 !--- calculate the cloud liquid water path in units of g/m2 below the model top:
10296 do k = kts, kte
10297 gliqwp = qc1d(k) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 !grid box liquid water path.
10298 cliqwp(ncol,k) = gliqwp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k)) !in-cloud liquid water path.
10299 enddo
10300
10301 !--- calculate the cloud ice path in units of g/m2 below the model top:
10302 if(iceflgsw .eq. 3)then
10303 do k = kts, kte
10304 gicewp = (qi1d(k)+qs1d(k)) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 !grid box ice water path.
10305 cicewp(ncol,k) = gicewp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k)) !in-cloud ice water path.
10306 enddo
10307 elseif(iceflgsw .ge. 4) then
10308 do k = kts, kte
10309 gicewp = qi1d(k) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 !grid box ice water path.
10310 cicewp(ncol,k) = gicewp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k)) !in-cloud ice water path.
10311 enddo
10312 endif
10313
10314 !--- calculate the snow path in units of g/m2 below the model top:
10315 if(iceflgsw.eq.5)then
10316 do k = kts, kte
10317 snow_mass_factor = 1.0
10318 if(resnow(ncol,k) .gt. 130.)then
10319 snow_mass_factor = (130.0/resnow(ncol,k))*(130.0/resnow(ncol,k))
10320 resnow(ncol,k) = 130.0
10321 endif
10322 gsnowp = qs1d(k) * pdel(ncol,k)*100.0 / gravmks * 1000.0 !grid box snow path.
10323 csnowp(ncol,k) = snow_mass_factor * gsnowp / max(0.01,cldfrac(ncol,k))
10324 enddo
10325 endif
10326
10327 !--- set the cloud physical property between the model top and the top of the atmosphere.
10328 ! do not allow clouds between the model top and the top of the atmosphere:
10329 do k = kts, kte
10330 clwpth(ncol,k) = cliqwp(ncol,k)
10331 ciwpth(ncol,k) = cicewp(ncol,k)
10332 cswpth(ncol,k) = csnowp(ncol,k)
10333 rel(ncol,k) = reliq(ncol,k)
10334 rei(ncol,k) = reice(ncol,k)
10335 res(ncol,k) = resnow(ncol,k)
10336 enddo
10337 !---- no clouds are allowed in the extra layer from model top to TOA:
10338 clwpth(ncol,kte+1) = 0.
10339 ciwpth(ncol,kte+1) = 0.
10340 cswpth(ncol,kte+1) = 0.
10341 rel(ncol,kte+1) = 10.
10342 rei(ncol,kte+1) = 10.
10343 res(ncol,kte+1) = 10.
10344 cldfrac(ncol,kte+1) = 0.
10345 do nb = 1, nbndsw
10346 taucld(nb,ncol,kte+1) = 0.
10347 ssacld(nb,ncol,kte+1) = 1.
10348 asmcld(nb,ncol,kte+1) = 0.
10349 fsfcld(nb,ncol,kte+1) = 0.
10350 enddo
10351
10352 endif
10353
10354 !--- sub-column generator for McICA:
10355 iplon = 1
10356 irng = 0
10357 permuteseed = 1
10358
10359 call mcica_subcol_sw &
10360 (iplon , ncol , nlay , icld , permuteseed , irng , play , &
10361 cldfrac , ciwpth , clwpth , cswpth , rei , rel , res , &
10362 taucld , ssacld , asmcld , fsfcld , cldfmcl , ciwpmcl , clwpmcl , &
10363 cswpmcl , reicmcl , relqmcl , resnmcl , taucmcl , ssacmcl , asmcmcl , &
10364 fsfcmcl)
10365
10366 !--- initialization of aerosol optical properties:
10367 do nb = 1, nbndsw
10368 do k = kts, kte+1
10369 tauaer(ncol,k,nb) = 0.
10370 ssaaer(ncol,k,nb) = 1.
10371 asmaer(ncol,k,nb) = 0.
10372 enddo
10373 enddo
10374
10375 do na = 1, naerec
10376 do k = kts, kte+1
10377 ecaer(ncol,k,na) = 0.
10378 enddo
10379 enddo
10380
10381
10382
10383 !--- CALL TO THE RRTMG SHORT WAVE RADIATION MODEL:
10384 call rrtmg_sw &
10385 (ncol , nlay , icld , play , plev , tlay , &
10386 tlev , tsfc , h2ovmr , o3vmr , co2vmr , ch4vmr , &
10387 n2ovmr , o2vmr , asdir , asdif , aldir , aldif , &
10388 coszen , adjes , dyofyr , scon , inflgsw , iceflgsw , &
10389 liqflgsw , cldfmcl , taucmcl , ssacmcl , asmcmcl , fsfcmcl , &
10390 ciwpmcl , clwpmcl , cswpmcl , reicmcl , relqmcl , resnmcl , &
10391 tauaer , ssaaer , asmaer , ecaer , swuflx , swdflx , &
10392 swhr , swuflxc , swdflxc , swhrc , &
10393 aer_opt , &
10394 sibvisdir , sibvisdif , sibnirdir , sibnirdif , & !added for ssib coupling.
10395 swdkdir , swdkdif)
10396
10397 !--- OUTPUTS:
10398 gsw(i,j) = swdflx(1,1) - swuflx(1,1)
10399 swcf(i,j) = (swdflx(1,kte+2)-swuflx(1,kte+2)) - (swdflxc(1,kte+2)-swuflxc(1,kte+2))
10400
10401 if(present(swupt)) then
10402 !output up and down toa fluxes for total and clear sky:
10403 swupt(i,j) = swuflx(1,kte+2)
10404 swuptc(i,j) = swuflxc(1,kte+2)
10405 swdnt(i,j) = swdflx(1,kte+2)
10406 swdntc(i,j) = swdflxc(1,kte+2)
10407 !output up and down surface fluxes for total and clear sky:
10408 swupb(i,j) = swuflx(1,1)
10409 swupbc(i,j) = swuflxc(1,1)
10410 swdnb(i,j) = swdflx(1,1)
10411 swdnbc(i,j) = swdflxc(1,1)
10412 endif
10413
10414 if(present (swupflx)) then
10415 do k = kts, kte+2
10416 swupflx(i,k,j) = swuflx(1,k)
10417 swupflxc(i,k,j) = swuflxc(1,k)
10418 swdnflx(i,k,j) = swdflx(1,k)
10419 swdnflxc(i,k,j) = swdflxc(1,k)
10420 enddo
10421 endif
10422
10423 !--- output heating rate tendency; convert heating rate from K/d to K/s:
10424 do k = kts, kte
10425 tten1d(k) = swhr(ncol,k)/86400.
10426 rthratensw(i,k,j) = tten1d(k)/pi3d(i,k,j)
10427 enddo
10428
10429 else
10430
10431 if(present(swupt)) then
10432 !output up and down toa fluxes for total and clear sky:
10433 swupt(i,j) = 0.
10434 swuptc(i,j) = 0.
10435 swdnt(i,j) = 0.
10436 swdntc(i,j) = 0.
10437 !output up and down surface fluxes for total and clear sky:
10438 swupb(i,j) = 0.
10439 swupbc(i,j) = 0.
10440 swdnb(i,j) = 0.
10441 swdnbc(i,j) = 0.
10442 endif
10443
10444 endif
10445
10446 end do i_loop !end longitude loop.
10447
10448 end do j_loop !end latitude loop.
10449
10450 end subroutine rrtmg_swrad
10451
10452!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10453
10454!ldf (2013-03-11): This section of the module is moved to module_physics_rrtmg_swinit.F in
10455!./../core_physics to accomodate differences in the mpi calls between WRF and MPAS.I thought
10456!that it would be cleaner to do this instead of adding a lot of #ifdef statements throughout
10457!the initialization of the shortwave radiation code. Initialization is handled the same way
10458!for the longwave radiation code.
10459
10460#if !(defined(mpas))
10461
10462!====================================================================
10463 SUBROUTINE rrtmg_swinit( &
10464 allowed_to_read , &
10465 ids, ide, jds, jde, kds, kde, &
10466 ims, ime, jms, jme, kms, kme, &
10467 its, ite, jts, jte, kts, kte )
10468!--------------------------------------------------------------------
10469 IMPLICIT NONE
10470!--------------------------------------------------------------------
10471
10472 LOGICAL , INTENT(IN) :: allowed_to_read
10473 INTEGER , INTENT(IN) :: ids, ide, jds, jde, kds, kde, &
10474 ims, ime, jms, jme, kms, kme, &
10475 its, ite, jts, jte, kts, kte
10476
10477! Read in absorption coefficients and other data
10478 IF ( allowed_to_read ) THEN
10479 CALL rrtmg_swlookuptable
10480 ENDIF
10481
10482! Perform g-point reduction and other initializations
10483! Specific heat of dry air (cp) used in flux to heating rate conversion factor.
10484 call rrtmg_sw_ini(cp)
10485
10486 END SUBROUTINE rrtmg_swinit
10487
10488
10489! **************************************************************************
10490 SUBROUTINE rrtmg_swlookuptable
10491! **************************************************************************
10492
10493IMPLICIT NONE
10494
10495! Local
10496 INTEGER :: i
10497 LOGICAL :: opened
10498 LOGICAL , EXTERNAL :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
10499
10500 CHARACTER*80 errmess
10501 INTEGER rrtmg_unit
10502
10503 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) THEN
10504 DO i = 10,99
10505 inquire ( i , opened = opened )
10506 IF ( .NOT. opened ) THEN
10507 rrtmg_unit = i
10508 GOTO 2010
10509 ENDIF
10510 ENDDO
10511 rrtmg_unit = -1
10512 2010 CONTINUE
10513 ENDIF
10514 CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( rrtmg_unit , iwordsize )
10515 IF ( rrtmg_unit < 0 ) THEN
10516 CALL wrf_error_fatal ( 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: rrtm_swlookuptable: Can not '// &
10517 'find unused fortran unit to read in lookup table.' )
10518 ENDIF
10519
10520 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) THEN
10521 OPEN(rrtmg_unit,file='RRTMG_SW_DATA', &
10522 form='UNFORMATTED',status='OLD',err=9009)
10523 ENDIF
10524
10525 call sw_kgb16(rrtmg_unit)
10526 call sw_kgb17(rrtmg_unit)
10527 call sw_kgb18(rrtmg_unit)
10528 call sw_kgb19(rrtmg_unit)
10529 call sw_kgb20(rrtmg_unit)
10530 call sw_kgb21(rrtmg_unit)
10531 call sw_kgb22(rrtmg_unit)
10532 call sw_kgb23(rrtmg_unit)
10533 call sw_kgb24(rrtmg_unit)
10534 call sw_kgb25(rrtmg_unit)
10535 call sw_kgb26(rrtmg_unit)
10536 call sw_kgb27(rrtmg_unit)
10537 call sw_kgb28(rrtmg_unit)
10538 call sw_kgb29(rrtmg_unit)
10539
10540 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) CLOSE (rrtmg_unit)
10541
10542 RETURN
105439009 CONTINUE
10544 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error opening RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
10545 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
10546
10547 END SUBROUTINE rrtmg_swlookuptable
10548
10549! **************************************************************************
10550! RRTMG Shortwave Radiative Transfer Model
10551! Atmospheric and Environmental Research, Inc., Cambridge, MA
10552!
10553! Original by J.Delamere, Atmospheric & Environmental Research.
10554! Reformatted for F90: JJMorcrette, ECMWF
10555! Revision for GCMs: Michael J. Iacono, AER, July 2002
10556! Further F90 reformatting: Michael J. Iacono, AER, June 2006
10557!
10558! This file contains 14 READ statements that include the
10559! absorption coefficients and other data for each of the 14 shortwave
10560! spectral bands used in RRTMG_SW. Here, the data are defined for 16
10561! g-points, or sub-intervals, per band. These data are combined and
10562! weighted using a mapping procedure in module RRTMG_SW_INIT to reduce
10563! the total number of g-points from 224 to 112 for use in the GCM.
10564! **************************************************************************
10565
10566! **************************************************************************
10567 subroutine sw_kgb16(rrtmg_unit)
10568! **************************************************************************
10569
10570 use rrsw_kg16, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
10571 rayl, strrat1, layreffr
10572
10573 implicit none
10574 save
10575
10576! Input
10577 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
10578
10579! Local
10580 character*80 errmess
10581 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
10582
10583! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
10584
10585! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at v = 2925 cm-1.
10586
10587! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10588! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
10589! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
10590! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
10591! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
10592! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
10593! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
10594! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
10595! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
10596! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
10597! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
10598! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
10599! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
10600! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
10601! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10602
10603! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10604! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
10605! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
10606! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
10607! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
10608! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
10609! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
10610! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
10611! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
10612! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
10613! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10614
10615! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10616! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
10617! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
10618! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
10619! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10620
10621! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10622! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
10623! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
10624! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
10625! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10626
10627#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
10628#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
10629#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
10630
10631 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
10632 rayl, strrat1, layreffr, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
10633 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
10634 dm_bcast_real(strrat1)
10635 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
10636 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
10637 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
10638 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
10639 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
10640 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
10641
10642 RETURN
106439010 CONTINUE
10644 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
10645 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
10646
10647 end subroutine sw_kgb16
10648
10649! **************************************************************************
10650 subroutine sw_kgb17(rrtmg_unit)
10651! **************************************************************************
10652
10653 use rrsw_kg17, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
10654 rayl, strrat, layreffr
10655
10656 implicit none
10657 save
10658
10659! Input
10660 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
10661
10662! Local
10663 character*80 errmess
10664 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
10665
10666! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
10667
10668! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at v = 3625 cm-1.
10669
10670! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10671! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
10672! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
10673! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
10674! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
10675! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
10676! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
10677! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
10678! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
10679! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
10680! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
10681! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
10682! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
10683! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
10684! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10685
10686! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10687! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
10688! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
10689! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
10690! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
10691! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
10692! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
10693! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
10694! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
10695! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
10696! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10697
10698! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10699! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
10700! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
10701! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
10702! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10703
10704! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10705! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
10706! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
10707! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
10708! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10709
10710#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
10711#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
10712#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
10713
10714 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
10715 rayl, strrat, layreffr, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
10716 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
10717 dm_bcast_real(strrat)
10718 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
10719 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
10720 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
10721 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
10722 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
10723 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
10724
10725 RETURN
107269010 CONTINUE
10727 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
10728 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
10729
10730 end subroutine sw_kgb17
10731
10732! **************************************************************************
10733 subroutine sw_kgb18(rrtmg_unit)
10734! **************************************************************************
10735
10736 use rrsw_kg18, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
10737 rayl, strrat, layreffr
10738
10739 implicit none
10740 save
10741
10742! Input
10743 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
10744
10745! Local
10746 character*80 errmess
10747 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
10748
10749! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
10750
10751! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at v = 4325 cm-1.
10752
10753! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10754! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
10755! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
10756! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
10757! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
10758! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
10759! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
10760! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
10761! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
10762! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
10763! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
10764! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
10765! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
10766! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
10767! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10768
10769! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10770! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
10771! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
10772! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
10773! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
10774! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
10775! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
10776! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
10777! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
10778! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
10779! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10780
10781! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10782! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
10783! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
10784! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
10785! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10786
10787! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10788! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
10789! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
10790! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
10791! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10792
10793#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
10794#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
10795#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
10796
10797 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
10798 rayl, strrat, layreffr, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
10799 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
10800 dm_bcast_real(strrat)
10801 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
10802 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
10803 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
10804 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
10805 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
10806 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
10807
10808 RETURN
108099010 CONTINUE
10810 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
10811 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
10812
10813 end subroutine sw_kgb18
10814
10815! **************************************************************************
10816 subroutine sw_kgb19(rrtmg_unit)
10817! **************************************************************************
10818
10819 use rrsw_kg19, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
10820 rayl, strrat, layreffr
10821
10822 implicit none
10823 save
10824
10825! Input
10826 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
10827
10828! Local
10829 character*80 errmess
10830 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
10831
10832! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
10833
10834! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at v = 4900 cm-1.
10835
10836! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10837! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
10838! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
10839! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
10840! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
10841! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
10842! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
