10843! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
10844! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
10845! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
10846! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
10847! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
10848! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
10849! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
10850! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10851
10852! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10853! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
10854! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
10855! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
10856! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
10857! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
10858! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
10859! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
10860! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
10861! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
10862! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10863
10864! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10865! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
10866! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
10867! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
10868! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10869
10870! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10871! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
10872! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
10873! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
10874! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10875
10876#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
10877#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
10878#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
10879
10880 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
10881 rayl, strrat, layreffr, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
10882 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
10883 dm_bcast_real(strrat)
10884 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
10885 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
10886 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
10887 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
10888 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
10889 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
10890
10891 RETURN
108929010 CONTINUE
10893 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
10894 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
10895
10896 end subroutine sw_kgb19
10897
10898! **************************************************************************
10899 subroutine sw_kgb20(rrtmg_unit)
10900! **************************************************************************
10901
10902 use rrsw_kg20, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
10903 absch4o, rayl, layreffr
10904
10905 implicit none
10906 save
10907
10908! Input
10909 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
10910
10911! Local
10912 character*80 errmess
10913 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
10914
10915! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
10916
10917! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at v = 5670 cm-1.
10918
10919! Array absch4o contains the absorption coefficients for methane.
10920
10921! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10922! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
10923! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
10924! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
10925! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
10926! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
10927! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
10928! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
10929! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
10930! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
10931! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
10932! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
10933! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
10934! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
10935! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10936
10937! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
10938! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
10939! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
10940! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
10941! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
10942! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
10943! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
10944! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
10945! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
10946! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
10947! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
10948
10949! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10950! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
10951! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
10952! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
10953! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10954
10955! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
10956! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
10957! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
10958! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
10959! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
10960
10961#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
10962#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
10963#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
10964
10965 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
10966 rayl, layreffr, absch4o, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
10967 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
10968 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
10969 dm_bcast_macro(absch4o)
10970 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
10971 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
10972 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
10973 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
10974 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
10975
10976 RETURN
109779010 CONTINUE
10978 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
10979 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
10980
10981 end subroutine sw_kgb20
10982
10983! **************************************************************************
10984 subroutine sw_kgb21(rrtmg_unit)
10985! **************************************************************************
10986
10987 use rrsw_kg21, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
10988 rayl, strrat, layreffr
10989
10990 implicit none
10991 save
10992
10993! Input
10994 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
10995
10996! Local
10997 character*80 errmess
10998 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
10999
11000! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11001
11002! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at v = 6925 cm-1.
11003
11004! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11005! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11006! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11007! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11008! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11009! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11010! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11011! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11012! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11013! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11014! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11015! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11016! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11017! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11018! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11019
11020! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11021! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
11022! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
11023! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
11024! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
11025! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
11026! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
11027! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
11028! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
11029! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
11030! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11031
11032! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11033! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
11034! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
11035! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
11036! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11037
11038! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11039! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
11040! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
11041! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
11042! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11043
11044#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11045#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
11046#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11047
11048 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11049 rayl, strrat, layreffr, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
11050 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
11051 dm_bcast_real(strrat)
11052 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11053 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11054 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
11055 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
11056 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
11057 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11058
11059 RETURN
110609010 CONTINUE
11061 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11062 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11063
11064 end subroutine sw_kgb21
11065
11066! **************************************************************************
11067 subroutine sw_kgb22(rrtmg_unit)
11068! **************************************************************************
11069
11070 use rrsw_kg22, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
11071 rayl, strrat, layreffr
11072
11073 implicit none
11074 save
11075
11076! Input
11077 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11078
11079! Local
11080 character*80 errmess
11081 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11082
11083! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11084
11085! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at v = 8000 cm-1.
11086
11087! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11088! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11089! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11090! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11091! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11092! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11093! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11094! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11095! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11096! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11097! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11098! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11099! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11100! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11101! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11102
11103! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11104! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
11105! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
11106! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
11107! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
11108! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
11109! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
11110! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
11111! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
11112! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
11113! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11114
11115! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11116! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
11117! index refers to reference temperature (296_rb,260_rb,224,260) and
11118! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
11119! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11120
11121! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11122! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
11123! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
11124! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
11125! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11126
11127#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11128#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
11129#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11130
11131 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11132 rayl, strrat, layreffr, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
11133 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
11134 dm_bcast_real(strrat)
11135 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11136 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11137 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
11138 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
11139 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
11140 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11141
11142 RETURN
111439010 CONTINUE
11144 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11145 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11146
11147 end subroutine sw_kgb22
11148
11149! **************************************************************************
11150 subroutine sw_kgb23(rrtmg_unit)
11151! **************************************************************************
11152
11153 use rrsw_kg23, only : kao, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
11154 raylo, givfac, layreffr
11155
11156 implicit none
11157 save
11158
11159! Input
11160 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11161
11162! Local
11163 character*80 errmess
11164 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11165
11166! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11167
11168! Array raylo contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at all v for this band
11169
11170! Array givfac is the average Giver et al. correction factor for this band.
11171
11172! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11173! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11174! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11175! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11176! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11177! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11178! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11179! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11180! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11181! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11182! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11183! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11184! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11185! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11186! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11187
11188! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11189! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
11190! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
11191! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
11192! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11193
11194! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11195! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
11196! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
11197! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
11198! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11199
11200#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11201#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
11202#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11203
11204 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11205 raylo, givfac, layreffr, kao, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
11206 dm_bcast_macro(raylo)
11207 dm_bcast_real(givfac)
11208 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11209 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11210 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
11211 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
11212 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11213
11214 RETURN
112159010 CONTINUE
11216 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11217 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11218
11219 end subroutine sw_kgb23
11220
11221! **************************************************************************
11222 subroutine sw_kgb24(rrtmg_unit)
11223! **************************************************************************
11224
11225 use rrsw_kg24, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
11226 raylao, raylbo, abso3ao, abso3bo, strrat, layreffr
11227
11228 implicit none
11229 save
11230
11231! Input
11232 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11233
11234! Local
11235 character*80 errmess
11236 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11237
11238! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11239
11240! Arrays raylao and raylbo contain the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at
11241! all v for this band for the upper and lower atmosphere.
11242
11243! Arrays abso3ao and abso3bo contain the ozone absorption coefficient at
11244! all v for this band for the upper and lower atmosphere.
11245
11246! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11247! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11248! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11249! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11250! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11251! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11252! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11253! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11254! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11255! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11256! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11257! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11258! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11259! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11260! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11261
11262! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11263! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
11264! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
11265! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
11266! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
11267! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
11268! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
11269! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
11270! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
11271! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
11272! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11273
11274! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11275! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
11276! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
11277! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
11278! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11279
11280! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11281! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
11282! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
11283! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
11284! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11285
11286#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11287#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
11288#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11289
11290 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11291 raylao, raylbo, strrat, layreffr, abso3ao, abso3bo, kao, kbo, selfrefo, &
11292 forrefo, sfluxrefo
11293 dm_bcast_macro(raylao)
11294 dm_bcast_macro(raylbo)
11295 dm_bcast_real(strrat)
11296 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11297 dm_bcast_macro(abso3ao)
11298 dm_bcast_macro(abso3bo)
11299 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11300 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
11301 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
11302 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
11303 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11304
11305 RETURN
113069010 CONTINUE
11307 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11308 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11309
11310 end subroutine sw_kgb24
11311
11312! **************************************************************************
11313 subroutine sw_kgb25(rrtmg_unit)
11314! **************************************************************************
11315
11316 use rrsw_kg25, only : kao, sfluxrefo, &
11317 raylo, abso3ao, abso3bo, layreffr
11318
11319 implicit none
11320 save
11321
11322! Input
11323 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11324
11325! Local
11326 character*80 errmess
11327 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11328
11329! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11330
11331! Array raylo contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at all v = 2925 cm-1.
11332
11333! Arrays abso3ao and abso3bo contain the ozone absorption coefficient at
11334! all v for this band for the upper and lower atmosphere.
11335
11336! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11337! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11338! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11339! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11340! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11341! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11342! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11343! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11344! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11345! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11346! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11347! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11348! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11349! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11350! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11351
11352#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11353#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11354
11355 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11356 raylo, layreffr, abso3ao, abso3bo, kao, sfluxrefo
11357 dm_bcast_macro(raylo)
11358 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11359 dm_bcast_macro(abso3ao)
11360 dm_bcast_macro(abso3bo)
11361 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11362 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11363
11364 RETURN
113659010 CONTINUE
11366 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11367 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11368
11369 end subroutine sw_kgb25
11370
11371! **************************************************************************
11372 subroutine sw_kgb26(rrtmg_unit)
11373! **************************************************************************
11374
11375 use rrsw_kg26, only : sfluxrefo, raylo
11376
11377 implicit none
11378 save
11379
11380! Input
11381 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11382
11383! Local
11384 character*80 errmess
11385 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11386
11387! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11388
11389! Array raylo contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at all v for this band.
11390
11391#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11392
11393 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,ERR=9010) &
11394 raylo, sfluxrefo
11395 dm_bcast_macro(raylo)
11396 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11397
11398 RETURN
113999010 CONTINUE
11400 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11401 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11402
11403 end subroutine sw_kgb26
11404
11405! **************************************************************************
11406 subroutine sw_kgb27(rrtmg_unit)
11407! **************************************************************************
11408
11409 use rrsw_kg27, only : kao, kbo, sfluxrefo, raylo, &
11410 scalekur, layreffr
11411
11412 implicit none
11413 save
11414
11415! Input
11416 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11417
11418! Local
11419 character*80 errmess
11420 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11421
11422! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11423! The values in array sfluxrefo were obtained using the "low resolution"
11424! version of the Kurucz solar source function. For unknown reasons,
11425! the total irradiance in this band differs from the corresponding
11426! total in the "high-resolution" version of the Kurucz function.
11427! Therefore, these values are scaled by the factor SCALEKUR.
11428
11429! Array raylo contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at all v = 2925 cm-1.
11430
11431! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11432! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11433! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11434! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11435! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11436! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11437! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11438! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11439! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11440! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11441! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11442! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11443! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11444! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11445! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11446
11447! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11448! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
11449! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
11450! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
11451! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
11452! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
11453! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
11454! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
11455! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
11456! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
11457! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11458
11459#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11460#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
11461#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11462
11463 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11464 raylo, scalekur, layreffr, kao, kbo, sfluxrefo
11465 dm_bcast_macro(raylo)
11466 dm_bcast_real(scalekur)
11467 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11468 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11469 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
11470 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11471
11472 RETURN
114739010 CONTINUE
11474 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11475 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11476
11477 end subroutine sw_kgb27
11478
11479! **************************************************************************
11480 subroutine sw_kgb28(rrtmg_unit)
11481! **************************************************************************
11482
11483 use rrsw_kg28, only : kao, kbo, sfluxrefo, &
11484 rayl, strrat, layreffr
11485
11486 implicit none
11487 save
11488
11489! Input
11490 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11491
11492! Local
11493 character*80 errmess
11494 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11495
11496! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11497
11498! Array raylo contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at all v = ???? cm-1.
11499
11500! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11501! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11502! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11503! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11504! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11505! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11506! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11507! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11508! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11509! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11510! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11511! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11512! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11513! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11514! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11515
11516! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11517! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
11518! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
11519! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
11520! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
11521! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
11522! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
11523! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
11524! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
11525! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
11526! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11527
11528#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11529#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
11530#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11531
11532 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11533 rayl, strrat, layreffr, kao, kbo, sfluxrefo
11534 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
11535 dm_bcast_real(strrat)
11536 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11537 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11538 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
11539 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11540
11541 RETURN
115429010 CONTINUE
11543 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11544 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11545
11546 end subroutine sw_kgb28
11547
11548! **************************************************************************
11549 subroutine sw_kgb29(rrtmg_unit)
11550! **************************************************************************
11551
11552 use rrsw_kg29, only : kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo, &
11553 absh2oo, absco2o, rayl, layreffr
11554
11555 implicit none
11556 save
11557
11558! Input
11559 integer, intent(in) :: rrtmg_unit
11560
11561! Local
11562 character*80 errmess
11563 logical, external :: wrf_dm_on_monitor
11564
11565! Array sfluxrefo contains the Kurucz solar source function for this band.
11566
11567! Array rayl contains the Rayleigh extinction coefficient at all v = 2200 cm-1.
11568
11569! Array absh2oo contains the water vapor absorption coefficient for this band.
11570
11571! Array absco2o contains the carbon dioxide absorption coefficient for this band.
11572
11573! The array KAO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11574! for a range of pressure levels> ~100mb, temperatures, and binary
11575! species parameters (see taumol.f for definition). The first
11576! index in the array, JS, runs from 1 to 9, and corresponds to
11577! different values of the binary species parameter. For instance,
11578! JS=1 refers to dry air, JS = 2 corresponds to the paramter value 1/8,
11579! JS = 3 corresponds to the parameter value 2/8, etc. The second index
11580! in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to different
11581! temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the data are for
11582! the reference temperature TREF for this pressure level, JT = 2 refers
11583! to TREF-15, JT = 1 is for TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5
11584! is for TREF+30. The third index, JP, runs from 1 to 13 and refers
11585! to the JPth reference pressure level (see taumol.f for these levels
11586! in mb). The fourth index, IG, goes from 1 to 16, and indicates
11587! which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11588
11589! The array KBO contains absorption coefs at the 16 chosen g-values
11590! for a range of pressure levels < ~100mb and temperatures. The first
11591! index in the array, JT, which runs from 1 to 5, corresponds to
11592! different temperatures. More specifically, JT = 3 means that the
11593! data are for the reference temperature TREF for this pressure
11594! level, JT = 2 refers to the temperature TREF-15, JT = 1 is for
11595! TREF-30, JT = 4 is for TREF+15, and JT = 5 is for TREF+30.
11596! The second index, JP, runs from 13 to 59 and refers to the JPth
11597! reference pressure level (see taumol.f for the value of these
11598! pressure levels in mb). The third index, IG, goes from 1 to 16,
11599! and tells us which g-interval the absorption coefficients are for.
11600
11601! The array FORREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11602! foreign-continuum (including the energy term). The first
11603! index refers to reference temperature (296,260,224,260) and
11604! pressure (970,475,219,3 mbar) levels. The second index
11605! runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11606
11607! The array SELFREFO contains the coefficient of the water vapor
11608! self-continuum (including the energy term). The first index
11609! refers to temperature in 7.2 degree increments. For instance,
11610! JT = 1 refers to a temperature of 245.6, JT = 2 refers to 252.8,
11611! etc. The second index runs over the g-channel (1 to 16).
11612
11613#define DM_BCAST_MACRO(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_bytes ( A , size ( A ) * RWORDSIZE )
11614#define DM_BCAST_REAL(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_real ( A , 1 )
11615#define DM_BCAST_INTEGER(A) CALL wrf_dm_bcast_integer ( A , 1 )
11616
11617 IF ( wrf_dm_on_monitor() ) READ (rrtmg_unit,err=9010) &
11618 rayl, layreffr, absh2oo, absco2o, kao, kbo, selfrefo, forrefo, sfluxrefo
11619 dm_bcast_real(rayl)
11620 dm_bcast_integer(layreffr)
11621 dm_bcast_macro(absh2oo)
11622 dm_bcast_macro(absco2o)
11623 dm_bcast_macro(kao)
11624 dm_bcast_macro(kbo)
11625 dm_bcast_macro(selfrefo)
11626 dm_bcast_macro(forrefo)
11627 dm_bcast_macro(sfluxrefo)
11628
11629 RETURN
116309010 CONTINUE
11631 WRITE( errmess , '(A,I4)' ) 'module_ra_rrtmg_sw: error reading RRTMG_SW_DATA on unit ',rrtmg_unit
11632 CALL wrf_error_fatal(errmess)
11633
11634 end subroutine sw_kgb29
11635
11636!------------------------------------------------------------------
11637
11638#endif
11639!ldf end (2013-03-11).
11640
11641END MODULE module_ra_rrtmg_sw
